While this shirt fit the 'cat crazy' requirement and the arms were incredibly comfortable, the hi-lo style is a bit extreme. The front portion sits right at belly button level (lifting and showing a good portion of tummy when arms are raised) and the back resembles a randomly long flap.Back it went in exchange for a larger size. Usually these sizes "7-16" run towards larger, but not this tee!!

I ordered these for my Keurig, as I thought the price was unbeatable. Well, it was definitely too good to be true. The filters work ok; I have yet to see any major difference in performance between this brand and the Keurig name brand. However these Crucial Coffee filters were packed individually in clear plastic, and then MORE plastic that wrapped the pair. The low price is worth it since these need to be switched every few weeks, however I think I'll keep an eye out at my local store for any Keurig filters on sale...

Victoria's Secret ran this PINK gift with purchase promotion twice in the last few months and I was able to snag a blanket in each of the offered colors. The stadium blanket is machine washable, line dries, and is incredibly warm and comfy!! Yes it's thin, but it folds small and is super packable. I recently took this blanket on a plane trip, and was definitely glad I did.  The "retail" of thirty-nine ninety-five is a joke, as these are definitely worth ten bucks or so.  But free?!?  Heck yeah, these were absolutely getting and the teal is my absolute favorite by far! :)VS runs these promos all the time, and they're pretty good about sending a preview email or updating the promo calendar on the PINK Nation app. Happy shopping, all!

My favorite tumbler of all, as the PINK branding is very small and discreet amid the pinapples.  Holds a full 24 fluid ounces, mine was shipped with a matching pink straw and a clear stopper.  I bought this directly from VS (so no decal), at about eight bucks, during the semi annual sale. Great way to hydrate!!

This tumbler was the July freebie for Victoria's Secret Pink.  The retail sticker states nineteen dollars, but the tumbler is really worth maybe about half that amount.  The cup holds a full 24 fluid ounces, and has a clear straw and stopper.  These cups are great for hydrating throughout the day, as well as for gift giving. The mini dog is super cute and truly mini at about 4 inches.  The direct instore and online gwp tumblers also included a scan card for that app good for another free gift (anything from a giftcard to % off PINK items to free undies {most were free undies}). Love these tumblers and PINK freebies!!!

Hubby ordered a pair of these chino shorts for the summer, and he looks great in them.  Seriously, not that I'm being a super nice wife, the fit looks like it would look good on just about any male body type - pockets are well placed and the seams are well proportioned and not darted. Inseam is the right length, fits perfectly at the knee so no comfort issues when sitting, driving, walking, etc.  The only complaint is the back pockets - if you're the type to store your wallet in your pocket, definitely use the button to close otherwise the wallet doesn't stay in place.  Also, one of the pockets is double lined for storing a card or a money clip.My husband ordered a pair of these chino shorts directly from the Levi's website (full price, % off, free shipping), and frankly he should have just bought here on Amazon as they are almost half the retail price.  Buy these, guys!!

These are truly a great option for any age! I'm almost on my third decade of needing these 'necessities,' and I am a huge believer in the Always Infinity line.  The teen version is cheerful (definitely a major plus), works just as well as any other Infinity product, and is perfect for those inbetween or late-course days.  The quantity lasts a couple months, for light use.

These classic fit Monroe's are a nice lightweight denim. True to size, there are NOT the 'slimtastic lift and slim fit' that is found in other Lee jeans. However, the straightleg flatters the leg and bottom no matter how curvy. The paisley pattern is interesting enough to be it's own statement with a plain tee or blouse, heels or wedges or boots (can't wait for Winter again!).  Good price, cute jeans, great buy!

These Tide Booster wash add-ins are helpful for those inbetween times (watered down detergent, not wanting to use bleach, when traveling, etc).  Clothes do seem brighter, however I tend to overload the drum so that may be my problem right there. However, these are expensive and having read that some folks use two discs for one load of whites (which I fully believe, since some of my socks were just as dingy grey)... that just seems excessive since a small dash of bleach would work just as well. I may pick up another pack if it's on sale, but unfortunately this isn't a must-buy on my list.

Talk about a glass slipper! I've been on a OGX kick because of their amazing scents and fair prices. The other formulas just didn't do all that for my hair. Lo and behold came this Awapuhi Ginger in the mail... Reminded me of back in the day when I would steal a bit of my mom's Nexxus or Paul Mitchell.My hair is cleaner longer (honestly, it still looks super shiny even 12 hrs after washing), my tangles and frizzies are way more under control, and there is a major reduction in split ends. This also seems to have helped ease my dry scalp.  Great shampoo and conditioner, great price, delivers on promises... This is DEFINITELY a keeper on my s&s list!

I purchased this pillow last Fall at Macy's during a sale (about half the current price).  At first I loved the cover and design - very polished, looked great, and slept pretty good for a while.  Then after a few weeks the fill just went flat.  I had to go to Target to get something decent I could sleep on!  I now use this pillow for my decorative sham.  Flat and out of shape quickly... Save your money and buy something better - you deserve it!

I recently ordered this set directly from Macy's and I'm in love!  For just thirty-five bucks, I received three cute and deliciously fragrant (from light to intense) pencils plus a sharpener, all in a lovely gift box.  Also qualified for a Lilly Pulitzer gift with purchase!  So pretty, makes a great gift for yourself or a loved one (Mom's Day and graduations are just around the corner!).  This is a Macy's limited edition/exclusive, and Macy's dot com states the set retails for forty-nine dollars.

I picked up a few boxes of these Special K Almond Honey Oat Granola (yes, that is the ENTIRE name) bars during a sale for two bucks at my local Kroger.  If it wasn't for the sale and the fact that I needed KFR codes, I probably would have passed on these. My kids didn't seem to like these, and they are big eaters of various granola and trail mixes. Personally, I think the bars taste pretty good - just enough crunch, not too sweet with just 7 grams of sugar. Great for a quick mini breakfast, throwing in the purse when on the go, running errands, or for those long trips.Not the best option for those with pickier tastes, and definitely NOT worth paying top dollar.  But a good choice when offered at a fair price.

Organix Sea Mineral Moisture is very much a "spa" experience offering a nicely foamy lather and rich sea scent.  My hair looks great after my usual two washes per shower - super strong, super shiny, and very much under control (see ya, frizzies!).  However, the scent can be a little overwhelming especially when combined with the conditioner.  And even though these minerals are ideal for dry scalp, I unfortunately still have build up after a few days of use (have to use a different product for a day or two, then return to using Mineral Moisture).For those who are new to Organix/OGX, the hair products are SLS free but are NOT 100% organic or all natural.  Also shop around for the best price.  I picked up a few bottles during a great sale at my local Kroger.

This Organix (OGX) Coconut Water shampoo is indeed weightless.  The fragrance is mild, but still noticeable.  This product is NOT organic nor is it even remotely all natural.  However it is SLS free, cleanses very well (after two shampoos each time, in my case), leaves very little build-up (important for my chronically dry scalp) and is a great fairly priced alternative to more expensive brands.  I purchased this particular formula at Ulta, great deal when combining the coupon they offer!

What a bargain!  Disney branded Crocs, plus they glow in the dark??!?! Sold!! I ordered these not realizing the fit is extremely generous, almost a full size bigger. Definitely order a size down if you can, otherwise your kiddo can grown into these and have them for a while! Colorful, fun, and great for either gender.  :)

I ordered these to replace my girl's water sandals that she has since grown out of. Love the fun, bright colors. However, I ordered a size 3 and they fit like a normal size 2 so these are definitely snug. If your child is a half size, do not hesitate in ordering up! Also, there is no strap or buckle or velcro or nuthin' on these - one end simply lifts up so your kid's foot can slide in.  Not the most ingenious method and certainly not the most long-lasting (I can easily see this part ripping in the future), however it will definitely save time when we're in a rush.An absolute steal at the current price for brand name water sandals. But deducting a full star because of the sizing issue and lack of buckle/strap.

3.5 starsLast year Gillette Venus marketed a purple lower priced "starter"/basic Venus razor towards the teen/college set, and now offers this cute and compact Venus Snap.  The Snap *looks* like a fun, travel friendly, convenient product. But is it worth it...?No, not really. At big box stores, the retail is nine ninety-nine (slightly less at about nine-fifty at my local Walmart). I combined a manufacturer coupon plus a rewards card e-coupon at my local Kroger to get this down to just a few dollars - definitely worth the price for just the blade alone. The chunky handle is somewhat difficult to control - I kept holding on to the razor release and was afraid it would pop out! After a week I ended up switching to the normal Venus handle, and I felt the longer handle was easier to maneuver.  I also realized that the Venus handles have a notch about 1/3 of the way down from the razor, where I usually grip on to.  So after years and years of using my razor this way, no wonder the Snap felt strange! The shave itself was alright, but for some reason didn't seem as close as when using the normal sized handle (even with the exact same blade). Anyhow, the blue compact is a nice touch especially since the vents allow the razor to air out.Overall this is a tremendously marked-up price for a "cute" product. Definitely worth purchasing if on sale, or you have a coupon (be on the look out for  Gillette promos here on Amazon) or perhaps in a gift set. But otherwise, meh... You would be better off getting a full sized Venus razor for less.

My 30-something year old skin has developed serious dryness issues, especially during the winter months. The low price of this wash was a great incentive, but ultimately the mid-range rating on Good Guide (dot com) of 5.8 made me want to try this product. These days I'm big on what goes in and ON my body, so the fact that the ingredients in this creamy soap are for the most part safe is extremely important. Also important is the fact that it delivers on its moisturizing promises!My skin is now more supple and needs much less lotion during the course of the day, and my back (you know the spot I'm talking about) is much less dry and itchy. This also works great as a shaving cream. Yes, as the body wash formula includes Olay facial moisturizer, this smells like goopy "old lady soap."  Meaning it smells formulaic, but not necessarily perfume-y like most heavily scented body washes on the market. The lather is so-so: use a few drops on a loofa, then repeat if necessary for more bubbles.With stacking a coupon + subscribe and save, I was able to try Olay Age Defying body wash for just under two bucks. Definitely worth that cost, as this is a small bottle (in fact, the smaller 13.5 oz size is a good thing as no wash goes to waste AND the bottle easily fits in the shower). Not exactly "age defying," but it cleans and moisturizes wonderfully.

I recently managed to snag a few of these sets on clearance at B&N.com for just under five bucks each.  The game is super fun, more portable and travel friendly than the majority of board games out there, great for ALL Adventure Time fans young and old (cute watching my toddler with my husband 'battle' at Memory), and this specific set leaves all other Memory sets in the dust!  The retail price is unfortunate, as the less "deluxe" Memory sets cost a fraction of that.  BUT this awesome Adventure Time game on clearance?  Heck yeah!!  :^)

I was so excited to get these refillable pouches. They are super easy to fill and clean  I make my own baby food and hated carrying the jars ... this is much better to travel with.  Also, they are easy for little ones trying to learn how to feed themselves ...I use them on my three year old since he often asks for a snack on the go and I can fill it with healthy alternatives. Hee, hee, I will never confess that I may have used it myself when on long trips for yogurt.  It does make eating healthy on the go convenient. It is a heck of a lot healthier than that junky fast food too. My little one loves to help me make a layered yogurt in the pouch with plain Greek yogurt and different jellies or jams. I was thinking even if you have a picky kid like some of my friends, these would be great because they can see exactly what they are eating so I think less resistance.  I love these all around and there a so many benefits, cost savings, healthy eating, and earth friendly.  A++++ all around and I will be buying many more.

I needed a charging cable for my phone. It had to be long enough for work and it had to be thin to be able to fit between the wall and my cubicle. This was perfect! It charged my phone with no problem and I was even able to download content for backup. I give it a high recomendation because of the quality and that I have not had a problem for weeks. My husband bought another one for the car. It threads perfectly in the console.

I love to cook and I am always looking for tools to help me complete dishes. I have owned sooo many julienne tools and they work fine but either they are too expensive, are poor quality, or stop working after a while. The quality of this product is incredible and I have used mine for everything! I recently did some shrimp spring rolls and they were a must. Everything came out perfect and they looked professional. It is so easy to clean too. I forgot to mention that I use it to garnish my dishes. Wish I could share pictures of my creations with just these two tools. My SIL loved it so much because she is on a vegetarian diet ..she gave me so many recipie recomendations ... needless to say, I got her one and she was SUPER excited. A++++ all around

Firstly, the packaging is high quality and it included everything necessary to successfully install and re-install this protector if needed. You get a sheet of stickers (Two for dust removal and two more for screen protector removal if you need to re-position), a micro-fiber cloth, an alcohol wipe, and instructions for installation.There will be an area all around the side of this protector where your iPhone bezel will be unprotected. This is due to Apple's decision to make the screen curved as opposed to flat like in generations past. I personally do not like this choice, but hey it's not my choice to make, lol!As a positive side effect, since the protector does not go all the way to the edge, you should be good to use just about any case for the new iPhone with worry of the glass protector getting in the way.Overall, I highly recommend this protector for the price and say to those who believe the protector doesn't fit....wake up, realize that glass isn't flexible and go get your orange peeling plastic protectors if you want something to fully cover the top of the phone! :)

If you're wondering, yes the product works with both iPod 5g and iPhone 5 (and most likely 5s)and from what it seems it will fit previous generations but it wont be as snug a fit as the 5th gen models. Now on to the product, I'm a Weight lifter and i occasionally run (2-3 days a week) for prolonged periods of time (2-3 miles) and i can say from using this for a week and a half this is the best arm band I've ever used. Its so durable, it fits my arm and then some, and on top of that it has a key holder, which i use to keep a few dollars to buy water if i need it, very handy. The Velcro is tough and dose not get loose, there were times where i purposely tried to see how much force it took for it to come off my arm, and the only way to get it off was by removing it myself, so its very tough. The Item Arrived on time and is exactly what I ordered. I'm planning on finally getting an iPhone 5 next month and all I have now is an iPod 5g and it fits like a glove, and when I get my iPhone 5 I can just swap out my iPod for my iPhone 5. For the price this is a no brainer, one the most highest quality iPod/iPhone arm band I've ever used, I wouldn't be surprised if the price went up, the quality is top-tier and rivals the other(more expensive) products on amazon.IF YOU LIKE MUSIC WHEN YOU'RE WORKING OUT, IF YOU LIKE TO CARY YOUR IPHONE WHILE YOU RUN BUT HATE HOW IT JERKS AROUND IN YOUR POCKETS DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND BUY THIS YOU WONT REGRET IT!!

We'd previously been using some of the old-style roller shades that attach with suction cups. These do work... for a while, until the glass gets dusty or oily, or something (i.e. a power window being lowered) bumps them loose. Then more often than not, they never work again.I also found that these simply refused to stick to the sharply inclined rear windshield. They're also a pain to remove when you want to, and don't cover very much area. Half the time we tried to retract them, the cups would come loose and fall off altogether.These use the same material as screen protectors, and that makes way too much sense. They don't have adhesive, but it almost seems that way when you stick them on a window. They're light and don't fall off even sharply inclined glass (you could even put it on a moonroof if you wanted) and they're easy to remove. .On a safety side, they're also light enough that they won't kill anyone if turned into projectiles. Overall, it's a major improvement and they're cheap to boot. Can't really find anything to complain about here.

Big cubes are the latest trend in high-end cocktail bars because of their slower melt rate (less surface area) and curious look.I have found that people have many uses included:Freezing and Storing Homemade Baby FoodFreezing a bit of wine that you have left in the bottle for a future food recipeHomemade Soaps and even Homemade CandlesPeople Freeze Coffee and/or Chocolate and stick it in their morning iced coffee so you don't water it downJELLO SHOTSFreezing Hot Chocolate with Marshmallows on top of themAlso, something I would have never thought of is to Freeze Water with some lavender or other essential oils. Then you put a cube of this water and oil in your shower and you have a Soothing Hot Shower.child friendly, no nasty plastic toxinsHigh recomendation!!!

I just love this car shade .. this has been such a life saver.  We travel with my son who has congenital heart defect and traveling with him in the sun can be tricky ...even for local trips.  Before we would go shopping during the Summer and by the time we got to our car it would be burning ... no matter how high you put your air conditioner it takes a while to cool down and for him it can be dangerous ...especially when his car seat is burning hot.  We noticed that the temperature of the car was cooler with the shade the first time that we used it.  Had NEVER thought of getting one .. don't know why these are not standard offerings.  I love the way that it fold up easily and can be kept handy at all times.  I hope to make everyone aware that this is an amazing tool ..especially if you have kids. NOTE: Don't even think of leaving your kids in the car with the shade .. I just thought some idiot would read it like that .. so don't be an idiot and leave your kids in the car unattended ..especially in the heat.  But this shade is A++++++

I just fell in love with this cute little guy the second I saw it. who would have thought it ... used it as soon as I got it and it was perfect for my club .. it REALLY made a difference.  I noticed it in the swing. I am so used to the navigation program in my car that when I bought another car without one I felt lost.  I started using my phone and it was hard to drive and navigate (talk about hazard), it was suggested by a friend that I get a car holder, to be better able to use the features of my phone. On that advice I looked for a car mount for a while and I'm really happy I purchased this one! I've only had it for a couple weeks, but it has made a lasting first impression. I originally wanted to stick the mount on my dash, but with my phone in it my vision was blocked. I put it on my windshield, and it worked GREAT! It really does stick to the windshield.It is so easy to put my Samsung Galaxy 3 with its case in it, something that apparently a lot of others do not do. It does this with no problem. It's easy to adjust and locks firmly in place. Make sure the part that holds your phone is locked into place with the mount. You'll have to tighten the ball. I put my phone in and remove it easily with one hand, an action that has become as second nature as inserting the key. I am also able to charge my phone as the holder does not get in the way and all the other controls on the side are easily accessible.My nephew drove with me this weekend and as teenagers do, he put his IPhone 5s in and did a video while driving. I thought that this was a pretty "neat" feature, if that term is still used. Of course it is probably going to cost me another as he mentioned that his mom's got in the way of his camera and it shook a lot making his video bad.Overall, I love it! It will be a practical and SAFE way to use the GPS on my phone. I have also noticed that the speaker for calls and music is a lot clearer. I will and am buying another.

I hit about 1000 balls a week at the driving range and this glove has held up for almost 3 months of the range + 3 18 hole games.Overall, I'm very pleased with this product!

Great scale. Does what it needs to. Scale is legitimately precise, and not artificially so. I have read that some other scales on Amazon have "memory" and artificially falsify successive measurements to appear more precise than they are.This scale is sleek and looks great. High quality glass, looks modern and expensive.Works instantly, don't have to "tap" to wake it up and then wait, and then step on.I am very confident in this scale's accuracy. If you step on with just one foot, pause for a bit, it will measure a realistic, smaller weight, and then you step up the rest of the way and it adjusts. I believe it to be accurate, as compared to measurements from other scales.

This isn't my first brand of phytoceramides. I've used a couple of different ones and have been exceedingly pleased with the results. This isn't a magic pill that you take once and watch as youth ripples up your face and body. It takes time. It was at least a couple of months that I was just popping the pill along with my 25 (exaggeration but not much) other supplements. Then one day I thought -- damn, I look pretty good for 38. Not long after my step daughter literally asked what was up with my face -- she said my skin looked amazing. Saw an ex boyfriend for lunch a few days ago and he said "you look exactly the same as when I met you" which was almost ten years ago. So do they work? Yeah. He** yeah.This specific brand I've been using for only a few days. I haven't had any adverse reactions and the more youthful appearance I have regained over several months of using ceramides hasn't dripped off like candle wax, so I believe they're still working. I like that this contains 350 mg of phytoceramides. I am also pleased that the ingredient list is as simple as "phytoceramides, vitamin a, c, d, e". No fillers or crap listed.This product does have gluten in it, so if that's an issue for you, check out the potato or rice derived products. However, for me, the gluten isn't a huge deal. We do avoid a lot of it, but in this small quantity it isn't the end of the world. I've used wheat, rice and potato and honestly, I can't tell you that I prefer one over the other. From what I understand, Dr. oz recommended this dosage and type while other types contend that a lower amount of their product is as or more effective. To me, it is still just one pill. If it works, then I'm down with it.

I not only lost a pant size but it's from all over, little by little. It took a long time for my body to get to where it is and it's not going to disappear overnight, and I don't expect miracles. I have been doing several painting in different medium since I was a child. I now have an eight year old that has the same love and I was telling her how important it is to have a great quality brush. I had given her some of my older brushes but she wanted some new ones so I went on shopping. I didn't want to spend much so these seemed perfect. My biggest concern was that the quality was going to be very poor so I was a bit hesitant. I had her open them but together we did a watercolor project. She loved them and so did I. Loved all the variety and the quality was exceptional for each one.  The bristles are soft and maintain their shape. The paints are easily transferable to the canvas and paper. I also loved that they come in a perfect carrying case.  I now have to buy myself a set. . High recommendation.

These are a great idea... for the right person. They are cutely packaged in a book style set with a bag for containing them. Great as a stocking stuffer or small gift idea for someone who prefers their spirits straight. Also a unique conversation starter.What they will do:- Drop the temp of your drink by a few degrees- Keep the drink from being diluted for slow sippers who don't want their drink watered down- Allow for a reusable set of chilling stones that provide many reuses- Keep an already chilled drink cool longerWhat they won't do:- Cool a drink to refrigerator temperatures (they just can't, it's a matter of physics)- Keep a drink ice cold for long periods of time (meant to chill, not super-cool drinks)- Scrape high quality glasses (soft stone, rounded corners mean little to no scuffing)... no promises on low grade glassThese will work for the intended purpose, which is to keep a chilled drink cool longer, or to add a slight chill to a drink. They can't possibly make a room temperature drink ice cold, because they just don't have the thermal mass to do so. But if kept in the freezer (in a cold spot, not on the door), they will work nicely for someone that absolutely must have their spirits straight. Many people are used to ice diluted drinks, and no, these cannot compete with the thermal mass of frozen water, but the trade off is, they won't dilute the drink either.As long as you know what you're getting when you buy them, these are great. Just don't expect them to be something they're not.

I got this for my daughter who has very long thick hair. It was not problem to put on. What I loved was that it was snug without being too snug and it kept her hair dry and ears as well. I rinse it out after each use and after it is dry I place it in the bag that it came. I am buying one for me and another one just in case. I am super happy. A+++ all around.

My whole family often had to replace their phones because they kept on getting damaged. I decided to buy one for each family member because it was costing me so much to replace phones. I needed to find a case that not only protected my phone but that it also fit the personality of each family member. Pure success. This case fit like a glove and it protected the phone perfectly. My family member loved it and is going to order more! Great quality and amazing customer service!

Once Upon a Power Play is a great addition to Jennifer Bonds Risky Businessseries. Character-driven, the story very much focusses on Chloe and Ryan and considering I havent been overly impressed with many of the Brazen titles of late, this was a welcome discovery. And whilst the storyline was fairly predictable, this couple had an amazing chemistry, didnt bring a huge amount of drama and created some very sexy heated moments. I couldnt have asked for much more."Happily ever after is a fairy tale that's not meant for me."The authors writing style works perfect for me. She pulls her reader in from the start and has brought characters with superb personalities. There was nothing I didnt love about Chloe and Ryan, individually or together, and whilst both have their vulnerabilities and insecurities its perfectly balanced with verbal sparring, fun and dirty-talk that actually doesnt leave you cringing."Everywhere this ice cube goes, my mouth follows."All in all this was a thoroughly enjoyable read that I wouldnt hesitate to recommend if youre looking for a feel-good sexy sports-romance which is low on angst. Heres hoping that Jennifer Bonds has a story in the making for Ryans teammate, Bash as he was a wonderful secondary character who definitely has mileage in him.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

I'm always happy to pick up a book by Marissa Clarke and her Anderson Brothers series has so far has brought me pretty much all I could ask to find in a lighter contemporary romance. Chance of a Lifetime was no exception; romantic, fun and sexy, heart warming and at times quite emotional, Chance and Gen brought a refreshing perspective to one of my favourite tropes; second chance love."...he could show her the adventure and freedom she craved so badly and still keep her safe."Simply put, I adored them together. Strong and feisty, Gen is absolutely determined that her disability won't prevent her from living her life how she wants to, which is easier said than done with a family who think being blind means being helpless. Chance has been a little of a mystery in the previous books, but now is his time to shine and believe me, he does. His humour, patience, devotion and regrets over the mistakes he has made in life made him a man to fall in love with, and following a chance encounter in a bar with his childhood best friend, he finds himself offering to help her complete her bucket list."What do you see?""Nothing but you."This couple's journey was my definition of rom-com and Marissa Clarke has injected the same emotions you experience when watching a film on a screen. I howled with laughter at the verbal sparring between the Anderson men, and I must admit there were a couple of moments between Gen and Chance when I thought my eyes may leak. Add in Will and Claire and Michael and Mia's evolving lives and Gen's irritating big brother and you have the icing on the cake. And, whilst I'm a little sad that the series is complete, I can say without a shadow of a doubt that it's one I'll be re-reading.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing via NetGalley for an honest and unbiased opinion.

For those of you who follow my reviews, you'll know by now that Victoria James is one of my favourite authors. She crafts beautiful love stories with characters who steal your heart and journeys that enchant from the opening page."...what happened here last night? A Christmas Miracle?"The Billionaire's Christmas Proposal is a book I've been eager to get my hands on as its predecessor, The Billionaire's Christmas Baby is a festive read I could read over and over again. And whilst it does bring all I expect to find in a book from Victoria, and I did fall in love with Ethan and Allie and their story, I have to be honest and say it's not my favourite from her. There were parts to the story that I don't feel were necessarily needed; in comparison to her previous books it was heavier on tropes and there were elements that wouldn't have have been missed if you'd taken them away, giving an opportunity to give the reader a little more on those that mattered. And if this had been the case, you would still be presented with a lovely romance with an equally lovely couple who have secrets and uneasy pasts."The way he spoke; the warmth in his gaze and in his deep voice was enough to make her forget all the reasons she'd made up about why she couldn't be with Ethan."Ethan and Allie's journey is romantic, festive, heartwarming and bittersweet, bringing a family feel and highlighting aspects many of us take for granted. And, whilst it was fairly predictable in comparison to Victoria's usual MO and it may not have pulled the level of emotion from me that so many of her books have done in the past, it was an enjoyable read."I'm showing you what it's like to forget where you are, who you are, and everything except wanting more."Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

The second book in the Sin City SEALS series picks up more or less where To Tempt a SEAL left off. I loved the first, we were given a glimpse of the characters featuring here and Sara Jane Stone's writing voice worked well for me, giving me huge hope for the series."I always play to win.""I dare you to try."For me, Natalie and Jack didn't light the pages up in the way Cade and Lucia did. Their story had already laid the groundwork giving us an insight into Natalie's upbringing and Jack came across as fun and appealing, so I was semi-expecting a hero who would break through his lady's barrier in an equally fun and sexy way. And so it begins when he makes a bet with his idiotic older brother that he can bed her, which she knows about."I dont understand how all those women who fall for your pick-up lines walk away afterward."I started out liking both Jack and Natalie but, if I'm honest, it was too long a read, padded out with too many games of cat and mouse. Many of the enjoyable moments involved Lucia and Cade, but I generally found Natalie frustrating with her running and this pretty much lasted until 80%. However, I will say that heading towards the finish this couple did endear themselves and they brought what I'd been hoping for earlier it; was just that bit too late to rate this higher.Will I read more in the series? Absolutely. If Sara Jane Stone can recreate the spark she brought to the first book then I will be a satisfied reader. On this occasion though, To Dare a SEAL just missed the mark for me.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Over the past twelve months or so, I have become a fan of Joya Ryans writing. And, whilst fairly predictable, Tell Me You Need Me continues her trend of delivering a quick, easy-read steamy romance with a likeable couple."I'm hungry, sweetheart, and we both know you are too.""I'll see your dinner and offer up "a quick meal" instead."Having inherited her mothers restaurant, Chloe is focused on making it a success, pausing only to satisfy her own hunger whenever Search and Rescue officer, Gage arrives in town. Both with an aversion to commitment, their arrangement has worked perfectly fine, that is until Gage decides he wants more and Chloe isnt exactly welcoming of his idea."Youre the only man Ive gone back to more than once..."This couple do have a great chemistry and create plenty sexy moments, but I do feel that the ending seemed rushed considering Chloes general reticence in taking things to the next level. However, on the whole it was an enjoyable sexy friends-to-lovers read and a promising start to Joyas Search and Seduce series.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

I've always been a fan of Samanthe Beck's work. Her writing style has grabbed and she's consistently brought her readers engaging, entertaining, sexy romances with great couples. So it's fair to say I had high expectations for Compromising Her Position.I intended to stop you, butI can't really put it any other way; I had issues with how this book was opened and the mistaken identity sex aspect of this storyline. Mistaken identity sex becomes a grey area when you know the girl you're having sex with doesn't know who you are, yet you say nothing. If she knew who was actually underneath the Santa-suit, what would she do? She might say carry on, good for her, but she also may say no and that choice was never given. And this immediately became a pretty big sticking point for me."...once shed pressed her soft, eager mouth to his, he couldnt for the life of him bring things to a halt."Had this been an author I wasn't familiar with, I'm pretty certain I would have parted ways at this point, but despite this whole aspect bothering me I continued, and unfortunately I have to say I found the story generally lacking. Samanthe has always brought her readers that bit more; she's written books with stories that are more than sex, with couples who are relatable and quickly endear, and whilst the consensual passion between Rafe and Chelsea was well-written, outside of the bedroom they didn't have that spark that she has so often created and I simply couldn't become invested into a couple who started out the way they did.This doesn't mean I won't read future books from Samanthe Beck. I will, I have always rated her writing, and her previous books have all been four and five-star reads for me, but in comparison, Compromising Her Position just didn't hit the right notes.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Zoe Forward has brought a good second instalment to her Keepers of the Veil series. I thoroughly enjoyed the first book, Protecting His Witch so was eager to see how what His Witch to Keep held in store."No previous Pleiad has ever been matched to a man who is not druid. It's not possible."This time around, our dimension-hopping witch is Serenity, utilising her skills as both one of the Pleiades witches and former MI6 agent to save her kidnapped sister. Placing herself in dangerous situations means its not long before her protective one-night stand Alexi decides to involve himself and whilst the pull between them may be magnetic, it can never be anything more, because he is death-reaper."Just for tonight, I will own your soul."The tension between this couple burns from start and leads to some very heated moments amongst the fight, action and suspense of the overall story. I have to be honest and say it seemed to lack the paranormal feel the first book brought, but it was still an enjoyable well-paced read and Im looking forward to seeing which of the seven sisters is next.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing via NetGalley for an honest and unbiased opinion.

2015 has seen Kat Latham become one of my go-to authors. I just know that when I pick one of her books up Im not going to be left disappointed and Three Nights Before Christmas reinforces this."There's no officer here. No criminal. Just Austin and Lacey..."I have to say I wasnt quite sure how a romance between Lacey Gallagher and Austin Wilder would work; after all he played a part in her ending up spending three miserable years in prison, how do you go from that to lovers? But Kat Latham did make it work and crafted a wonderful festive romance focusing on forgiveness and understanding."...I see you, Lacey."Perfectly paced, the romance was enchanting, steamy, emotional and Lacey and Austin were a couple to love. Shes no wallflower, her time inside may have ended her career as a successful train engineer but her strength of determination to move on with her life and start again was quite humbling, as was Austins realisations as to the mistakes and assumptions he may have made in the past."You're a dirty-minded sex-fiend."If a festive feel-good, steamy read is what youre looking for, then this ticks the boxes. And with Laceys brother and her lawyer featuring throughout, its onto Sarah Mayberrys His Christmas Gift for me to see what lies in store for them.Copy received courtesy of Tule Publishing via NetGalley for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Victoria James is an author who hits the spot every time. I've been waiting for Falling for Her Enemy since the moment I finished Falling for the P.I. and I absolutely devoured Alex and Hayden's story."You want to take my daughter away from me..."Alex suffers trust issues; understandable considering she grew up in foster care. But having made a life with her family, foster-sisters Kate and Cara and their adopted daughters, her life is reasonably settled. Until Hayden turns up and drops the bombshell that he believes he may be her daughter's biological dad."She was a woman that made him crave things he hadn't craved in a hell of a long time."Victoria does what she does best and brings her reader a beautifully crafted, charming, sweet romance filled with emotion and a sprinkling of angst. Hayden was a hero who proved himself as the story progressed and, whilst he frustrated a little at first, he was a darling and he and Alex had a lovely chemistry, as did he and Cassy."I don't know if you know this, but she's not my pathological mother.""Biological.""Right. But she loves me just like a pathological mom."Falling for Her Enemy was a complete pleasure to read and Cara's story can't come quick enough; that's how eager I am to return to the wonderful place that is Still Harbour. (And, if you're familiar with The Billionaire's Christmas Baby you may spot a little nod in that direction.)Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

If you've liked the previous books in the Fated Matched series, you'll love The Alpha's Temporary Mate. Victoria Davies has skill when it comes to giving her reader an enjoyable paranormal romance and once again I found myself immersed."A woman my checkbook can't sway? Show me such a creature and I'll marry her."This time around, our couple are Fated Match's resident matchmaker and witch, Chloe and playboy/werewolf alpha, Kieran. His pack are insistent he needs to find a mate, he has no intention of doing so but he needs to keep the wolves from the door and tasks Chloe with finding him a fake girlfriend. A role Chloe finds herself persuaded to take."His wolf wanted to keep her. It was the man holding him back."I loved this couple together. Their romance is fairly slow-burn and the odds aren't particularly in their favour, but they have a strong chemistry and bring humour, passion and fight. And with vampires, sirens, succubus, necromancers and a whole raft of other immortals, once again we're transported into a magical paranormal world."If I let myself lose track of what exactly it is you want from me, I'm going to get hurt."This series has worked its way into my heart and I'm not ready for it to end. Here's hoping that Victoria Davies treats us to more.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing via NetGalley for an honest and unbiased opinion.

I've adored Elizabeth Otto's Paint River Ranch series and Can't Resist a Cowboy is a good finale. Granted, for me, it didn't hold quite the emotion pull as its predecessors, but Levi and Carrie were another endearing couple who haven't had an easy-time of things."You're staring, Sunshine.""If you saw yourself from a female perspective, you'd be staring too."Second chance love, an injured ex-marine/cowboy and a heroine with a life-long illness that could change her life. Combined, this held huge promise, and whilst Levi and Carrie's circumstances did pull on the heartstrings, I was expecting more considering Levi's history. Unlike Cole and Tucker's stories, there were no tears, but he is a sweetheart and he does have the Haywood charm; I just didn't fall in love with him in the same way I did his brothers."I never stopped caring about you, Sunshine. I learned to push it away, but it was always there, with each breath."That's not to say I didn't enjoy it, I did; Elizabeth Otto has a gift of creating likeable characters who absorb you into their lives and have personal issues that are often shied away from in romance. Levi and Carrie have a past and with that comes a natural chemistry and intimacy, but I found the passion quite slow burn. In some respects it was fitting, but it did add a steady feel when reading."You never have to apologise for touching me, Carrie."The banter and sparring between the brothers brought humour, Birdie brought the cute and that honesty only little-ones can get away with, and it was lovely to see Cole and Rylan, and Tucker and Sophie's lives evolving. It may not have been quite the journey than I was hoping for, but you can't not want Levi and Carrie to find their HEA and it is a good addition to a series I highly recommend.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

I love the London Legends series. No point pulling any punches, I do; I've pretty much read them back-to-back and I can quite comfortably say, Kat Latham can do no wrong. She has a talent of creating endearing characters with wonderful personalities, strengths and weaknesses. Ash Trenton and Camila Morales are no different and were as unique as each of the previous couples from the series."If you want easy, you came to the wrong man. I don't do easy. I do worth-it."Newly retired from the Legends, Ash has been a bit of an enigma throughout the series. But when he bumps into his first love at his leaving-do, old feelings are re-ignited and Camila has a proposition for him. One that requires him hopping a plane and helping out at the camp she runs for troubled teens.Their journey was so different, for a start it doesn't take place in the UK, and whilst we know these men fall and fall hard, Ash was in a league of his own. I had an inkling I knew where the story was heading, and I was proved right, but it didn't detract from a strong, emotional read with humour, heartache and strong determined lady and a strapping man to fall head-over-heels for. He's a softie, but he's also a talker."I don't want lovey-dovey words. I want dirty talk. I want your mouth to get so filthy you feel like you need mouthwash."With a natural chemistry that comes with familiarity, Ash and Camila's re-ignited passion brings revelations, vulnerabilities and maturity, and together they were perfect. If, like me, you love this series, Taming the Legend won't disappoint. (And it also has a hidden treat of being loosely connected to One Night with her Bachelor, although it's not necessary to read it to follow).4.5 stars.This review will feature on Read Your Writes Book Reviews.

The second book in Jessica Scott's Homefront series, After the War is an engaging read with a storyline that goes beyond romance. Life in the army is often glamourised and to be presented with serving officers and the situations they have encountered and continue to face, was quite humbling; running parallel to this second-chance love-story is one that makes you realise just what these men and women sacrifice."Sean Nichols was nothing more than a bad memory. One she was determined to leave exactly where he belonged. In the past."Sarah and Sean have a history, Rewind several years and we have a young man who didn't want the woman he intended to marry to become a soldier, and a woman who didn't see her role in life as that of an army-wife and mum. Ending their relationship, Sarah pursued her dreams, married, had a daughter and faced her own tragic loss. But when circumstance places them in the same place eight-years later, they discover war may have changed them, but their feelings for one another remain."This doesn't feel wrong to me."Whilst at times it felt a little steady, it was an enjoyable read. Sean and Sarah were likeable and their reconnection was touching, emotional and at times a little heart-wrenching. I have no idea what army-life is like, but with a gritty accompanying storyline it's given me what I can only perceive as a reality to the struggles officers face. Jessica Scott is an author that I will certainly read again and I look forward to the next book in this series.Copy received courtesy of Rock Star Lit PR via NetGalley for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Let me begin by saying J.D. Hawkins has talent. To cram that much awful into an opening chapter? Oh, that takes a level of skill that goes beyond mastery."Let me tell you something. I can tell how a woman f***s by the way she moves; you can tell how a man handles business between the sheets by the way he walks."and I can tell when my early warning detection system is doing its job perfectly when sentences like that appear a couple of lines in.Unfortunately I threw the towel in at 20% and for several reasons. Aside of my feelings towards the characters (which I'll return to), Insatiable was in desperate need of an editor - the grammar and punctuation errors, the telling without showing and the POV slips made it a frustrating read, but grammar wasn't the only problem. It was the choice of words."I pull back, her clit following me like a lost dog.""I roll my knuckles in and around her holes with the expertise of a piano player.""she rolls it (his juices btw) around her mouth before swallowing it like its a vintage wine getting her drunk."This isnt erotic. Far from it. What I read was clichd, crass and left someone with a fairly strong constitution feeling queasy. Yet it was strangely clinical. All the action happened just like that. The licking lips, the awful chat-up lines and a girl dragging him into a corner in a nightclub; what I managed to read had no sense of pacing and everything just happened so abruptly and dispassionately that there was no emotional investment to be had. It centres wholly around who Jax does or doesn't want to bang and whether or not he succeeds."I can sense the dozens of women deciding at first glance that Im the one they want to f*** tonight."He had no redeeming qualities. Insecure and manipulative, cocky and chauvinistic, I couldn't abide him and felt like I was reading and being expected to enjoy the thoughts of, quite bluntly, a misogynistic narcissist. As for the heroine, Lizzie, she really was nothing more than an object. There for his benefit. As were all the women, including the one redeeming character, Luce who had the potential to be a likeable character as she was the one person to pull him up on his incessant bitching. But the author ruined that by pulling out the old pathetic misconception that man cannot simply be just friends with woman.On the positive side, the reader does get sex in the opening chapter (clunkily and unsexily, but it's there) and the book is fairly short, which is a definite plus, if you can make it to the end.Will I be reading the subsequent books in this series? I think my answer may be a little obvious, but no I won't. And, as always these are simply my own personal and honest thoughts.

Changing His Game is a steamy addition to the Brazen line, with a refreshing storyline. Combine Tumblr, a dirty talker and a lady who knows what she wants, and you get a romance with plenty heat and some humour."Is that a river in your panties or are you just happy to see me?"When Marley Lake has a computer problem at work, her knight-in-shining-techy-armour comes in the form of Austin Rivers, silent partner in Gaming magazine. The same magazine Marley is copy-editor for. And when he spies the dirty gif she's watching, it's not long before she sees his hard-ware."I didn't realise you were left-handed.""I'm not.""But you're eating with your left hand.""That's because my right hand is busy with something a lot more important."Megan Erickson is a new author to me and whilst it was fairly predictable, she's brought her readers likeable characters, chemistry and sexy shenanigans. And with much of the humour courtesy of Austin's best-friend Grant and his daughter, I look forward to seeing what lies in store for him.3.5 stars.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Jen McLaughlin/Diane Alberts is just one of those authors you can rely on to bring you a hot sexy read. Taking What's His is another great addition to her Shillings Agency series, and brings us Holt Cunningham; a dirty-talking, bespectacled, dominant man with a vulnerable side."One wild, crazy night, and then we both move on. No broken hearts. No painful goodbyes."When Holt meets Lydia Thomas in a bar, their chemistry sizzles and it burns bright throughout. I loved how prepared Lydia was to go toe-to-toe with him, but it was how hard Holt fell that made me adore him the way I did. He has vulnerabilities, he's stubborn and dominant but he's also a complete sweetheart."I'm not going to call you sir.""Yeah. You will."If you're a Doctor Who fan, there are little moments in this book that will make perfect sense and bring the feels, and if you're not, well they'll still do that, just perhaps not on the same level. Jen certainly doesn't let her reader down and with Lydia's newly-single brother Steven featuring throughout, here's hoping we're given the opportunity to discover which lady will bring him to his knees.4.5 stars.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

...and Richard Larsen and Hanna Vincent's spans over twenty years, beginning on the eve of the millennium. Told from both perspectives no emotion is left untouched and I loved them together....they say you hurt the ones who love you most...Fix You is about normal people. Normal everyday relatable people who have the same ups and downs in life that any of us could have. Hanna and Richard's journey puts you through the ringer; you feel their joy and their pain and live their highs and lows, they frustrate, they make foolish decisions but they're soul mates, they're just meant to be and you can't not want them to find their HEA.Ive always loved you, even when youve been far away and I havent been able to see you.Withh a plethora of secondary characters to love and hate, all adding valuable content, Carrie Elks has brought her reader a contemporary romance that draws you in from the opening chapter. Granted at times I found it a little slow going, I still polished it off in one sitting and found it an enjoyable captivating read.

The third in the Blackcreek series, Pretend didn't grab me in the same way as Collide and Stay. The storyline had potential, both characters have family issues, but they seemed to play second fiddle to the fact that Mason and Gavin couldn't keep their hands off one another.What kind of life is it if youre not living your own?Together they were lovely, Mason has a dirty mouth and Gavin doesn't fair so bad, but the emotional angle could've been much more. I wanted to love it as I had its predecessors and it's a shame I didn't, but I'd still happily read more from Riley Hart in the future.

The first book in this series has always been one of my favourites from the Bliss imprint. And having waited quite a while for this, I was very much looking forward to returning to Lake Bliss. Second-chance love is a trope I'm fond of, and with a romance between the town's once golden-boy and the town's sweetheart on the cards, it enticed."I've never forgotten you...Can you say the same"Unfortunately, I didn't enjoy this as much as Just for the Summer which was a real shame. I had such high hopes; Rachel and John have that chemistry that comes with having a past, and there were some lovely moments between them, but on the whole I struggled to connect with them until pretty much near the end. The introduction of Rachel's ex-husband and her decisions frustrated and if I'm honest, I was hoping that the kids would have had more time in the spotlight.On this occasion, Just for Appearances just wasn't for me. That's not to say that you won't enjoy it.2.5 stars.Copy received courtesy of Entangled Publishing for an honest and unbiased opinion.

When Victoria James releases a book the clouds part, the heavens sing and rainbows fill the sky. Well, perhaps that's an exaggeration, but it makes me happy as I know I'm going to find a man to love. This time it's Gage Mackenzie; Cowboy, gent, user of the word Darlin' and yes, I'd happily ride off into the sunset with him..."Sweet baby Jesus, this man was a work of art."The second book in the Tall Pines series,  Rescued by the Rancher is a lovely romantic journey with endearing characters, a captivating storyline and set in a beautiful location. When Meredith Simms arrived at Tall Pines a year previously, she was at a low point in life but with the support of her sister, brother-in-law and Gage, she's become a strong, independent lady, but with a vulnerable side. Gage is a protector; strong, sexy and gentle, he's a complete sweetheart, but he has his own secrets. I expected emotion, I've read enough of Victoria's books to know I'll get it, but I didn't expect it to be as deep-rooted as it was. I hurt for them, but this was balanced by so many uplifting and romantic moments."You walk into the room and you turn me on. You look at me, you smile at me, you laugh, and you turn me on."Whilst the intimacy is closed door, the emotional elements surrounding Gage and Meredith bring a sexy and passionate feel keeping the romance alive throughout. Victoria James has a gift of creating a couple to fall in love with with a strong, emotive writing style containing humour and with secondary characters who bring a real family feel and valuable content to the story. I loved seeing how Cole and Mel were getting on, well if I'm truthful I loved getting another little fix of Cole, but I also did a happy dance that's there's the possibility of more visits to Tall Pines. I have to be honest and say it's not my favourite of Victoria's books, but she can still do no wrong; it's a fine addition and one I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.(The second in the Tall Pines series, Rescued by the Rancher could be read as a standalone. That said you don't want to miss out on The Rancher's Second Chance and the brooding delight that is Cole Forrester.)Part of this review can be seen on Read Your Writes Book Reviews as a joint review feature.

I admit that I have the ebook version of this book through B&N for my Nook Tablet (the ebook comes as a trilogy called Time In Death along with 2 other novellas, Haunted & Eternity)I love the In Death Novels, but the novellas can make your head ache. I realize she only has 80 to 100 pages to build up murder, back story, solving the crime and arrestBut it is due to the limited space that many of the dramatis personae do not get developed. In this book you have the 2 main characters of Eve & Roarke, 5 secondary characters of Mavis, Ian, Mira, Peabody, Summerset; three recurring characters in Leonardo, Morris and Isis. Now add to those 10 characters another 24 minor and periphery characters that we have never heard of. That is a LOT of people to develop a story for in 100 pages.As I said, I have the single ebook from the Suite 606 anthology because I have read the other authors work before and do not care for them. I own all of JD Robb's books from Naked In Death to Festive In Death and have Obsession In Death on Pre-order.I love the stories in the novels, but the novellas? Not so much.In my opinion, the most confusing and unsatisfying novella to date was Missing in Death.
Cut several colors of this die and layer them up to make pretty tiger lily bouquet for your cards
Really lovely die and even if you do not need the icicles that long, they are easy to cut away and hide under the window panes. I will use this die through out the year for many different things.

I never thought I would buy these. After all anyone can cut a rectangle, right? Wrong, I found out that with a dull blade and/or an extension arm not fully pulled out can be the death of many a piece of cardstock.I no longer worry about that with this set of dies and I am looking forward to buying the Basic B set.

I love this guy! His music is still rocking and he is still the shock rocker I remember as a teenager. His concerts are still filled with energy and macabre imagery. I saw him in concert June 2012 for the Welcome 2 My Nightmare tour. He still has what his audiences are looking for; mixing new material with his classics high energy, entertainment and some totally awesome music!His life was filled with things that would have killed us lesser human beings, but he is a survivor.This book is about his life. His struggles with alcohol addiction (before the time of Betty Ford clinics), the love of a good woman, turning down advances from Mae West and Raquel Welch are all woven into his life with GOLF!!!As much as I would love to meet him some day, I could never play golf with him. He has a 2 handicap!!

Works great for getting all of the bits out of your intricate dies, but it also works getting the paper fibers off of the plastic cutting pads as well.Periodically, I will put my cutting pads into a sink of hot sudsy water to allow the paper fibers to swell and hopefully come out of the cuts in the plastic. With this brush, I can roll it back and forth over the cutting pads to really get all of the bits out.
I have loved all of the Weta books and are grudgingly looking forward to the last 2 books from the Battle of the Five Armies.
I bought this for Edgar Allen Poe themed Halloween cards, it cut very well and very cleanly.

I got this to make Halloween cards with a Edgar Allen Poe theme.As usual with Sizzix Bigz dies, it cuts through almost anything and it did through very thick cardboard and medium weight leather pieces.

I liked the idea of a window with shutters, but the die was very small.I was hoping to frame a Yule tree in the window, but not enough of it shows!I will definitely use this die for other cards, but for the reason I wanted the die for it doesn't work.I am giving this a good review because it cuts beautifully, it makes a good embossed impression on cardstock and it will be pretty with a flower box under it.

I love all of Spellbinders dies and with the help of a dryer sheet, I have no problems cutting out the little bits.OK, many people look at this and see a pretty holiday die cut. Not me, I see more than that. Look at that tail, cut several of those tails in blues and green and I see a peacock! Look at that wing, extend it with another wing die cut and I definitely see a dragon!!Die cut the whole bird and several cuts of the tail, color them with alcohol ink from shrink plastic and then shrink them. Adhere the tails pieces with either hot glue or glossy accents at an agle to each other and you would have a cute little embellishment for your card. You could do the same thing in cardstock to make a larger embellishment for a gift. I made a few in shrink plastic, colored in silver, gold and copper, then staggered their lengths inside a clear glass ornament.. It will look very pretty on the tree this year.

I love all of Spellbinders dies and with the help of a dryer sheet, I have no problems cutting out the little bits.I have cut this die in many layers in order to cut them all apart and rebuilt the die up like tole.Cut layers in brown, white, green and a flower color, I chose purple. The brown was for the vines, white for the fence, green for the stems and leaves and purple for the flowers. You can use a Xyron sticker machine to adhere the layers down but I used Scotch Fast Dry glue in a 20mm needle applicator (my favorite applicator - bought here on Amazon) to glue down the little bits.When all the layers were done, the die cut was 1/8" thick and when centered on a light blue layer it was quite pretty. I suggest trying that technique should you buy this die. Think outside of the packaging!

I love all of Spellbinders dies and with the help of a dryer sheet, I have no problems cutting out the little bits.This die is awesome because I can cut it apart and use the twigs as trees behind the Iron Fence die or join them in a chain to climb up the side of the card to make a vine.

I've had mine for 3 months and I live in the hot sun of the South. After reading some of the reviews I decided to seal my magnet before putting it on the car. I ran it through my laminating machine, twice to ensure a good seal, then trimmed it. It had been covering up a dent in the door that someone put there while I was shopping last year.The color was still bright like new, but now the sticker is gone. Someone stole it while I was in the movies tonight!!I love the idea of a bandage on the car so I have just ordered a new one.

This Cottage Cutz die actually does what it is supposed to do. Maybe it is because there are no intricate cuts to make, I do not know, but I only need to run this through ONE TIME and it cuts everything out! Out of the 6 Cottage Cutz dies I have, this one and a tea pot border die cut correctly.So I am 2 for 6.

I love the idea of having some ivy to dangle behind flowers on my cards and thought this was the answer to my problem.As long as I have TIME to spin this die around and around in order for it to cut cleanly, its great, but when I simply want to have a bit of greenery for a card, I pull out my Tim Holtz Greenery strip die.I have no idea why Cottage Cutz can be so difficult at times. Some of their dies cuts perfectly and others do not. this is one of the do nots.

I make a lot of steampunk bezel jewelry and I could not do it without this. Creating my own gadgets and bezels is easy using this 2 part epoxy.Just a note that this is a clay for you to form or mold. If you want to make a mold of something by using this clay you can do it but you will need  Environmental Easymold Silicone Rubber first. By making the mold once you'll never need to do it again. So if you want to recreate a button or bezel shape, make sure you make a mold of it in the mold making clay, then push this epoxy into it, let it cure and you will have exactly what you were wanting thanks to Environmental co.
One of my favorite Spellbinders dies for masculine and Autumn cards! Cuts beautifully and is easy to dump the pieces from.

I love all things Tim Holtz and I own many of his dies. This die cuts wonderfully. But, rolling up the pine cone from the spiral is a bit difficult.I am sure that if I ever get the knack of how to roll one of these cones they would be beautiful on my Solstice cards. I am making bluish cone and I am only using half of the spiral for the cone as I want a small one. But the rolling and gluing takes a bit of effort.

They foot part may be XL but the toes are for average feet.I wear a size 14 in the Vibram Five Fingers shoes. I thought these socks would extend the life of my shoes as well as absorb sweat from running.Unfortunately, whoever designed these socks didn't realize that size 14 feet has longer or larger toes as well.When I put my feet into the sock you can clearly see how my big toe is stretching the material to a point of unraveling and that is before I put on my shoe. As for the rest of the toes, the little cylinders they go into are too thin.These would be amazing socks if whoever made them understood larger feet. I'd be willing to spend more money on the socks if they would just fit.I was very disappointed with these.

I never got into Oreo cookies.  I always found them much too sweet, with too strong a taste.  Growing up, I loved HYDROX cookies!  These delicious sandwich cookies were less sweet and had much less after-taste.  So I was stunned and saddened when HYDROX cookies went off the market several years ago.But now--through the magic of online shopping--HYDROX is back, and better than ever!  I bought several packages from Amazon, and eagerly look forward to buying more.  The cookies have the same great taste and texture as before; with each bite I'm transported straight down Memory Lane!  Kudos to Leaf Brands for bringing HYDROX cookies back!  Muchos gracias!--D. Mikels, Esq.

We're lucky.  We're in the midst of a renaissance of TV--where quality TV series (plural) have invaded the airwaves.  'The Sopranos.' 'The Wire.'  'The Shield.'  'Mad Men.'  'American Horror Story.'  'The Walking Dead.'  All excellent television. . .but then there's BREAKING BAD.  No other series--in my humble opine--comes close to this mastermind Vince Gilligan brainchild about a high school chemistry teacher going meth rogue.  And what better way to enjoy this dysfunctional journey of Walter White turning into meth kingpin Heisenberg than devouring the box set BREAKING BAD:  THE COMPLETE SERIES.  All six engrossing seasons--along with countless extra features--are available for your ultimate entertainment.Bryan Cranston as Walter White.  Anna Gunn as Skyler White.  Aaron Paul as over-his-head Jesse Pinkman.  Dean Norris as DEA brother-in-law Hank Schrader.  Betsy Brandt as sister and troublesome Marie Schrader.  RJ Mitte as confused Walt White Jr.  Bob Odenkirk as constant comic relief bad attorney Saul Goodman.  Jonathan Banks as steady thug Mike.  Giancarlo Esposito as deadly drug lord Gus Fring.  And so many more quality actors.  Not to mention top-of-their-games production crew.  All elements combine to tell us the story of nerdy Walter White transforming himself from a high school teacher nobody to the Southwest's most notorious meth cooker--and all the carnage left in Walt's wake--until the series' riveting finale. . .no doubt the best climax in all of television history.  And you'll see it all in this ultimate box set.Extra features.  Almost every episode has an audio commentary, featuring showrunner Vince Gilligan, an array of actors, producers, directors, lighting experts, sound and music experts, editors, etc.  In a word. . .illuminating.  And each disc contains several other extra features highlighting how certain memorable scenes were made, cast interviews, and other fascinating vignettes.  Each season contains three to four discs; each season builds the transformation of the ultimate antihero Walter White from nerd to kingpin in grand fashion.  BREAKING BAD is television at its finest.  BREAKING  BAD:  THE COMPLETE SERIES proves it.--D. Mikels, Esq.

I should have known Jonathan Tropper was involved with this movie.  I'm a huge fan of this talented and gifted writer who specializes in bittersweet comedies.  THIS IS WHERE I LEAVE YOU is based on Tropper's novel of the same name, and the author also wrote the screenplay.  When a family patriarch suddenly dies, and four scattered siblings with hectic, dysfunctional lives are put together under one roof for a week, there is everything from chaos to heart ache to warm fellowship.  THIS IS WHERE I LEAVE YOU tells the story of the Altman siblings, who must first get to know one another all over again before there's any chance of a connection, plus get to know their surrounding community again.  It's a solid comedy with plenty of poignant moments--which is vintage Tropper.All four siblings have plenty of baggage.  Paul, the oldest (Corey Stoll), has been stuck in his hometown running the family business; his life is fairly predictable and mundane--except he has a wife (Kathryn Hahn) obsessed with becoming pregnant.  Second oldest Wendy (Tina Fey) has a marriage in freefall due to her workaholic husband, but has a special connection to her two younger brothers, who she helped raise.  Judd (Jason Bateman) is going through a divorce--and has also lost his job.  And Phillip (Adam Driver), the baby, has been so indulged his entire life he's totally dysfunctional--but he brings his much older girlfriend (Connie Briton) along to show her off.  All the siblings are brought together by their caring mother (the ageless Jane Fonda), who has a bombshell of her own to share with her children.  The story is told primarily from the point of view of Judd, who's feeling his life is spinning out of control--but there are plenty of other snippets revealed about all the family members.  Plus Judd and Wendy get to rub elbows with childhood sweethearts (Rose Byrne and Timothy Olyphant, respectively).  The film meanders a bit too long, and Connie Britton is so under-utilized, yet THIS IS WHERE I LEAVE YOU will still have you both chuckling--and leave a lump in your throat.--D. Mikels, Esq.

When I became a huge fan of the movie, I did not realize CLOUD ATLAS was based on a novel.  I thought such a complex plot of six interweaving story threads to be the product of a group of screenwriters, so I was delighted to learn the movie stems from David Mitchell's extraordinary and brilliant novel.  Having just finished the book, I cannot wait to see the movie again!  Mitchell is an extremely gifted writer, as he tells each separate story in a totally different genre.  What the movie portrays is aptly conveyed in the pages of Mitchell's book:  That our lives are ripples in time that affect other lives in other times, and vice versa.  It's a haunting theme, masterfully told by a terrific writer.Again, the novel is comprised of six separate story threads; with the exception of the sixth story, each other thread is interrupted in half, then resolved in the second half of the book.  'The Pacific Journal of Adam Ewing' is told in the first person and relates a 19th Century south seas ocean voyage with very racial overtones.  'Letters from Zedelghem' is in the form of letters from one man to his lover conveying the story of a dysfunctional music collaboration in 1930s Europe.  'Half Lives:  The First Luisa Rey Mystery' is told in the present tense and is about a young reporter in the Seventies suddenly finding herself in the deadly corruption of big oil.  'The Ghastly Ordeal of Timothy Cavendish' is relayed in first person and is the hilarious story of an aging book publisher trapped in a nursing home, and how he conspires to escape.  (Like the movie, this by far is my favorite story--and it is incredibly funny.)  'An Orison of ~Somni 451' is a futuristic interview between an Archivist and a "fabricant" (clone) regarding a bold uprising that rattles the establishment (the "corpocracy").  Finally, 'Sloosha's Crossin' an' Ev'rythin' After' is told in broken English first person about a brutal post-Apocalyptic world far, far into the future.  Again, each thread is vastly different, but the theme--our lives are a mosaic that transcends time--is constant.  Mitchell's CLOUD ATLAS is not for everyone, but it is definitely a novel like you've never seen before--and one I'm most appreciative to have read.--D. Mikels, Esq.

Let's keep things in perspective.  J.R.R. Tolkien's 'The Hobbit' is a lighthearted, whimsical, 275-page fantasy novel for children, ages 9 to 12.  It is anything but a dark, brooding, sinister epic requiring mining plot lines (and characters) from the appendices of Tolkien's sequel 'The Lord of the Rings'. . .or pulling new characters directly out of writer/director/producer Peter Jackson's creative posterior.  Yet with the third--and, we hope, final--installment of THE HOBBIT:  THE BATTLE OF THE FIVE ARMIES, Jackson has created a whopping 9 hours of cinema.  All of it is a stunning visual feast, full of heart-pounding action, haunting music, and amazing visuals--but most of it is forced and contrived.  It's akin to ordering a hamburger and receiving an entire cow; to fans of the novel, these three films are the culmination of over-the-top.But again, Jackson knows how to make a movie, and FIVE ARMIES is quite a movie.  Here we find the original 13 dwarfs, and Bilbo (Martin Freeman), entrenched in Erebor, where Thorin Oakenshield (Richard Armitage) has succumbed to the same destructive greed that affected his grandfather.  Meanwhile, the nearby humans of Laketown claim they're entitled to a portion of Erebor's treasure, as do the elves of Mirkwood, led by the mysterious Thranduil (Lee Pace).  And of course, Sauron has dispatched an army of evil orcs to invade the region, and, not to be outdone, an army of dwarves, led by Thorin's cousin Dain (Billy Connolly is terrific), sweeps in to defend the fortress.  And through it all, there persists the non-believable romance between an elf and a dwarf (Evangeline Lilly and Aidan Turner); plus no Hobbit movie is complete without the fantastic Gandalf (Ian McKellen).  Throw all of these elements together, and the viewer is overwhelmed by a non-stop battle, but to his credit, Jackson pulls no punches; several characters, as in the book, are ultimately killed.  It's all masterfully crafted, with incredible special effects and furious action, yet THE HOBBIT:  THE BATTLE OF THE FIVE ARMIES proves to be too filling.  This quarter pounder has too many toppings.--D. Mikels, Esq.

Where I live, there are limited places to buy bath towels--including the dreaded store starting with a "W", and I never go to "W".  So as my existing towels were showing signs of wear and too many machine washings, I decided to roll the dice and come on this website to purchase a new set of bath towels.  I picked the UTOPIA towels, but with some trepidation; it's been my experience with cheaper towels that the quality is inferior, causing the towels to shed fibers on your person during drying.  But my fears were unjustified; the UTOPIA 8-PIECE VALUE 100% COTTON BATH TOWEL SET is worth every penny and more!As the product page advises, these towels are feather soft and mega-absorbent.  The edges are tightly woven and show no signs of unraveling.  Plus they are extremely durable; I've had the bath towels and hand towels through the washer several times, and they've yet to show any signs of wear.  And best of all:  No towel fibers left behind on my carcass!  As advertised, the UTOPIA set includes 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, and 4 washcloths; in my small household that's more than sufficient.  So if you're looking for quality towels at an affordable price, get the UTOPIA 8-PIECE VALUE 100% COTTON BATH TOWEL SET.  Hit the showers in style!--D. Mikels, Esq.

When it comes to comfort and style, you can't beat the Levi brand.  I was running low on shorts that weren't absolutely worn out, and immediately decided to try the LEVI'S MEN'S 550 DENIM SHORTS.  (I own a pair of the Levi's 550 Jeans.)  Needless to say, I have not been disappointed; the shorts are comfortable and look great.  So why not 5 stars?  Again, the tiny front pockets are a bit of a pain.  I carry my wallet, keys, and pocketknife in my front pockets, and with these shorts, the pockets are absolutely crammed.In my neck of the woods, the warm weather season basically stretches from March to late October, so quality shorts are a must.  So if you're looking for a quality, durable denim short, it's hard to go wrong with the LEVI'S MEN'S 550 DENIM SHORTS.  Let the summer broil; I'm good.--D. Mikels, Esq.

Summer is not my favorite time of the year, because where I live, it can be brutal and broiling outside.  So I was looking for a comfortable pair of shorts that was lightweight, yet durable--plus didn't cost me a small fortune.  I've been a huge fan of the Haggar Expandle-Waist Dress Slacks; I own several pair, so I took a chance and purchased a couple pair of HAGGAR MEN'S COOL 18 GABARDINE HIDDEN EXPANDLE-WAIST SHORTS.  Jackpot!These shorts are light as a feather, wrinkle free, machine washable, and they look great.  Plus with the expandable waist, I can enjoy that gut-splitting chicken fry for lunch, and stay perfectly comfy, as the shorts' waist expands with my girth.
