Stevia has a bad rap because almost no one in the U.S has ever tasted product equal to the quality of this product.I've been selling Stevia for years into the Nutraceutical Industry and been forced to use my companies expired samples for personal use because we don't sell under 5kg Qty. The cheap stuff sell 20 to 1 over the Gras level quality product. The garbage you commonly find on the market  [usually 90% Steviosides OR LESS] is 1/4 to 1/3 the price of this product, Available at a fraction of the cost  everyone markets the cheap stuff and depends on masking agents to cover the bitterness or just plain sells an inferior product. It's a shame that no one knows what true stevia tastes like. Truvia what a joke. [Explained Later]When comparing Stevia look on the label. Does it say Reb A [Rebauside A] 97% or above, if it doesn't specifically mention  Reb A [Rebauside A] then it's the cheap stuff. Reb A is a constituent or Glycol of the Stevia Plant which is 200-300 times sweeter than sugar, 0 Calories, and approved by the FDA for Food.I've sold and tasted the two and I can tell the difference, and the taste and concentration  of this product is spot on with authentic Gras caliber Stevia. By the way I don't sell to this marketer and don't have any interest other then to educate others.This is the real deal. It does not have that bitter aftertaste associated with Stevia. It doesn't have dextrose or any fillers so you'll need a super small spoon or be prepared to use very small amount.Stevia 95% and above has Gras or Generally Recognized as Safe. This means that the FDA has approved it for use in common food and beverages. Any lower grade Stevia has to be sold with a Dietary Supplement Warning Label.This is the same stuff that they use in Truvia but without the Fermented Corn Starch, sorry meant to say erythritol, that they cut it with. Truvia is a joke, it is heavily cut Stevia, while I've been told that it's good in Coffee, I'm not a fan of fermented Sugar Alcohols.From Live Strong"Sugar alcohols such as erythritol are difficult for the body to digest, which can cause digestive problems if you eat too much. Symptoms include diarrhea, gas and bloating. The amount needed to cause symptoms varies greatly based on your individual tolerance. Some find that even small amounts of sugar alcohols upset their stomach, while others can tolerate higher amounts before they experience gastrointestinal symptoms."Until you've tasted this Stevia you aren't qualified to judge Stevia as a sweetener.What it's good for:Tea - Green Black pu-er Chai you name it and it works great.Great to boost the sweetness of any Fruit Drink Such as Cranberry JuiceGreat to boost the sweetness of any fruit such as Grape Fruit, or Black Berries, Blue Berries, StrawberryGreat to sweeten Yogurt, Cottage Cheese and FruitSmoothies etc..Great with VanillaWhat it's not good for:Coffee- Aargh Tastes Horrible Alone.Hot ChocolateYes this product is more expensive then the commodity products but it's also much more expensive to manufacture and the marketers cost is higher too.Try it!As the old saying goes,  you get what you pay for.
Light reading, a little predictable. But sometimes you don't feel like a complicated book.

Update after around 40 to 50 hour Burn In:All week long I've been burning them in. Used a program from Jbuds butbut mostly just playing them overnight with a Classic Rock Station from Slacker going.There is definitely a difference in sound. They keep getting better.I compared them again against my Sony's and realized that the Sony's aren't picking upnuances of the instruments. Also initially the treble sounds were muddy, that muddyness is going away.Will continue to burn them in for another week until I have around 100 hours on them.My impressions of the Earbuds are that they are incredible on the Treble and Bass Instruments etc.But I've noticed that the instrumentals often comes through stronger than the vocals. This is across different Gendres of music.It's like you hear all the Instruments Clearly and in the forefront but the vocals are in back of them. I haven't figured outyet if I like this or not. In one sense I'm listening to music in a way that I've never heard it before, but on the other sideI'm accustomed to voices being in the forefront.By the way Jazz and Classic and Opera are tremendous.++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++Just got these in today and ergonomically these are the finest earbuds that I've ever seen or owned.I'm a loop em over the ear guy. I learned a long time ago that it's the most secure way of wearing earbuds.If you don't like to wear your earbuds looped over the ear. Move on these aren't for you.These have a stiff loop that feels secure and comfortable. One of my complaints has always been that if I take a earplug out of my ear to listen the earbud will out. Not with these. The loop will hang from my ear.My second major complaint is that I always have trouble finding the buttons on the earbuds. I have a Moto X so I knew ahead of time that I wouldn't be able to use the volume buttons.  No problem, on my Android phone I found a program called " Head set Button". The way I have it set is that I press the center twice and the volume goes down to a set limit, I set it at 45% then it automatically goes up until you stop it by pressing the button another time. Works even better then using a 3 button controlWhat is outrageous about this headset and no one has remarked on it, is that it not only has a center button but also clicking right and left side simultaneosly does a center click, If you look carefully you'll see a deep indentation, when you press the indentation you either push the button orthe Plus Minus buttons simultaneously. Is that cool or what. This is the easiest darned button that I've ever used. It's just so easy to find.Finally the headset has nice long cord. I like to put my phone on my desk, in my car etc and with the long cord I don't feel constricted.Now for the bad, I'm not an audiophile, just an average Joe, but I compared the sound to my $20.00 Sony Earbuds and truthfully my they may have been the same or gulp maybe my Sony's a little better until reaching highest volumes. But I'm not disparing,  before buying these I read an article in a Audiophile Magazine where they changed the review on these after burning them in for a week non stop. So for the next week it's burn in time, I'll be running them almost 24 hours a day,  and I hope to return to this page with an update telling how wonderful they sound.Based on Build Quality, 3 year warranty and the outrageous ergonomics even if the audio doesn't improve, these are a keeper!

Hurray, this review has the most helpfuls of any negative review also the most unhelpfuls.I'm happy that I could make even 1 person aware of the defects in these headset. The most important reviews are the ones that help others to avoid making a mistake [For their situation] or reinforce the decision to buy because the defect doesn't affect the buyer.Everyone has a opinion about the star system. My opinion is that if what you buy didn't work out for you and that the reasons weren't disclosed on the description or on the manufacturers page, then it's your responsibility to make others aware of the shortcomings.Sennheiser does not have a updated compatibility page for compatibility with different phones. Their page states that it will work with most smartphones. No where on the internet was it disclosed that not even the middle button wouldn't work with certain phones. I extensively researched these before buying them. I read articles, reviews etc.. and information about incompatibility wasn't available. I even asked a sales rep on a  site specializing in Headphones if just the middle button would work and he said "Yes".Verbatim from the Sennheiser site it says "Samsung Galaxy, Sony, Htc, other tablets and smartphones." I though I fit into other category. My expectation was just for the middle button to work. These are proprietary buttons designed for certain phones, if you don't own one of those then be careful.My second issue with the Headset is that the location of the Microphone on this Headset is proprietary and not normal. It is positioned higher then any other headset that I've ever tried. While fine if wearing under ear, when worn over the ear it was exactly 1/2 inch below my earlobe. I've owned at least 10 headsets from different manufacturers and this is the first time I've encountered the mic being located less then 3 inches below the earlobe. Maybe this is common on high end headsets, I'm not sure.I loved these In Ear Headphones, the sound even without break in was superb and rich sounding. I found them to be very comfortable.If I had a Samsung Phone I'd give them a 2 Star. If I had a Samsung and didn't wear looped  over the ear I'd give a 5 Star. The position of the microphone was a deal-breaker.My expectations weren't that high:In my Moto X, I wasn't expecting all 3 buttons to work, but just the center 1 as with every other Android Headset and Apple Headset that I tried. I was expecting not to have the volume controls, but  thought that the middle button at least would work. With a middle button I can use a program like headset control to  raise and lower headset volume using just the one button. Most importantly I can pause the Music. On my Moto X none of the buttons worked. By the way the plug is thin and easily plugged into my phone, so this is not an issue of case blocking complete contact of Headset Plug.My expectation for the mic was that it might be a little high as many headphones not specified for looping over the ear, but not only 1/2" below my earlobe is not normal.I would highly recommend these Earphones to a Samsung, Sony, or HTC user who doesn't wear them looped over the ear. As stated previously the sound is very rich. I absolutely hated returning them.But if you own a Moto X No Way, or Smartphone that is not Samsung, Sony or HTC, then be careful. If you wear looped over the ears then this headset is definitely not for you.

Update:Caution, these cables are sensitive. I've ruined two of them because my phone fell and this ended upbending the Micro Connectors. I'll dock a star for that. Update: Day 12 the microphone stopped working. Returning to buy Sennheiser Momentum.Should mention that I didn't abuse these at all. Very disappointed.++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++I found these very uncomfortable and was about ready to do a return, then I tried http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00GJPFS20/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1with these earbuds they are very comfortable and stay in the ear. Sound is great too.If link doesn't show just look up  " Veritas Memory Foam Earphone Tips Foam Tips (Fits 2.5mm-3.5mm  Size Medium.this fit the headphone perfectly and turned an uncomfortable product into something I can sleep with. Literally, I fell asleep listening to audible and woke up with my Earbuds still in my ear and no discomfort.By the Way:Found the Klipsch R6i online at an office supply store for $80.00 . This is one of those times when Amazon doesn't have the best price.

Update after 3 week of ownership:If I have one gripe it's that they try to protect your ears, so if you are using a headset and put the volume past a point, a warning comes up and you have to press OK. Not a deal breaker. By the way sounds great on my Klipsch Speakers.The system has a graphic equalizer. I changed the setting to Full Featured, and Ambient and the sound improved [to my ears] by leaps and bounds. Turns out to cater to Bass Lovers who are in vogue the default system setting is enhanced bass if you have headset with good bass that's overkill. Probably would sound great as is on studio monitor style.+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++This is a review about the Moto X in general.Just received my Moto-X Gen 1 phone using Republic Wireless and I'm impressed as heck.I'm switching over from an Iphone 4s. I had nothing but trouble on Android and went to Iphone 4s around 2 years back and have been very happy except for one major issue.The lowest cost programs use the Sprint Towers and my house is a Grey Spot, tower just doesn't work well . I started with a Moto E for my Daughter $100.00 for the phone and $10.00 a month for unlimited Text , Calling, but Internet only through Wifi.Her phone comes in and I'm amazed. Her $100.00 phone had a screen that was way bigger then my Iphone 4s and she was receiving and making calls without issue from the house.I did the math and figured out I could buy a Moto X get a unlimited 3g plan and save around $15.00 a month which will pay off the difference in selling price of used Iphone 4s and New Moto in 7 months.Let's talk about the Moto X in general.Android has finally come of Age. I like this phone more than the Iphone 4s. The screen is way bigger but the form factor isn't much larger.Seems around as zippy too.Suggestion to new Android users. The trick is don't add too many 3rd party apps and just work with Standard Google and Google Apps that comes with phone. If you add launchers and too much customization programs you are going to slow down the phone. The beauty of the Moto X is that the devision of Motorola that makes it was bought by Google. So the phone has a very pure android interface.The custom Programs Added by me are as follows:Shake- This cool program let's me shake the phone and have Google Now Appear. Move it back forth and recents show up, shake on the side and phone turns on.How cool is that.Giganticon -AWidget which allows you to make front screen Icons big without messing with the Launcher. Basically it just adds an icon with a shortcut and you can adjust the size of the Icon.Swift Key-A keyboard that rocks, bigger then the standard Google Keyboard. Predictive text.To Do Reminder from App Innovations is excellent reminder/alarm program.Battery Widget Reborn - Shows your battery % agesThen I added the usual, Audible, Slacker, Waze, Yelp NetflixHere is what I love.Touchless ControlsI have always hated having to push buttons on my phone. I just want it to do what I want it to do without me touching it. Google and Motorola really nailed it on the Moto X ,Initially I was hesitant about Touchless because you have to say OK Google Ready. Google is invasive enough without me having to say their name 20 times a day. Also the phrase is long. I looked on the internet and found a loophole.There is an alternative to saying "OK Google Ready", looks like the engineers at Motorola left a Backdoor to use a simpler and shorter phrase "OK Moto". This shorter sounding phrase sounds better to my ears. It was very easy to implement when you train it to say" OK Google Ready", just say "OK Moto" instead. It'll pick it up and memorize.I went a step further and added a program called Shake and by shaking the phone the Google now interface comes up. But the Ok Moto still comes in handy when driving.Touchless Control Rules. I don't have to hit any buttons to get into voice commands. No more pressing button for 4 seconds to wake up Siri. To make calls or open/switch to apps Just say "Ok Moto" Call [Person] or open [Program] No more of the two second press to get Iphones Siri to respond.I'm finding that Google Now is around as accurate as Siri, also they have a setting to personalize it IE Learn and if you leave that setting on it appears to keep getting more accurate.Next Moto adds a feature called assist to the phone. It detects when I'm driving and if someone calls me, It says [Caller] is on the phone do you want to answer. HOW COOL IS THAT. And of course when I'm driving using the Touchless "Ok Moto" I can do most things without ever having to reach over and touch the phone. This is both convenient and much safer then reaching over and pushing a button for two seconds..I give the Phone a Five Star rating because Motorola and Google have nailed it on providing a great user experience.Though it may not have the Latest Greatest Processor, or the Highest resolution, I find it zippy and doing the job.Apple you goofed, the Iphone line doesn't pay attention to the touchless experience. Until you integrate touchless controls into your phones, Motorola and Android have surpassed you.

Mr Two Thumbs put this on with no problemsI must have looked at every screen protector out there.I'm Mr Two Thumbs and was fearing putting on a protector. I decided against the ones that use the liquid because knowing me, I'd probably flood my new Phone.Yes it took me around 3-5 times with the same protector to get it right. But the protector is thick enough and not too sticky that I couldn't reseat it until I got it right. Bubbles were easily pushed out of the way. I used my fingers mostly. Found it better then the credit card method.Plastic is thick so looks like I'll get decent protection out of it.

UPDATE AFTER 3 DAYS USE:I had to dock it 2 stars,it doesn't have a voice button. [DealBreaker]So you can't switch to filling in by voice in many programs. Deinstalled and went with Swiftkey.+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++I bought the full version at the other place beginning with G.I love it, love it, love it.Great for Texting Challenge People. It's the biggest keys that you are going to find and if you goof up it figures out what you were going to type. They've changed it a lot since years ago and made it very user friendly.So if you are Mr Two Thumbs like me and constantly making errors, aren't that good at texting, and desire humungous keys to type on,  then this is the typing program for you. By the way in settings it let's you choose normal, medium, and small.Also instead of needing to press the space bar, if you swipe right it makes the space.

Not for Prudes and not for those looking for a deep book.Decided to put my two cents in because I almost skipped an enjoyable read because of the bad reviews.Get the sample, either you'll be hooked on the book. Or like some others, you will be offended by the protagonist bedding down with two hot women and looking to find fault with the whole book. Me,  I'm not offended, wish I were him. Ha!This is light, fast paced, reading and if you like the sample you'll enjoy the series.1/2 way through the sample and as soon as it's done, I'll buy the book.

I got the Carbide Series White and Black and it's Beautiful. I just put together the cleanest build ever. There are no cables showing through the windows and every wire is strung through the correctly placed grommets with precision.This case has full tower capability in a small form factor. [Drawback in Negatives section].It will accept a Dh-15 Fan [One of the Tallest Fans Ever] Extended Motherboards, Extra Long Video Cards, Extra long Power supplies. And all this in the form factor of a corpulent Mini Tower.Now about the size. I compared it to a minitower on a co-workers desk and it was only 1 inch higher. It's probably twice as wideIt is the first high power computer ever that I was able to put on the desk at my house. Any Mid or Full size tower is simply too highand deep. Also for stability reasons I wouldn't feel comfortable.Transporting this case was a dream compared to my Mid Tower.  While not a really light case,  it's a lot lighter then myAll metal Haf 922 was. I would not suggest that anyone looking for a mobile case purchase this. Too much plastic and plexiglass to scuff and break.Especially in the White and Black model.When transporting from my office [Where I assembled it] to my house I used the black cloth cover that came with it. Soit arrived immaculate. Kudos to you Corsair for including the cloth cover. A necessity for a machine with exposed white plastic partsand a immense plexiglass type side window.Putting in my car was easy and I followed this technique.I moved the passenger side chair all the way forward. Then I put it in the back with thefront facing backwards. Then I moved the passenger side front seat all the way back and reclined it.Perfect, because this is cubular the center of gravity is stable and it didn't' fall over.In addition carrying it around, I found it easier to hold ,the lower profile box shape is just easier to carry.Now to the negatives.1st and Biggest Negative -Possible Deal Breaker. The biggest drawback for some would be that it has limited 3.5" and 5.25"  Slots. My build all fit.The Two  5.25 taken by a BluRay DVD Burner and a Lamptron Fan ControllerThe Two  3.5" by a 1tb Velociraptor and a 1 tb CaviarMy 540Gb EVO SSD Drive taking 1 of the 6 SSD SlotsI believe with a little mickey mousing I could add another 2 3.5" drives,.2nd Negative Possible Deal Breaker- and a reason this case may end up $30.00 to $100.00 more expensive.Warning Will Robinson the DVD Burner is positioned  sideways and many drives won't' operate that way. in normal position. I found I could tip the case at an angleand the burner would open. Then put it back to normal and the burner had no problem working sideway. To operate normally you need a slot burner instead of tray burner and theydon't make those in 3 1/2 or 5 1/4 size. So you need to get a Slimline Slot Burner a frame by Digistor and cables around $100.00. Or one company sells it pre-assembled for $110.00Any way who really wants to be tipping a high end system. I don't need a superior player for the most part. So I ended up buying an slimline external USB DVD Writer for $30.00. I almost never watch BD movies so I'll leave the BD Player in and just use [by using the tip method] a few times a year for Blu-Ray ovies.Another thought, if you are into CD - DVD Rom Copying etc and have lot's of burners then this is not the case for you.3rd Negative: Possible Deal Breaker - If you plan to move this case around a lot.  lot's of plastic. This is not a sturdy and indestructible definitely do not go drop kicking it around the fields.4th Negative- Annoying but not a deal breaker. If I'm going to spend this kinda money on a case, I want my build [through the window] to be immaculate. Well the Motherboard 24Pin Connectors closest Grommet Top Grommet is blocked by the 5.25" Cage. Their is no way you can get those connectors to slip behind that cage. YOu have my motherboard and you want perfection then you have to remove the cage.I'm telling you almost the longest part of the build was dissasembling the case to get that rack out.Attn: Corsair, if you are listening, your manual is really lousy. There are no instructions on how to do this. So I had to figure out through Trial and error. I repeat your manual sucks! Not a clue. Hey if my whole build is going to be seen through that huge side window it's gotta look awesome and the cables be arranged perfectly. I would think anyone buying this case isn't going for a mediocre build.Removing the 5.25 cage was a necessity for me. In addition, it's hard to secure the 5 1/4 in the slot. I forgot to do it while open and I think I'm just going to use a temporary style glue to hold them in because taking that rack out is a bear of a job.I was really conflicted on whether to give this product a 4 star or 5 Star. Really I wanted to give it a 4.5 but that doesn't exist.So while pondering this dilemma,  I went out and looked at the Assembled system  , the white on black [Sharp as heck], and the huge Plexiglass window [showing my cleanest build ever]. I just had to give it a 5 star.After taking it home and seeing how it fit on my desk and the great trans portability I see no need to change the 5 star. There is no other case that I'veseen that offers so much in such a small form factor.As long as you can live with the pausity of 3.5" and 5.25" bays and aren't looking for indestructibility, you will be very happy owning this case.

This is a monster of unit. It's huge. Luckily I have a Haf 922 which is a very roomy midtower. I checked compatibility first and it fit. Be careful and make sure that your case is big enough because this unit is big.The reason why I tried this is that after 3 years or so my H-55 went bad on me. I didn't like that on opening the case I saw the slightest condensation of chemicals on the side. Also the stories about the ones that go bad and irrigate your system make me shudder.So I went looking on the Internet for the best Air Cooled Fan around and this is the one that had the best reviews and benchmarks.I bought the  highest stock voltage CPU on the market AMD 9590 and wasn't sure if this Cooler would be strong enough to keep temps down.Normally I do my own work but I didn't even attempt to do the install this myself. This Cooler is just so Big and my CPU so small. I was right because It took over an hour for the guy at Fry's to assemble and install it.His initial words to me were. Shouldn't this chip be water cooled. Won't it run too hot. I told him that I had investigated and that this Air Cooler keeps up with the higher end stock water coolers and if it didn't keep the CPU cool, it's on me.Finally we fired it up and ran 8 cores of Prime 95, Small Units Maximum Heat. The CPU Socket didn't go higher than 55" C and the Core CPU was in the 40s' C Wow!!This Fan disproves that Stock Air Cooled is inferior to Stock Water Cooled.Quiet, did I mention that this Air Cooler is very quiet.

I've held up posting a review for 4 months because I wanted to see the durability of this Remote. It's been great. Haven't had to change  the batteries. And it's saved me aggravation a few times.Reason why I bought this is that I have a Stimulus Collar with two pieces. 1 is the remote and the other is the collar. Well the remote kept getting misplace. I'm very organized with my stuff. But with 3 children. You can imagine the strange places it ends up. I lost the first one and after spending $80.00 to replace it found it in my back under the rear car seat.Every time it disappears I go looking with my keyfinder and I've found it in such odd places as, in the bathroom [Took off to give dog bath]. Under a bunch of papers in the living room. In back of the couch. [Fell behind cushion]. I can't tell you how much aggravation that the Key finder has saved me.My keys are all over the place and it's taken a licking and it keeps on beeping.Thumbs up to the KeyFinder.

My Radeon Saphire HD 5870 Fan broke and I replaced it with a EVGA GeForce GT 630 1024MB GDDR5,. I decided to return that card because it reacted badly with the Bio on the Asus Crosshair iV motherboard. While moving it around to different slots, I didn't notice that a screw had fallen onto the Motherboard. I noticed the fallen screw and like a lame brain fished it out while the Computer was running and fried my motherboard.I replaced the motherboard with a Gigabyte 990FXA-UD3 the problem went away but I had already initiated the return and I wasn't happy with the GT 630. It couldn't handle Crysis [The original].Did a lot of research and just couldn't bring myself to spend the extra $70.00 on the GTX-760. I bought my Asus GTX-660 at $185.00 delivered with tax. Anyway I was very hesitant about the install. I had read in other posts that Windows 7 64 Bit might have problems with it. Some said to use the Asus Drivers, and some said to use the Nvidia Drivers.Well I installed the card, with no problem then fired it up, and nothing on the screen, I have enough experience that before panicking I make sure everything is plugged in so i checked and sure enough, I had neglected to plug in the DVI plug for the monitor. Plugged it in and showed black screen. I waited a while then I turned off the computer [Hard Off] and fired it up.Computer fires up and the monitor looks perfect. The proper and most updated drivers from Nvidia were installed.I installed GPU Tweak and it wouldn't work on the card, Whenever I tried to change it wouldn't save. This may be because I used the Nvidia Drives and not the Asus. But I suspect that the settings are hardwired into the GPU Bios.  I installed Zotac Firestorm and played with it and according to furmark, I was able to increase the score in 1080p from 1888 ot 1960 or a 4% increase. More then that and crash. That extra 4% made a difference in Crysis at the toughest points.This card is enough for the majority of Gamers.Crysis is the torture test of games and I played 1920*1080 with antialiasing 2 and all high settings never going below 30 FPS with most of the time 40 to 60 FPS.My View1. It does use a 6 Pin Power Connector2. It is a long card but was a little shorter then my 58703. It is very quiet.4. My case has excellent Airflow and the card never went above 60" even when being benchmarked with Furmark5. I will repeat this card is very quiet and runs cool6. My experience is that it works flawlessly with Windows 7 64 Bit and the Nvidia Drives work great7. Overclocking this card was difficult when using Nvidia drivers but at it's stock speed it's very good.8. My plan is to run two of these in SLI supposedly two of these in SLI is equivalent to a $1000.00 + Card

I was skeptic and fully prepared to write a 1 star review and pan this product as a Fraud.First let me tell you how it works.It's nothing more than a rectangular plastic piece with the top side being a rubbery material that is the sharpening surface.You do nothing more than rub some shaving cream on it and then take your razor and push it forwards. The contact with therubbery surface aligns and sharpens the blades. Super easy.It comes with a stand. I put the sharpener in the center of the stand and then lean my razor up against it.Perfect for corners.Amazingly it works. I'm using it with inexpensive Fusion Blades from China so my cost savings aren't so high, but if I was using itwith the American Fusion Blade, this would pay itself off within the Year. In addition there is the benefit of a consistent shave each time.Positives1. It comes with a stand. I put it in the corner of my bathroom and no one bothers it. Mostly Sigh..2. It's very easy to use3. It works4. Same Shave every timeNegatives1. I wish that the stand was more customized, since it's designed for universal application that  won't happen.I used the same blade for 2 months and only had to change it because my wife cleaned the bathroom and left the stand outin the open. My daughter when curling her hair proceeded to knock it onto the ground, destroying the blade and my$175.00 Art of Shaving Razor Handle [Over 10 years old] Luckily I epoxyed the handle back together because Art of Shaving hadlowered the quality of there products and don't produce a heavy etched handle anymore.Normally my blades last around 2-3 weeks. Extending to 2 months without quality loss is pretty amazing.What impressed me is that every shave was the same.Normally the first shaves are great then slowly the blades dull and the shaves get harder.Then I change it when I start to get my first strong Rash, Razor Bumps, or cuts.I am using this sharpener before every shave and each shave is the same.By the way I use the Bigelow Italian Shaving Cream, Great stuff, slippery enough to not get cut andunslippery enough to allow the razor to cut the hair and not skip over. Perfect for the fusion.I have the worlds tenderest skin and toughest beard. I've went to professional barbers with straight bladerazors and ended up with irritation and cuts. So if I endorse the sharpening quality of this product thenit's a winner.One Tip.The first time I used it the razor had been in use a week and it kept maintained it at exactly the same setting.This time I used it from day one and it's shaving exactly like day one. So start using this immediately becausemy experience is that it maintains the sharpness of the blade. But doesn't sharpen it.

Let me start by saying that I only use them while relaxing so no comments on the durability. I have earbuds for when I'm on the move.These are a finer sound then I've ever heard from any earbud. They weigh very little and are very comfortable.They sound great on an Iphone 4s.I firmly believe that  these are great for listening to MP3 Sound and at around $30.00-$40.00 you won't be dissapointed.

Update after 1 month: The switch from TOTW was flawless, and since the switch her stools have been perfect, she eats less and a fortunately or unfortunately depending on how you look at it. This food has made her much more active. For my Girl it's  worked out very well health-wise and for me well I'm saving major bucks.++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++I've been feeding my 12 month old American Bulldog Petunia TOTW for the longest time.But I'm economizing and it's just too expensive. Well her bowels have always been a little loose on the TOTW Bison formula.I figured that this formula is close, the differences is that the main ingredient is Bone Meal instead of Meat and rice which I think she needs to bind her. Thus difference in price.So far the switch has been flawless, no diarrhea and we are at a 2 weeks and 50/50 mix, Actually, I'm not sure if it's coincidence but she has become much more active and requiring more exercise.So if TOTW becomes too expensive, this may be a good alternative. I picked up a 20 LB bag on amazon and am going to a brick and mortar store today and buying the 40 lb bag at $29.99 + Tax a way lower price then Amazon.

I have an space between my upper teeth that get's gunk caught in it and infected. I also may or may not have had tooth pain caused by a cavity. Not sure if it was pain transference.I was going to use Clove OIl which helps a little but is not too effective. But couldn't find it. So on a lark, I took this tea tree oil and rubbed it on the gum and on the tooth. Amazing, it instantly numbed it, much better then clove oil. Then when I woke up in the morning the infection and pain were gone.Now once or twice a week I put some drops on top of my toothbrush and/or floss it in. No infection since then. Oh and freshens up the mouth too!Use it in my Dandruff Shampoo to boost it, and haven't' had dandruff in ages.
I've found the plunger catches. It's almost like it needs lubrication or gets slightly out of alignment.Just doesn't match up to the quality that I've received from my Pharmacy.But usable.

These batteries don't have the lowest resistance off the charger. But they are workhorses.For example on my Mod running at .33 OHM on a fully charged battery I'll get approximately 3.4V this is on a battery that is 6 months old and I'll be replacing so a new battery may give better results. I'll come back and update after I buy a new set. [Soon]  My Sony 30 Amp battery that is around 6 month old but hardly used, possibly abused!  gives me a 3.6V on the same setup.The difference is that after 10-12 hours of vaping I'm at a level of around 3.2v and after 3-4 hours my Sony 30 Amp 2100 Battery is toast.They have only lasted me around 7 Months but remember that I'm at very high tolerances and a 7 month lifespan is very good for a battery that is being used at close to it's maximum tolerance and that at times has been over-discharged.They are rated for 10 Amp Continuous and 16 or 17 Amp Burst. So check your resistance on the Ohm Chart. My preferred .33 Ohm is within the Burst Tolerances. If you sub ohm below .27 Ohm than you are beyond the tolerance of the battery and use at your own risk.

Being a huge Greek mythology fan I get excited when I stumble on books that use it as the backdrop of a story. The Olympic Cove series is one of these books. So far there are three installments out, this being the third. Each book can be read as stand alones however, it is best to read this according to their publications. The plot is quite convoluted as well, so start with the first. Thankfully, Nicola Cameron did such a good job, I read the second book without getting lost.Deep Water is not an MM, this is an MMF story involving Poseidon, Amphitrite and their long lost agapetos. The prophecy was clear, they the god and his wife were to have a third but finding that third would mean the beginning of the end of happiness. The series opens with Poseidon and Amphi separated for about seven thousand years. The loss of their agapetos seven millennia past drove a wound between the mates they never once thought could ever be healed. When the Fates inform Poseidon they used an old but never forgotten thread, the news spark the renewal of hope. Unfortunately, there is a weakness: the old soul is human.The story is told from three main points of views as well as the POVs of some of the more important side characters. Where once the agapetos was female, now it is male so the confusion is mainly on the characters themselves.Thetis is still around, unfortunately, and is getting meaner and more cunning. Her interference on the lives of Poseidon's territory is causing havoc on the environment and it is frustrating to read the gods and goddesses battle it out then deal with fighting on another day. Poseidon trying to right a wrong done eons ago is also wearing on him especially when his plans get waylaid by miscommunication and hardheadedness. The author managed to integrate the mythology into a contemporary setting and make it work. It was a fun read. In the end, there is an HEA and rightly so, the getting to that point was an interesting read of erotica and action with a dash of the mytho/sci-fi.The only thing I should warn hardcore MM readers out there, this is an MMF and so involves scenes with between the the men and the men with Amphi. Yes, readers, there are quite a few MF scenes here as well as a lone FF. I must point out, it was a necessary read and it answered a whole lot of questions left open in the previous books.

I am a fan of all things sci-fi but I am also a huge nerd for the Greek Gods . Strange isn't it, to refer to the mythological beings when reviewing a science fiction/fantasy novel? Truth is, I was reminded of those myths even when the setting is in a galaxy different from ours and involving advanced technology such as those we see in Star Trek and Star Wars. You can be sure that Star Gate is thrown into the mix as well. It is the interfering beings, though, that made me think Greek Mythology.This is set in a time and space where the highly advanced beings guised themselves as gods and seemingly did not interfere with the lowly lifeforms they created or took a hand in developing. Seemingly for just like the gods, they interfered only when the world or universe was in trouble and so had to took a hand in fixing stuff. In the meantime, we see a galaxy dominated by a volatile and warlike female race who enslaved men for their pleasure, needs and service. These women remind me of the Amazons of old. Caught in the middle of it all is a slaver, Taine, a red skinned being much resembling the demons of legend. He buys a young man, Sunshine and gains an apprentice, Tanner. The relationship that develops between them is peppered with BDSM elements that are not BDSM per se because it is a cultural thing going on here and Taine is just doing his job.This is a huge tale told and there are a lot of characters who come in and out of the story which could confuse the reader. However, I am quite used to this type of story telling because, again, I am used to the way myths are told. There are side characters who pop in and out because they are needed to pop in and get out as soon as they did their interference into the lives of these three men. The god-like beings are the main culprits here for they are interfering busybodies and prone to arguing with each other much like when the gods hold their meetings on Olympus.There is action, speculation, violence and elements that may trigger some readers but these are all essential to the telling of the tale. However, once the epilogue closed, I wondered. There has to be a follow up to this story, there are a lot of things dropped that opened a Pandora's Box of questions and they would involve Taine specifically. Also, someone is not done with Taine so I am left even more curious.Overall, if you like sci-fi and myth mashups, this is the right one for you. Written very well to open the imagination, the images that come to mind as the story unfolds can be quite intriguing and graphic.

When I got the draft for this ARC, I prepared myself for a good read with loose ends that may need to be ironed out. The usual stuff one would expect from an ARC. Surprisingly, this particular work of Etienne read like a retail copy.This book opens a few years after Clyde and Bobby have had their required time in Atlanta. Carlyle, (a.k.a. Clyde) is about to take his board exams while Bobby is ready to retire from the city lifestyle even if his career is at that point many only dreamed of. Both ready to turn from the city, they look to home and Blue Ridge. Their lives passing daily in an almost humdrum way and the only excitement is looking over plans for their new home overlooking a ridge with orchards either side of the view. It's a nice boring life that is, until a worker stumbles into two skeletons from what was obviously a moonshine shack. It should have been an open and shut case but instead, they stumble into a troubled sheriff's office and the real Carlyle is back. As their day to day experiences become more interesting every day, both Bobby and Carlyle begin to wonder the kind of future they are about to face.Set in the days when gay couples were sneered at and beaten up, Bobby and Carlyle live the life as close cousins who choose to live and work together. The support of their immediate family and good friends make them realize they are more lucky than most. When they see they could spread the love around, they don't think twice and face a new life.The story of Bobby and Carlyle is familiar in a way. It reminds me strongly of the relationship between George and Mike of the Avondale series who are very strong and masculine. They are never open to public displays of affection as they knew they had to protect themselves from bigotry of the days but never fail to speak and act their love with each other in the privacy of their bedroom.No, this is not a romance, far from it but there is romance in private between the men. This is more a story of how they are living their lives and how they face up to responsibilities. They make decisions together as well as support each other in every way possible. They are partners. No, there's no romance. Just two men loving each other.

This is a trilogy but there are only two books out so far. This review is based on the first two books.Em went into a relationship that soon turned sour and abusive. Not in the physical sense as readers are more familiar with, but the mental and emotional kind. His partner of five years made him feel less than what he was and it came to the point where he could no longer think past his insecurities for fear of failure. The one good thing is Em's best friend, Joss, who not only made sure to get him bodily out of that relationship from hell but to get him back on his feet. This story takes place around two years later when Joss decides that Em is ready and so makes the moves and talks for him.Penn was standing in as a barista for his mother's coffee shop when in walks a very interesting but quiet man. It is the friend, Joss, however, who makes sure Penn sets his eyes on that quiet man and both men make plans. Penn arrives at Em's place ready to take him out on a date. He did not expect Joss to be there taking prom pictures of them. Neither did he expect Em to come with a bit of baggage. Instead of making him disinterested, however, Penn's protective instincts kick in and the date proceeds. Their first date is what sets the pace for this first installment. Penn makes sure to gain Em's trust and in the process, delights in Em's intelligence and courage. Breaking down Em's barriers sounds easy enough, but to actually step into the personal space is a different matter altogether when the body is willing but the mind screams NO!Book two opens with Em and Penn in a trusting but budding relationship. Em's trust in Penn is on sure footing and Penn's love for Em is verbalized and expressed openly. The problem is Em's inability to say the words back but his actions speak louder. Penn is set to wait out patiently for that time when Em does say the words but is in no hurry. It is when the parents from hell call Em does Penn realize the why's of Em's resistance to saying the L word.Em and Penn embark on this particular journey filled with distrust for the parents who abandoned Em. In the process, they meet an unusual character who, with his dog, enter the house where a reading of a will is set. Why are the parents all set to embrace Em once more? Why was Em even called in? At the end of this installment, readers are left with a lot of questions that are sure to be answered in the third and final book.The back to back read is what made these stories work for me. If I had read these months apart, I would not even have bothered. This is the weakness of a trilogy story for it sets a certain pace but is too short and the HFN is hanging. Patience is sometimes not a virtue readers hold on to. That said, I would recommend the reading of this trilogy like I did, back to back. Thankfully, even with just the two books so far, it is enough to gain my curiousity meter pinging and wanting to find out how it will all pan out for Em and Penn.Note: Joss is a very interesting supporting character who steals the show when he does show up. It would be interesting to read his story later on, should the author deem it wise to write his story. Now that, I am impatient for.
