It is truly a fascinating world, and I look forward to reading about more adventures there.

By the Lake was a virtual unknown for me, since Id never heard of Ainsley Peace before. However, I love taking chances on new writers and discovering their talent, so I gave this one a whirl. Im sure glad I did! Peaces work is inspired by Agatha Christie, one of my favorite mystery writers, and By the Lake has a definite Christie-esque feel to it.The characters within the book are compelling and well-developed, and the plot has plenty of twists and turns to keep you guessing. The story starts off slowly, but quickly picks up pace until youre breathlessly reading page after page, anxious to find out what happens next.This book is Ainsley Peaces debut novel, and it shows quite a bit of promise for this budding young writer. I look forward to seeing more of her work, and I encourage any and all mystery fans to pick up a copy of By the Lake to enjoy.

"Solutionist" is the start of what should certainly be an extremely adventurous and action-packed series, the "Demonic Council" series of books. Author Kayvan D mixes fresh dialogue with well-developed characters and an amazing storyline to craft a book that will entertain readers from beginning to end. The book is fast-paced, and is truthfully difficult to put down until you've finished it. That would be my only complaint about the book--it was so good that I didn't sleep until I was done with the book! Kayvan D might be a relatively new author, but he certainly has a compelling voice with some fantastic stories to tell. I look forward to more of the Demonic Council books.

"Ayatollah's Wife," the first book in the Eruption series, is a book that you won't be able to put down. Kayvan D brings an imaginative spin to the idea of women's place in the battle between Heaven and Hell, and he also weaves together an amazing mixture of historical facts with imaginative fiction. This book is certain to entertain even the most discerning readers, with intriguing plot twists and wonderfully developed characters. The dialogue between the characters is fresh and natural, and the variety of times and places covered by the "stories within the story" are both imaginative and accurate to historical records.

Times of Victory: Living Without Limits is an inspirational book that everyone who wants to live a life fulfilled in the promises of God should read. Pedro Valdez shows you, in the page of this book, a life fulfilled through the power of God. Times of Victory provides fantastic Biblical stories along with anecdotes from Pedros own life and ministry, which show the perseverance of a man who knows he is justified through Jesus Christ. This is a quick read, and it is one that will inspire you to take your faith to the next level and share the Gospel with others. Highly recommended!

Danielle Raceys The Wisherman is a touching and insightful book about the trouble special gifts can cause, and a teenagers attempt to fit in despite his uniqueness. The book also deals heavily with the emotional problems brought on by child school prisons (otherwise known as boarding schools), especially those that are run by power-hungry administrators. Youll find your self laughing, crying, and screaming with rage at various turns as you read this book, as Racey draws you deep into the characters lives and encourages you to care about what happens to them. A very well-conceived concept, flawlessly executed.

Something Stinks in Deep Cove is a really fun mystery. Its well-written, and jam-packed with excitement. The pacing is excellent, and the characters really drive the story along. Grant T. Reed really has a flair for storytelling, and he tells an excellent tale with Something Stinks in Deep Cove.Whats even better about this mystery is that its both mystery and fantasy. Youve got dragons, magic, golems, and other staples of the fantasy genre to go along with the mystery genre. Its a two-for-one deal in sheer entertainment. I enjoyed every page, and couldnt put the book down until it was done. Im looking forward to reading the rest of the books in the Vellian Mysteries series.

As a married man, Attract a Girlfriend didnt seem like it would be too applicable to me at first glance. However, reading this book has helped me to rekindle some of the spark in my marriage, since it has helped me to better talk to my wife and understand her point of view on a lot of things. There is quite a bit of information in this book that would have been helpful when I was on the dating scene, and almost all of it remains relevant once youre off the market and are with that girl of your dreams. The book is well-written and easy to read, so I strongly recommend it.

The Masculine Mind: Alpha Male Life Lessons on Careers, Money, Relationships & Women is the ultimate resource for men of all walks of life in our society. If you read it with an open mind to self-improvement, this book will help you better learn how to succeed at your chosen career, manage your money, and have more successful relationships with others. Whether youre married or a bachelor, this book has tons of great insight and tips to help you be a better man. The book is logically organized, well-written, and chock full of sound advice. I would recommend this book to any man, whether they think theyve got it all or theyre struggling to understand what manhood is about in todays day and timethe book has valuable knowledge for all men!

Savage Run is one of my favorite books of 2014. Part of this is because Im a huge lover of dystopian novels, but the book is mostly one of my favorites because it is executed with flawless attention to detail and the art of the written word. The world created within the pages is definitely our own, but significantly changed by the catastrophic event that has created a world with an amazingly detailed and original caste system and many technological advances that put the book sometime in the future.The book gets your attention quickly, and holds it firmly with a storyline that is original and inspiring. The characters are very well developed, and the pacing was top notch. All in all, a great book by an amazing author.

Lilyred is an intriguing book, and was a first delve for me into metaphysical fiction. I found the storylines were superbly woven together, and the character development throughout the book was top notch. I was firmly drawn into the tales, flipping from page to page almost in a frenzy, anxious to read what was going to happen next. The writing is above and beyond anything Id hoped for, and the imagery was vivid and fantastic. If you are a fan of books that provoke deep thought, youll definitely enjoy Lilyred. I look forward to reading the rest of the books in The Aquarius Series, and following Kewalnam Christs sure-to-be illustrious writing career.

Truth Insurrected: Declassified is the perfect follow-up companion to Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project. Packed with facts and tidbits of Daniel Douglass history and experiences, the companion provides thought-provoking insight into key aspects of Douglass Truth Insurrected: The Saint Mary Project. Well-placed excerpts from the book are interspersed with background information on some of the theories and controversies surrounding UFOs and other conspiracy theories.If you havent read The Saint Mary Project yet, read itand then read this excellent companion. Once youre done with the Declassified companion, if youre anything like me, youll find yourself reading The Saint Mary Project a second time!

If you struggle with trying to be more productive, it's important to learn the little tips and tricks (AKA "hacks") that will help you be more productive. That's where this book, "Getting Things Done with 100+ Instant Productivity Hacks" comes in. This short and easy-to-read books provides a wealth of tools for your productivity toolbox, with sections ranging from how to be more productive at work to how to boost your productivity by changing your way of thinking. You get tips and tricks on how to boost your productivity by changing what and how you eat, hacks for at home, and one of the best collections of technology hacks I've ever seen within a single book (although there are not many GTD apps listed). All in all, this is a terrific book that is sure to help you improve your productivity.

A Students Key to Ancient Greek Thought is exactly what the title implies, and does an excellent job of providing that. The book is meticulously researched, and offers the reader an outstanding level of information on ancient Greek philosophy. The text is clearly written and provides knowledge on all of the great minds of the ancient Greek times, such as Socrates, Plato, Aristotle, and others. G. A. Rauche has organized this book in a sensible way, addressing first the principal features in Greek mythological thought, then the characteristics of Greek philosophy, and then drilling down into the various schools of thought from ancient Greek times. The book is detailed enough to be used by homeschoolers, high school students, or even college students.

Who Done ItFor Nothing was a new, refreshing experience for me. Ive always loved private investigator and crime novels, but Id never read a crime novel set in the 30s before. Mitzi and Mallett are an amazing pair, and get into some fantastic exploits together, and the strength of her female character was nothing short of amazing.The book is chock full of intrigue and mystery, as Mitzi and Mallett struggle to solve a homicide case. Mitzis strength and perseverance in helping lead Mallett to the right suspect is wonderful, and the interaction between the characters is authentic and real. Ill definitely be picking up more in this series!

Mischief, Mayhem, the Blue Men of Minch is a wonderful story, and an amazing mixture of various different genres. The author points out in the description that the book is great for people who love the fantasy (nonsense) of the likes of Terry Pratchett as well as those who enjoyed Nancy Drew or the Hardy boys books of years gone by, and the book is definitely well-grounded in all of those genres. Equal parts fantasy and suspense, the book entertains from beginning to end. The character development is wonderful, and the plot has just enough suspense and twists in it to keep things interesting. This is a strong book, and an excellent addition to your Kindle library!

Id never heard of Zentangle before reading this book, but the idea of it intrigued me. For as long as I can remember, Ive doodled on blank sheets of paper or the margins of paper I was taking notes on, and Ive done it either out of boredom or stress relief. Learning that there was a meditative art form for what Id already been doing was awesome, and Ken Itos Zentangle Basics opened my eyes to the benefits and methods to get the most out of my doodling.Zentangle will definitely help you relax and calm down, and Zentangle Basics will show and teach you everything you need to know to get started. I highly recommend this book for anybody looking for an introduction to using their doodling to effectively get all of the benefits from their doodling.

Whether youre interested in New Age stuff or not, Auras: How to See, Feel & Know is an enlightening book. There is a ton of information about what auras are and are not pegged to the pages of this book, and Embrosewyn Tazkuvel does an excellent job educating the reader about auras.What makes this book different from most, is it lays out a personal journey of coming to see and understand auras. By the end of the book, youre liable to be a believer, if you werent already, and youll be on the way to reading and understanding auras on your own. I say this from personal experienceI was definitely not a believer in auras before reading, but after readinglets just say, with pun fully intended, that my eyes have been opened!

Keys of Zephyer is a terrific adventure story for children. The characters and settings are richly described, using a vocabulary that will challenge young readers just enough to keep them interested. The storyline is fast-paced and adventurous, with all of the action that you and your younger readers might be looking for. Chairman Zeddy is definitely a skilled writer, and my children and I are looking forward to more of his work. The book is so good that my kids are reading it over and over again, and talking about it the same way we all talk about The Princess Bride.

Romance novels can often be formulaic and unrealistic, and I think Denzel Weidner must know thatbecause Coming Home is far from both. Instead, the novel is a unique love story that follows some all-too-real paths, and features fantastic plot and character development along with a compelling story that will suck you in and have you coming back for more.The chemistry between JD and Melanie is nothing short of electrifying, and you can sense both of them struggling to come to terms with the fact that each has finally met the one. You are constantly left wondering, though, if they actually will come to terms with that realization, or if theyll keep wandering around. Suspenseful and wonderful! Im quite looking forward to more of Weidners books!

If youre looking for a unique diet that actually allows you to eat the foods you enjoy, check out The Old Chocolate Diet by Diana Artene. Artene has developed a common sense way to manage what you eat without forcing you to sacrifice the foods you love. Instead, you eat sensible amounts of the food you want, when youre hungry, but only eat enough to make you feel full. You wont feel compelled to binge eat, because you wont be depriving yourself of the good flavor that gourmet food brings to the table (pardon the pun). This book is well written, and the diet plan is laid out in a way that is easy to understand and follow.

Monks, Meatballs and Machine Guns is a fantastic memoir of Greg Vitranos time in a military school. LaSalle Academy is portrayed in vivid detail, and the dialogue and stories of Vitranos exploits inside and outside of the school are at times funny, terrifying, and heartwarming. Vitrano has a flair for prose, and he weaves words together in a way that is almost magical.If you are looking for a very engaging and entertaining book to read, this is a fine choice. This is especially true if youre a history buff with an interest in life in the 70s, when the book takes place. Youll get an excellent idea of what life was like for these juvenile delinquents who wound up in one of the toughest schools in America.

This is a pretty nice, retractable dog leash for a SMALL dog as the leash is made of black grosgrain RIBBON. The ribbon is very slim and the flat design is great for re-tractability but I am not sure, in the long run, how it will stand up to lots of use.It does have a nice ERGONOMIC DESIGN and extends up to 16 ft.  I wouldn't want to use this leash with a 40 lb. dog though. It features a NON SLIP GRIP and one button that locks AND retracts.

I am a gal who has never worn "heavy" makeup or "bold" colors, especially now in my middle 40's,  so I chose Maybelline's  new Blushed Nudes Eyeshadow to see how I liked them.  All of the colors are very subtle, not to "sparkly" and look very "natural" no matter what combination of the 10 different shades you choose to use.If you are a more "natural gal" like me, you won't be disappointed in this beautiful but subtle 10 shade color eyeshadow palette!

I have occasionally used Proactiv products over the years, especially in my 30's as I "had" oily skin.  Now, in my middle 40's, I STILL have the occasional breakout and now have combination skin.  I have had skin sensitivity issues with products that have sulfur in them so I used this on a couple of pimples and did a "spot" treatment.  Boy, does this stuff WORK!  It's potent but non-drying for me.  I have an 11 year old granddaughter who has breakouts on her forehead, nose and chin and she ALSO has very sensitive skin.  This stuff works wonders for her also!  If you use it only as an overnight spot treatment, the 3 ounces will last QUITE A LONG TIME.  Definitely WORTH the price because of the quantity!You can use the mask as a cleansing ritual two to three times a week to refine the appearance of pores, or as a rapid response overnight spot treatment to clear emerging acne breakouts.

This camouflage lantern is the perfect size for camping/fishing/boating/hunting has a built-in compass on the top and features a COOL, telescoping on/off switch.  It is also SUPER bright at 120 lumen. Just extend it to turn on and retract to turn off. Works great outdoors and indoors.At a shade under $15 (at the time of review) this is a great little lantern at a decent price.  The lantern takes 3 AA batteries in the bottom of the unit (which are not included)

Over the last several years, I have purchased many different brands of microfiber towels and none have really "grabbed" me the way the DII brand has.  I have always took issue with some microfiber towels not being very absorbent nor thick enough to really do large jobs. These microfiber towels have a special blend of microscopic fibers woven into hooks & loops, creating tiny scoops which attract, absorb and wipe out grime for lint free cleaning. They are ultra absorbent - holding up to 7 times in weight in liquid, dirt or grime. Also, when used while dry, microfiber is positively charged and naturally attracts negatively charged grease, dirt and dust.These towels also are pretty odor free as long as you rinse them out well after each use.  Do not use fabric softener on these towels, however as it is sure to ruin the absorbency and their effectiveness.

I have purchased several different cheese powders over the last 12 months along with the Hoosier Hill Farm offering.  I must say that for the price, taste and moreover the consistency of this product highly outperforms some of the other products on the market.  I have had this SAME one pound container for over 1 YEAR stored in my cupboard and it has yet to clump, get moist or taste ANY DIFFERENT than the day that it arrived on my doorstep in February of 2014!  My granddaughter LOVES it on baked potatoes, in mac and cheese and ESPECIALLY on  air popped POPCORN! For the ounces/pound and the cost, you JUST CAN'T BEAT Hoosier Hill Farm Cheddar Cheez Powder!  I will be a return customer - again and again!

These Henckels Ultra-Slim Nail Clippers are of a very high quality stainless steel construction. Super sharp; their ultra-slim design provides extra leverage so you don't need a lot of pressure when cutting and maintaining nails. The clippers ingeniously fold flat to fit in their own small black, leather storage pouch.These clippers are for maintenance only, as I would use a bigger clipper/scissor for MAJOR manicure issues.  They are also on the pricey side...

I STILL like a physical paper/pencil planner even though I am quite tech savvy.  This AT-A-GLANCE planner does the trick and is a great size.  Not too big and not too small.  (Think of a 5 by 7 picture frame for size.)The pretty and definitely girly, heat stamped nature pattern with gray and pops of pink is on very nice and durable leatherette cover12 months, July 2015June 2016; weekly: one week per two-page spread in a 8.65 x 2 inch column format with hourly appointment times, 7a.m.-8p.m. Monday-Friday and open weekends; 8.5 x 11 inch page size, Julian datesMonthly: one month per two-page spread; tabs for quick reference and navigation; 1.85 x 1.75 inch ruled blocks; past and future reference month; notes space and includes Julian dates

I am a big believer in probiotics for digestive health so I was anxious to try TheraBreath oral care probiotic lozenges.  I take probiotic capsules regularly to "keep regular" and wondered if this product's claims would live up to its statements.  I took all 8 of the pills nightly (please make sure to let the lozenges dissolve in your mouth instead of chewing) but I didn't really notice any changes in morning breath or white coating on the tongue being eliminated or even helped in any way.  Maybe you need to use the toothpaste, mouth rinse and the lozenges in combination to eliminate bad breath. However, I have had more success with parsley pills in relation to bad breath and morning breath overall, and parsley pills are MUCH cheaper than these lozenges.

If you are a fan of Starburst than you will more than likely "like" Starburst Minis. I am reviewing the flavor combo called FaveREDS which are all the "red/pink" starbursts.  Watermelon, cherry, strawberry and fruit punch are the flavors in the FaveRED pack.  These are tiny, unwrapped Starbursts with approximately 1 1/2 cups of product per bag.  Even though I am an "original" Starburst fan (lemon being my fave flave) these Starbursts are really delicious and I can see them really being a great, sweet snack for parents to carry with them for toddlers up to tweens.The minis are softer and not as "waxy" as the original Starbursts. They are packed in a zip top/resealable fresh pack and are SUPER convenient for travel.

This is a top quality gift card box that can be used not only for weddings but baby showers, graduations and the like.  It is really beautifully made and can be folded for storage and used over and over again!

I got these metallic tattoos for my 11 year old granddaughter and she was THRILLED with them and so were her friends!  Super cute designs, easy to put on and easy to take off.  All in all, a fun gift!

These plant markers are a great size and I am able to use them for selling seedlings and cutting of plants.  I used a thin Sharpie marker instead of the pen that is included due to other reviewers stating that the writing came off in rain/watering and such...

The Fenix tempered glass screen protector is the mother of all screen protectors!  Super easy to install, no "bubble" problems and a clean, clear screen with super delicate response. Don't waste your money on those decal style screen protectors.  Spend a little bit more and get the Fenix glass protector...

I have been interested in getting a pair of bluetooth headphones  for use on my motorcycle and these fit the bill! At a little over twenty bucks these earphones deliver great sound, are SUPER EASY to pair right out of the box and are very user friendly.  They really do eliminate white noise and delivers a pretty clean audio experience.  They are SUPER lightweight but not "cheaply made" at all.They also feature up to 6 hours of Talk/Playing Time and 150 hours Standby Time.and come with 3 different sets of earplugs (small, medium & large), a micro/mini USB cable and nice hard carrying case to store everything in.All in all, a really nice set of bluetooth headphones that will be getting lots of use on the Harley!

This portable humidifier unit is great for travel and office cubicle use and I really enjoy using about 10 drops of essential oil to the water so that my humidifier isn't only humidifying the air but scenting it also! It covers 5 square feet, has a blue light and comes with two filters.Great for putting right beside your bed or on your desk.

Brookstone's outstanding outdoor wireless speaker and docking station has been in our house for almost 10 years!  I love the portability, the light feature and that it is able to be left outside/waterproof.  This is the 2nd speaker I have purchased as the first one lasted close to 9 years with some serious, HEAVY use and abuse!  We love to hook it up to our Grace Digital Internet Radio, IPod or TV!I looked at other outdoor/wireless speakers but I just couldn't find one that I thought I would like more for the price range.  Again, this speaker is weather-resistant and features omnidirectional sound in yards, patios or anywhere else within 150 feet of your docked MP3 player or stereo. There are 3 audio channels prevent interference with other cordless devices, while the 5" woofer and 1" tweeter deliver dynamic bass and bright, clear treble. Uses an AC adapter (included) or 8 D batteries (not included). The universal dock connects to any stereo or MP3 player, streaming your music through walls, floors or ceilings via a clear, strong 900MHz signal to the Outdoor Speaker. Runs on included AC adapter, or 6 AA batteries (not included).Updates to this unit would be GREAT after being on the market this long.  The only update from the original speaker I bought is the docking station.  It used to be a thin silver receiver/dock. Obviously, this unit is a big seller for Brookstone. However, the only thing about this speaker and dock is that it would be great if the unit was BLUETOOTH enabled and if the dock would charge your IPod/IPad/IPhone or other phone/peripherals while sitting in the dock and/or in use.All in all, STILL a SOLID 5 STARS!

SOFI is a new product line by the very well known Fellows/Bankers Box/Body Glove Corporation which has been in existence since 1917.  Their quality products have been used for almost 100 years! This fashionable and solid SOFI Brix Bin is stain-guard protected, has a silk-textured exterior and stylish interior. It features a woven handle with brass rivets.This bin is clearly on the "high end" as far as price is concerned but you get what you pay for and this bin is sturdy, well-made and attractive!

I am a fan of Febreeze and wanted to try the new Unstopables fabric fresheners.  The scents are nice and the product works wonders but  it's quite pricey and the only reason why I am rating a four star instead of a solid 5.

I am a fan of Febreeze and wanted to try the new Unstopables Plug In air fresheners.  I love that the plug is able to be turned so that polarization is correct but the delivery system is quite large and blocks most of the whole outlet in my home.  I also like that the system is adjustable.  I had mine on the medium setting and it lasted almost 3 months.  The scents are nice but the overly large delivery system is a "fail" for me and the only reason I would not rate it 4 stars instead of 3...

This is from a short hair gal reviewer - I use to purchase the original Sea Waves spray that you shook up to mix and got new/improved release of the John Frieda Beach Blonde Sea Waves Sea Salt Spray.  I can honestly say that this product works just as well on my short, thick, straight pixie style haircut as the old product.  From other reviewers and varying hair length textures/lengths/thicknesses this is not always the case.Just wanted the short hair gals to know that for us, this product works the same as the old...

If your Basketball Star loves Nerf Mini Basketball Hoops then the Silverback Basketball Mini Hoop will be their new obsession!You can quickly and easily mount on: A Wall or Mount on Either Side of the Door with The Extended Bracket DesignFeatures include: Spring Action Break Away Rim for Rough Play & A Shatterproof Polycarbonate Backboard (18" x 12")PLUS - the package includes a great Silverback Mini Basketball!  Just pump it up and play!This b-ball set is solidly made and at a great price!  PLAY ON!

The Zeetron micro cord which I received has charged many a tablet, GPS, camera and phone over the past 5 months of solid use.  The BEST feature is that the cord lights up red when in charging mode and blue when the device is completely charged, making it the number ONE reason why this cord gets a 5 star rating.I would recommend the Zeetron cord for it's reliability, LED light and it's awesome price!

This is my 3rd Pet Magasin product and review. These 3 in 1 Value Pack brushes are great and at a reasonable price to boot!  I use them on my 4 rabbits and they work wonders on shedding and matting issues.  I would say that these brushes would also work on ponies, horses and even cats, especially long haired varieties.All in all, they are made very sturdy with quality and at a great price for ALL 3!

I am not, by any stretch of the imagination, a BLING wearing gal.  I wear simple, understated jewelry and these pearl stud earrings from Orrous & Company fit the bill.  The product picture does NOT do them justice!  Take a look at customer/reviewer photos! They are truly beautiful, boxed elegantly and are SUPER solid and very well made for the price.I am a musician/vocalist and I am able to wear these at concert venues and churches with an understated classic look in my black formal concert wear.

I am not, by any stretch of the imagination, a BLING wearing gal.  I wear simple, understated jewelry and these stud earrings from Orrous & Company fit the bill.  The product picture does NOT do them justice!  They are truly beautiful, boxed elegantly and are SUPER solid and very well made for the price.I am a musician/vocalist and I am able to wear these at concert venues and churches with an understated classic look in my black formal concert wear.

I was a bit skeptical when I received the iGearPro USB Flash Drive combination Audio Recorder.  How can you get a good recording from this tiny 8GB thumb drive?  Well, I am here to say you CAN!  I got this to record piano tracks for vocal rehearsal purposes and LOVE it!  I have an expensive Tascam recorder but end up using this one most of the time due to it's tiny size, ease of use and super portability.  I have been using this product from November 2014 - May 2015 with ease and the price is awesome!I would recommend this to any musician for basic recording purposes, plus I have a ton of PDF music sheets and scores housed on it for accessibility.Highly Recommended!

These are my first pair of Brainwavz and I must say, they are quite nice. The only thing I can attribute it to is the all metal shell that these ear buds are housed in.  I listen to all types of music - from Classical/Opera/Choral to the Pop/Country/Rock hits of today.  The only thing lacking is a strong and true "deep" bass, if you like that sort of thing.  For me, I will take detail and clarity over gut moving bass any day.The pack of included accessories are:1 Comply foam S-series tip6 Silicone tips1 Bi-Flange tip1 Tri-Flange tip1 Black & Red hard earphone carrying case1  Instruction manualThe Earphone Carrying Case is a GREAT accessory with a clip and Velcro strip for ease of storage.  I also LOVE the FLAT, OVER THE EAR design as the flat cables do not get tangled like rounded ones often do.All in all, a solid 4 stars for the Brainwavz S1!

I have been in the market for a new shower head with enough massaging pressure similiar to ones in fine hotels.  The A-Flow 5 Function Handheld Shower Head system fits the bill!  This shower head features five functions: rain, massage, aeration, rain/massage and rain/aeration and all of the functions are great, however, my personal favorite is the aeration.  It really SHOOTS the water out and massages the best of the five options.Another option I was in search of was a LOOONG enough hose to reach/clean the entire tub. This shower head has a SUPER long hose - 60 inches, to be exact and it is nice and flexible.  It was SUPER easy to install, taking me under 5 minutes to remove my old shower head, clean the plumbing, use the enclosed thread sealant tape, mount and install...The overall design and the top quality materials won't leave you disappointed.  Add the LIFETIME warranty and you really can't go wrong!Highly Recommended!

I received Pet Magasin's cat tunnel toy and the family of 6 cats had and are STILL HAVING a ton of kitty fun playing with these tunnels even after 2+ months of play! The "crinkle" sounds, the attached cat ball toys, the colorful nylon and the "peep" window are some of the great features.This package includes 2 cat tunnels. One large - 1 long (L:35'',D:10'') and 1 small (L:18'',D:10'').  Another great thing is that the tunnels are collapsible so they are easy to store.I have reviewed several products by Pet Magasin and all of the products have been top-notch.  This set of tunnels are made and sold by Pet Magasin  with a  2 year warranty and 100% money back guarantee. Highly Recommended!

I ordered "Nest" to read with my granddaughter, who is 10 years old and in the 5th grade.  One of the reasons why I thought this book might be an interesting read is because of the time period the novel is set in, which is the summer of 1972.  I, myself, was born in 1970 and I enjoy reading books and my granddaughter and I REALLY enjoy watching films that are set in the 1960-1970's, such as "My Girl", "Now & Then", "Pleasantville",  "Mermaids" and other films in that genre. That said, I would DEFINITELY recommend that this book be read WITH a child until they are at least 12-13 because of some of the thematic elements such as mental health institutions in the 70's, disease (this novel deals with Multiple Sclerosis in a young mother) depression, dreams unfulfilled, suicide and death.  The characters in the novel are "fleshed-out" and the story itself is a "tearjerker"...  Be ready to answer tough questions from the child you either read this book with or give to as a gift.  "Nest" covers multitudes of human frailties experienced in life.

3-M products have always been reliable for our household and this rubber weatherstrip is no exception.  To be fair and honest to people who might not know how and when to install and more importantly when to REMOVE weatherstripping, this item is made to be used for one season/year only.  Install when it is cold and remove in the late Spring.  This product worked much better on windows than it did my door, but I think if you had a newer style door, such as ALL fiberglass, it would work just fine.It does help reduce winter heating costs and this white, D-Profile is made for large gaps up to 1/4". The size of this particular weatherstripping is  0.35 inch x 0.29 inch x 19.7 feet.

What can I say about an A to micro B cable?  It either works or it doesn't, right?  This 3 foot cable is PERFECT for your car.  Since it comes in different colors, you can differentiate it from other cables you might have in your vehicle.  The only reason this receives 4 stars instead of 5 is that the color is slightly misrepresented.  The yellow is definitely a PASTEL yellow.  Think of the yellow color you see at Easter and this is EXACTLY the color of this cable.  All in all, a great deal and a great, working cable!

I got this for my 2005 Yellow/White & Black Mini Cooper S.  My car is mostly garaged with under 60K miles but at almost 11 years old it is beginning to show wear and fading.  This product really does do what it claims but I'll be interested to see if it lasts 9+ months.  If it does, you can be sure that I will give it 5 stars instead of 4.  The application process is tedious, but THAT is REALLY what DETAILING a car is all about.  This product worked ESPECIALLY on my outside vents/windshield wipers.  They were showing the MOST fading.

This Home Essentials mattress pad is sold exclusively on Amazon.com.  It features a 100% cotton top and is able to fit very deep mattresses.  I have a Tempurpedic  and this pad fits it perfectly.100% cotton top - 300 thread count100% olefin bottom; 100% polyester fillingPlush, 8 oz. cushion filling - adds comfort to your current mattressStretches to fit up to 22" deep mattress - Hugs your mattress tightly and stays in placeMachine washable for easy carePerfect For Restoring Older Mattresses, Softening Firm Mattresses, or Cooling Hot MattressesAs far as washing goes, I would wash on warm but either hang dry or tumble dry on low heat.  I do this for ALL of my mattress pads and they seem to last a LOT longer!  All in all, a nice mattress pad with a 3 year warranty at a fabulous price!

This is my 2nd "Juice Beauty" product review.  I have combo skin and am 44 years old. I have used this product four times for 10 minutes each in the last two weeks as recommended. Directions say, "apply a generous amount to face, neck and decolletage area." I would NOT suggest a generous amount.  A dab'll do ya!  I put a very thin, even layer over my face and neck.  In about 2 minutes, there is a tingling, but it was not uncomfortable at all.  My skin was a bit red after rinsing but quickly returned.  I did ALL of my "peels" at night so if I did have a bad reaction, it would hopefully be gone in the morning.  I had no lasting side effects.That said, this product is a bit pricey for me, but if you don't mind spending the money, it's worth a try.  I highly doubt that this product is going to diminish my sun/dark spots as I have tried numerous and more expensive over-the-counter products to do so, and have yet to find that "magic in a bottle"... Thus, the 3 stars.

I recently purchased a new Dell desktop and needed to transfer all settings and files from my HP laptop, both of which are running Windows 7.  Of course, the first place I go when looking for anything is Amazon and was SO pleased to find they had this Belkin Easy Transfer Cable, Prime Eligible and  at a GREAT price.  Please be aware that this transfer cable will ONLY work with Pentium Processor based computers.I own many Belkin computer/camera items and Belkin products always meet or exceed my expectations. This transferred all of my files, settings, contacts etc. and even has an automated report. Once your transfer is complete, a  report is generated, providing a view of everything that was transferred to your new computer. Because of possible incompatibility and licensing issues, some programs and applications may not be transferred to the new computer. The utility provides a list of all programs and applications installed on the old computer along with links to latest versions of the programs to install on your new computer. Please also be aware that if you are trying to transfer anything between a computer and Windows 8.1 this cable will not work.  There are LOTS and LOTS of 1 and 2 star reviews on this cable and believe me, it is NOT Belkin or Amazon's fault.  The product description CLEARLY states how and when this cable will work.  Now, you may use this between a Windows 8.1 computer as long as you UNINSTALL the 8.1 update, roll back to Windows 8, complete your transfer and then RE-INSTALL the 8.1 update.I am very happy with this product and give it a HARDY 5 STARS ALL THE WAY!.

This is my first "Juice Beauty" product and I was interested in it for the organic/natural ingredients.  I am 44 years old, have sensitive/combination skin and if I have a break out or a pimple it will ALWAYS be in the "tee" zone.  I have used this product nightly, after cleansing and toning and ONLY at night.I can ONLY recommend NIGHTLY use because the serum DOES leave a shiny, slick & sticky appearance to your face as other reviewers have stated. I haven't dared try and use this under my liquid foundation or make-up as I think it would make a huge mess on your face.I love the fact that it has a dropper delivery and it is in glass and not plastic. I also love the fact that you only have to use a TINY bit to cover your whole face. Some reviewers have "dinged" this product on its price, but you use SO VERY little, it is bound to last quite a long time.All in all, a nice, sensitive, organic, natural, no scent way to clear blemishes...

I received these 3 crocheted storage baskets and thought they would be a bit more rigid than floppy.  If you fold the top over to form a lip they tend to hold their shape much better. I nest one of the small baskets in the large one to create a divided large basket and use the other small basket by itself.  Too bad they don't come in 3 different sizes as it would have been nice to have a medium sized basket instead of 1 large and 2 small.  Just sayin'...These baskets are 100% Polypropylene and even though I haven't washed them yet, I have tote bags made out of Poly and they wash up just fine.The biggest drawback is the price...

This particular Kaboom toilet cleaning system that I am reviewing for Amazon Vine was very easy to install.  This system actually has TWO pouches of the tablets to last a total of 6 months.  There isn't a price listed on this page but I have searched other Kaboom systems and feel that they are QUITE overpriced.It seems to keep the underside of the toilet bowl ring cleaner than it was before but there is no such thing as a SCRUB FREE toilet. It seems to make the toilet EASIER to clean, however and that I why I rate it at 3 stars.  I will be updating this review in a couple of months to see if the tablets REALLY DO last 3 months. Until then...

Great Idea! I received this T-Shirt frame as I wanted to frame my 2012 Elton John Concert tee.  This frame has a nice, sturdy construction and is made well.  It has a sawtooth hanger on the back for easy installation and is available in either black or white.  Included are folding instructions which are very easy to follow.However, this t-shirt display will only show part of a design as the measurements inside are quite small (21-1/2 Inch by 19-1/2 Inch).  You can really only use this for an adult small - large size with a shirt that has a centered screen-print design.I think this product would be better if they were manufacture in sizes according to the size of your t-shirt you want to frame.  Shelling out  $30 for a frame (kinda pricey, if you ask me) the shirt you want to memorialize SHOULD fit.With this in mind, this frame would be better suited to a child's favorite shirt or sport jersey.  Just make sure to measure the shirt before ordering this particular frame.

This is a super cute oven mitt as the mitts have matching aprons.  I do LOVE all of the designs they come in and I really like the thermal, silver, heat protective layer inside.  Just wish these were flame retardant and came in a pair and not just a single mitt...  All in all, though it is a super cute oven mitt that does the job!

This adjustable Mesa/Aegis Trail Riding Helmet has met all of my expectations! I ordered a Black LG/XLG and is fits PERFECTLY! It features a dial fit retention system in the back of the helmet and is permanently anchored. It adjusts easily for a sure, secure and VERY comfortable fit! I also LOVE the black rubberized coating as it prevents scratches and peeling. The three-point super soft nylon harness system is fully adjustable and has a quick snap buckle.  The Velcro insert/head pads remove for cleaning and replace in a snap.The 6 mesh-covered aeration vents provide ample airflow and keep out bugs and debris. It has a non-adjustable and supportive visor.  The contrasting leather-trimmed band and leather-trimming on the three-point harness really sets this helmet off!The Mesa/Aegis Helmet is, of course, ASTM F1163-04A/SEI Certified & CE certified to European EN 1384 StandardsSizes:Small/Medium (20   21 )- 15.2 ozLarge/XLarge (21   23 )- 16 ozI am VERY happy with this helmet as it is attractive, functional and THEE most COMFORTABLE helmet I have ever worn!Five stars ALL THE WAY!

What a great set of 12 different stylus!  With this set you receive 3 regular and 9 extension stylus in SUPER vibrant colors and sparkly rhinestone accents!My granddaughter and I split these up amongst ourselves and have used them on various tablets, phones, laptops, desktops and the like.  This is a great set at an even GREATER PRICE!  Under a buck for each!These would make GREAT stocking stuffers for Christmas!

This wi-fi range extender has worked for me.  I live in a 900 square foot ranch style home and a have dead spots in my garage and four seasons room that is at the back of the house.  This did, indeed, extend my wi-fi but setting this up was less than easy.For the average computer user, the installation process will be complicated and I surmise that many people will just give up and lose their patience, as I almost did.  If you purchase this and have any problems with installation, I suggest calling the customer service  number so that they may walk you through the process...

This Remington trimmer/edger is a decent LIGHT DUTY ONLY machine.  It comes in two pieces, is easy to assemble  (just add the guard).  It features:  QuickStart technology makes pull starts easier  Straight shaft design makes it easier to trim under bushes and in hard-to-reach places  Dual line bump head with .095-inch line for greater control  Constructed with durable components  Includes 2-cycle oil 25cc 2 cycle gas straight shaft string trimmerWe have a heavy duty trimmer, but I HATE using it!  It's SOOOO heavy and cumbersome for me as a woman.  This is under 1 lbs. but it really can only be used in a very light duty manner. Good as a second home trimmer for the ladies of the house!

I got this Remington for my husband to use as a travel razor. I don't like him taking his $200.00 razor on motorcycle trips and this razor fits the bill for him to use while on the road.  He states that you have to make NUMEROUS passes at different angles to get a closer shave and that he wouldn't use this shaver for his every day shaving.  Sometimes my husband shaves two times a day so a higher end shaver is what he uses for every day.  He does like the "pivot and flex" that this razor features and it charges quickly and runs long.  He also really likes the pop-up trimmer!

My 11 year old granddaughter was ecstatic to receive this Barbie Dreamhouse camper!  It does have some very cool accessories and cool designs, such as:The cab detaches to transform into a poolGrill flips over to become a tableA TV flips out for loungingfire pit complete with marshmallows on sticks to "make" s'mores...and it even has a toilet and shower stall!All in all, my granddaughter loves this dreamhouse camper, we both had fun putting all the stickers on the vehicle, even though grandma thinks that the actual sticker price should have a lower M.S.R.P.!!!

I got this for my 10 year old granddaughter because she loves to write, paint and draw.  She also loves anything to do with spies/top secret/mystery films and the like.  She was very excited to receive the journal but the voice-activation only works intermittently. The paper pad itself is tiny, however, she loves the "secret compartment" and the invisible ink options.  The voice-activated lock opens only to your voice  Record your own password, greeting, signoff and intruder alerts  A hidden compartment is perfect for storing treasured mementos  Use the invisible ink pen to write private thought; then reveal the words with the glow light  Encourages self-expression and creativityWhile this toy is a great concept, the design of it leaves much to be desired...

I LOVE this X-ACTO knife set and what a great price for everything you get!  The basic set is ideal for cutting cardboard, paper, plastic, cloth and foam board.  The case is a sturdy, zippered compartment type case that holds everything in its own place. There are a variety of blade types including straight edge, general purpose, fine point, and scoring blades.The set includes: 3 knives, 13 interchangeable bladesThe only thing this set could use is the knives would be even better if they had one flat side so that they cannot roll off of a table, workbench or desk... Still giving this X-ACTO set a five our of five stars, though...

I got this game as a promotional item to play with my meetup groups, since I am a Meetup Organizer. So I did not have to pay for it. I got if after I played it with others in a meetup group. It's a combination of Uno and Apples to Apples. You're given 10 cards that have either a topic or a letter of the alphabet on them. One of each is showing on the table for everyone to see. Let's say that "Disney Move" and the letter B is showing. On your turn, you must switch either the topic ort he letter. Let's say you decide to switch the letter to F. So you must now name a Disney movie starting with F. Frozen and Fantasia come to mind. I'm sure there are others. So when you change, make sure you can come up with an answer. If you do, you don't have to pick another card. First player to get rid o all of their cards wins.There are special cards in the deck. One allows you to get rid of two cards, another allows you to switch your card with someone else. Also, if you're too slow, the 10 second timer will decide your fate. Overall a fun game that's simple but at the same time makes you think.

I got this game last year and brought it to my Word Games Group. Two teams compete with coming up with an answer to a topic with six different subjects. You turn the spinner to determine what your topic is. The topic appears in a small window.  Let's say the topic is New York. Teams go back and forth trying to come up with answer in six different categories containing that topic,  including TV, Movies, Music, People, Places and Things. You cannot pick the same category you picked last time or that the other team just picked ahead of you. On later turns, you can go back to them. Once you give an answer, it cannot be used again in other categories. Once either team reaches the bullseye in the middle, the category ends and teams get the points they earned. First team to get 100 points wins.It was a little confusing the first time we tried it, but we got the hang of it after a couple of rounds. The game comes with black and white markers to place where teams gave an answer. One team uses the black markers, the other team uses white. We found it helpful to place these markers on the categories to keep track of which ones teams last gave an answer in. You may want to get a 30 second timer from another game to speed things along. Teams can take a long time to deliberate. Other than that, this is a good team game that will make you think.

I've brought this game to a couple of meetup groups in NYC, including the trivia one that I run.  It proved to be quite popular. It comes with six dry erase boards, markers and a die. The die determines what type of question will be asked, multiple choice, higher or lower or fill in. The last one requires you to write a number. Person closest to the real answer wins a point. First player to get 10 points wins. A nice and fast moving game that should take a half-hour to 45 minutes.. The one complaint I have is that the type on the cards is small. Other than that, a good game.

I've had earlier versions of this game. I bought this one from Amazon as an update. Questions are challenging and you probably won't get the answer on the first clue, but once in a while, it's possible. Questions are formatted like Match Game, where you fill in the blank. Like "In 1972, terrorists broke into ________." Someone in our group knew the answer was the Munich Olympics. More likely than not, you'll have to pick other clues to help you. The first clue will get you five points, each subsequent clue is worth one less point. A maximum of four players or teams can compete. Each team gets their own questions. First player/team to get 30 points or more wins.The game comes with four booklets that cover the 50s through the 2000s The die roll determines what decade you get and in some cases, what other teams choose for you. I find the game to be fun and in a lot of cases will jar your memory to past events.

I got this game real cheap at Barnes & Noble. Sadly, Discovery Bay Games shut down, but this was one of their better games. You're given an obscure place somewhere on Earth. You must write down the correct location or come up with a good bluff to convince others. You score points for every vote your answer gets. Places that have come up include Assumption, Diss, Smackass Gap, Bumpass, Pratt's Bottom, Big Ugly and the ever popular Peniscola. One person in our group actually knew Big Ugly was in West Virginia. Peniscola, by the way, is in Spain.Everyone writes down their answer. All the answers are then read, including the real one. Players then vote for what they think the right answer is. If you can bluff well, this game's for you. Plus you get to learn where unusually names places are in the world. The game comes with a cool looking 90 second timer. The only complaint I have about this game is that it did not have the map markers that the instruction booklet mentioned. Also, as in all writing games, you may have to deal with someone whose writing is not easily legible. Otherwise, it's a fun game where you can learn a thing or two. This game is out of print, so if you want it, you can get it here on amazon.com.

I got this package of two games from Amazon. I like 1 vs 100 and I've played that more often. I've cleared the board three times. The e are two games of 1 vs 100 - one where the dollar value increases by $500 with each question for each mob member you eliminate. Then there's the "Big Money" game where dollar values increase $1,000 for each question. There's a bonus question to increase your jackpot where a wrong answer will NOT eliminate you. There's also a feature where you have 30 seconds to answer five questions, and three correct answers increases your score. Like the TV show, the game has three helps. You might win them back depending on the special features and if you knock certain people out of the mob (the ones lit up in green). If you lose, you might be able to redeem yourself with a "redemption question." for less that what you had.Deal or No Deal plays pretty straight to the show. Pick cases and try to avoid the larger amounts. When the main game is over, there are special games and features for you to try out. Enough diversity to make the game interesting.The game does not have Bob Saget  or Howie Mandel to guide you through the rules and stuff, but the makers of this game have added enough features and bonuses to make up for that. I definitely recommend getting this game, especially if you're a fan of either show.

I've had this game for years. On a whim, I decided to stick it in my PC this past Christmas. To my surprise, it worked with no problems. Considering this game is more than 10 years old, it was a bit of a shock, albeit a pleasant one. You can play with up to six others, though getting everyone around the computer may be tricky. You determine how many humans and rounds (up to seven each). You can have more or less of certain questions, like science, for example. You can bank on human questions only or set it so you can bank no matter whose turn it is. Play is almost exactly like the TV show. A maximum of seven rounds, dollar values are tripled (or "trebled" as Anne says) for the sixth round. And yes, Anne does her quips and insults, just like the TV show.You can choose from up to 24 CGIs as to who you want to play as. A varied assortment of ages and backgrounds, from a 17-year-old high school student to a 66-year-old retiree. You can play a single game or do the tournament challenge. The computer takes the roles of non humans. If you're playing solo, be prepared to get voted off if you have a bad round. But this game is incredible in that I have not caught a repeat question and it moves at a good pace.Anne Robinson has since retired from hosting the show in England. It only lasted a couple of years here in the colonies. This is a game that will test your knowledge and nerves. From someone who loves trivia, this is one of my favorite games. If you can find it, get it. You need to have the disc in your PC to play it.

Finally got to play this game this past holiday season. Like Hollywood Squares and Millionaire, you create a profile that keeps track of your progress. A solo game pits you against two computer players. The first few games, the computer players are no real threat. They will mostly not buzz in for questions or give a wrong answer. As you win more games, the computer players get smarter and more aggressive. They start giving right answers more often and will start buzzing in to answer questions. They might also pass their spins to you. If you have less spins or money, you can pass your spins to them.Format is based on the 80s version of the show that Peter Tomarken hosted. There's two rounds each of four questions and the prize board round. Player with the most spins and most in cash/prizes goes last, respectively, in the prize board round. The prize board is almost an exact duplicate of the show. Computer play seems to be random. They can pass spins and they do get whammies occasionally. You as the human player can always decide whether to play or pass your spins. Passed spins go to the computer player with the higher amount. So far, I've won 10 games. If you lose a game, you can play it over till you win. Overall a fun and challenging game to play. You need to have the disc in your PC to play it.

I ordered this game for Christmas. It follows the 2010 version where the dollar amounts for the lower valued questions was increased. The "hot seat" is there, and the CGI representing you is sitting in it. You're guaranteed money at the $5,000 and $25,000 levels The money amounts are as follows - $500, 1K, 2K, 3K, 5K, 7.5K, 10K, 12.5K, 15K, 25K, 50K, 100K, 250K, 500K and of course $1 million! Your three lifelines are the audience, phone a friend and "double dip" where you can give a second answer to a question if your first answer is wrong. If your first answer is right however, you've lost that lifeline - you can't get it back.You have time limits in each of the three rounds. 15 seconds for the first five questions, 30 seconds for the next five and 45 seconds for the last five. Any time saved or left over gets to be used for the million dollar question - if you make it that far. If you don't give an answer in the time limit, the game ends and you leave with the last amount you won. Graphics and game play are very good but the show has since changed its format.You get little bonuses and such as the game accumulates your winnings. New lifelines, wardrobe changes and such. You don't have the stick the disc in each time, so it's stored and saved in your PC the first time you do it. After your lifelines are gone, you have the option to walk away with your current winnings. But the computer will NOT show you the answer to the current question if you choose this option. I find that annoying as all Hell. The questions get harder. I think I've seen the $100K question twice in the 20 or so times I've played. So it won't be easy, but overall, this is a fun game for those who like a mental challenge.

I've had this game for some time but did not get around to playing it till Christmas 2014. At first, my PC was slow and I thought would not accept the disc. But it ended up taking it. Once I started playing, I was hooked. The game comes with celebs quips from the actual show in the center square. The rest of the squares are al CGIs. Game play is just like the TV show. A correct answer earns you an X, a wrong answer gives O the square, unless it gives you a win. As Peter Marshall used to say "the third square you have to earn yourself." In the event three-in-a-row is not possible, five squares will get you a win. Two out of three games wins the match. The bonus round consists of 90 seconds to try and answer nine Q&As. In most cases, this is enough time, but a really long question can cut it close. A few times, I got all the questions right or got only one wrong, which assures you of winning the $20,000 bonus.The are no zingers from the CGIs, the actual celeb clips have them. There are four celebs featured, one for five shows each. They are Brad Garrett (1st week), Kathy Griffin (2nd), Jeffery Tambor (3rd) and Matrtin Mull (4th). That's a total of 20 games. After that, you go back and start over. The questions have not repeated - maybe two or three times max. I.ve been replaying games I lost or where I won but didn't get the bonus.A couple of other things. The game allows for only one player, and you're always X. You see your questions but not the O questions. You just hear and see that O got it right or wrong. Tom Bergeron is the voice that guides you through the rules and reads the questions. It would be nice  if there were more than 20 games and a human two player option. Other than that, this a good reproduction of the show. Plus you don't need to put the disc in to play. Your computer should store and save the info the first time.

This is a repackaged release of Collectibles Records Ultimate Christmas CDs, Volumes 1 - 4. It was distributed under oldies station labels like WCBS FM (New York), WOGL (Philadelphia) and so on. 25 songs on each CD. 100 holiday hits, mostly well known with a few obscure songs thrown in for variety. Joe McCoy, former Program Director at WCBS FM put these together. We should all be glad he did. There's also Volumes 5, 6 and 7 of this series if that interests you.Bing, Nat, Johnny, Andy, the Carpenters, Dino, Elvis, Perry, Brenda Lee, Bobby Helms, the Chipmunks, Motown artists and more. If you don't have these CDs, here's a chance for you to correct that error. Over four hours of holiday music that will liven up most any gathering.

I have the cassette and CD version of this collection. It's from the 90s and features artists on the Columbia/Sony label over the years. It goes from the 40s to the early 90s The are different artists for each song, though Andy Williams is heard on two songs - The Most Wonderful Time and I Heard the Bells on Christmas Day. Quite a variety.Artists range from Burl Ives, Peggy Lee and Rosemary Clooney to Johnny Cash, Grandpa Jones and Willie Nelson to Bobby Vinton, Patti Page and Doris Day to Gladys Knight, Elmo and Patsy and New Kids on the Block. Carol Burnett and Liberace are here too.  Interestingly. Johnny Mathis. is not heard on this collection at all, and Lord knows he's recorded his fair share of Christmas songs for Columbia/Sony. Some earlier artists like Nelson Eddy and Arthur Godfrey are missing as well.  There's some instrumentals heard here as well to round out this collection.If you like variety in your Christmas music, this collection may be a good buy for you.

This CD contains four versions of the song. The latest (2014) released for the Ebola virus, plus the 2004, 1989 and 1984 versions. Pretty much it's the same song with different artists and some lyric changes. It's okay and the money goes towards a good cause.

This I believe is Vanessa's second holiday CD. I got it just for the title track. I always liked Burl Ives' version of it from the "Rudolph" TV special, but Vanessa has put her own sultry interpretation of it here, and it sounds just as good. Other tracks I like are Mary's Boy Child, Silent Night, Joy to the World, Little Drummer Boy, I Dream a World (with Ozzie Davis) and The Holly and the Ivy. A nice CD with soothing songs.

I had both of Mr. Goulet's Christmas albums on cassette. So I was glad when I found out they were both on CD. The real bonus, however, are the three songs he did with then wife Carol Lawrence. They are a snappier version of "Christmas Waltz" plus "Angels . . Heard on High" and "Carol of the Bells." I heard those songs and said Wow, they should've done a whole album of Christmas songs together. The voice comes through crisp and clear. It doesn't sound like the songs have been altered with reverb or anything like that.Solo efforts from Mr. Goulet that I like are Panis Angelicus (what a voice!), O Holy Night, Ave Maria, Home For The Holidays, Little Jesus (Rocking), On This Noel and The Christmas Waltz. There's also a promo of him doing a plug for Christmas Seals on the mono version of This Christmas I Spend With You, which was chosen as their song of the year that year (1964).These songs are all from the 60s, but they still hold up today, even though some were done 50 years ago. A great collection to add to your holiday CDs, and for Mr. Goulet's fans to remember him by. Highly recommended and amazon.com has it for a reasonable price. .

This is a great CD that carries on the memory of one of the biggest band leaders of the 20th century. Starting out with Sleigh Ride, we get to hear Jingle Bells, Silver Bells, Rudolph, Frosty, I'll Be Home For Christmas and Silent Night, along with a couple of medleys. Glenn Miller disappeared on a flight in 1944 and was never seen or heard from again. If he were still with us, a Christmas album of his would pretty much sound like this CD. The arrangements will bring back memories for those who are old enough. A well produced CD that will put you "in the Christmas mood."

This follow up to In The Christmas Mood has the same feel and bounce of its predecessor. The two yuletide medleys are well done. I also like No Place Like Home For The Holidays, Good King Wenceslas, Let it Snow and Winter Wonderland. If Glenn were still with us, he would be proud of this. A nice CD to put you in the holiday mood.

Of the 12 songs on this CD, Diana Ross is heard on six of them. The others are done by the London Symphony Orchestra and the King.s Singers. Tracks I like are Go Tell it on the Mountain, I Heard the Bells (on Xmas Day), The First Noel and O Little Town of Bethlehem. The latter two songs were recorded by Diana back in the 60s for her Christmas album with the Supremes. They didn't make the album, but they were heard when Motown (Universal) opened its "vaults" and released them on subsequent CDs.If you want to hear more of Diana Ross doing Christmas songs, get her "A Very Special Season" CD. It's NOT available in the U.S. but you can get it on amazon.com  That's how I got it, and it's really good.

I got this CD from amazon.com for less than a dime, plus S&H, natch.  The outstanding track is The Christmas Song, which she electronically recorded as a duet with her dad, Nat. I'm surprised we don't hear this on the radio more often. He take on The 12 Days of Christmas is rather interesting as well. Her take on Sweet Little Jesus Boy is very powerful. The Choir of St. David's Cathedral and the London Symphony Orchestra are also heard, with Natalie and on separate tracks of their own.  A nice CD with Natalie in top form.

I've had this DVD game for close to 10 years. I thought I reviewed it, but oh well. This version of TPIR DVD game is by far better than the 2nd edition. First, it has 12 games, including the most popular game, Plinko. The 2nd version has only eight games. Second, up to six can play. Markers and score boards are included. Next, if you just want to play the games and not deal with the "item up for bids" portion, you can do that. Great if you're alone. The 2nd edition does not allow this. The Showcase Showdown and Showcase portions of the game are similar to the TV show., except that the showcase features still pictures of the prizes. You get a choice of six bids. Beware - some of the bids may be OVER the showcase price.Games included besides Plinko are Golden Road, Cliff Hangers, Danger Price, Five Price Tags (True or False) Grand Game, Lucky Seven, Most Expensive, Pass The Buck, Push Over, Safe Crackers and Shell Game. The voices of Rich Fields, Rod Roddy and Burton Richardson are heard describing the prizes. Todd Newton guides you through the overall rules of games and such.So much for the good. Now the bad. You must keep track of your winnings. The game does not do that for you. The big wheel ALWAYS starts at $1.00 and there's no real way of controlling it other than pressing your controller button. Bob Barker was the host when this DVD came out. He's not here at all. He would have given this game authenticity. He probably would have commanded a high fee (rightfully so) and he's proven to be difficult to deal with in recent years.  But overall this DVD game has good reproductions of the games it has. I would recommend this game.

I purchased this game around the time it came out. Gene Rayburn is your host (natch), and it features celebs and questions from the actual show. However, a few things differ from the actual show. For one thing, only five celebs are featured in each game, not six. Another thing, while Rayburn is shown with actual clips, the celebs are only shown with still pictures with the audio. The Super Match comes at the end of the first round, and the one with the most matches at the end of the second round gets to play the "Head to Head" match with one celeb. The celeb differs with every game, and it's not always Richard Dawson.It looks like the games used are from the "Match Game '74" era. The questions aren't as wordy or naughty as they became later on in the series. There are 25 games included on the DVD. Once you go through them, you start repeating. Since the answers are from the show, they don't change. So you can memorize them, which makes the replay value of the games predictable. If you're a fan of the 70s Match Game, you'll enjoy playing this. It's largely a trip down memory lane, and they have a lot of celebs on the clips.

I've had this game for a few years. You can play solo or with another player. When there are two playing, the first person plays their entire game, then the second person goes. There's no alternating turns, which I think would've been better. This means the second person knows what score they need to beat before they even pick their first suitcase. I agree with other reviewers that the game moves a bit slowly. However it is a good reproduction of the format of the show, with Howie and the banker guiding you. It looks like they're using the actual DOND set. I find the solo version of this game more fun to play.

12 songs. Johnny Mathis and CeCe Winans team up for Happy Holiday and O Come All Ye Faithful. They each do four solo number and two of the tracks are instrumentals. I believe Johnny has recorded all the songs he does here previously. It's nice to hear him do a different take on these songs though. CeCe does justice to her songs and this CD is nice for your holiday listening pleasure.

I got this CD from Amazon for great price (less than $!.00). For that, I got a CD with Maria Von Trapp singing in great form. These songs are from a special Julie did in Salzburg in the 1980s. So this makes her third holiday CD, the other two being for RCA and Columbia (now both part of Sony/BMG I believe). A little known CD with one of the great voices of music. There's a few instrumentals, but Julie sings on most of the selections. I especially like Ding Dong Merrily on High, Sweet Little Jesus Boy and Sleigh Ride. Popular and rare selections combined to make a very enjoyable CD to listen to.

An almost forgotten holiday gem from the Rankin-Bass production company. Originally released as a feature film in 1967, Boris Karloff is the voice of Baron Von Frankenstein, who is retiring and must choose a successor from among his family and monster friends. Phyllis Diller voices the Bride of Frankenstein and calls her hubby "Fang." Other familiar monsters appear as well. There are songs and reminders of other movies mixed in here, including King Kong and the ending to "Some Like it Hot."This may have been the last thing Karloff did before he died. The video is a little over 90 minutes and there are some "bonuses" included. Done in the "stop motion" style of other Rankin-Bass features, the video is a nice "treat" for kids and adults alike. This would be a good video to show at a Halloween party.

I finally got around to playing this game in my trivia meetup. There are five things on each card. You must arrange these five things in some order, like smallest to biggest or earliest to most recent. You receive different colored markers to do this.  Depending on where you are on the game board, you will move ahead one or two spaces for each answer you get right. You may also move back zero, one or two spaces for each answer you get wrong. Get to the finish first and you win.Topics are varied, which is good. One bad thing is that the topic card must be passed around from person to person to see the five items. You also have to be careful about not revealing the correct order on the back of the card. Up to six players. A nice game to try out for game night.

I know the person who created this game, Gil Hova. But I still had to buy this game. I did, albeit on sale, but I consider it a good buy. The game can be played by one to five people. Score sheets, letters, bag, board, 45 second timer, pencils and instructions are included. I'll try to explain the rules.Letters are put into the bag. All the letters, except the five vowels are included. Letters like Q, X and Z are worth more points. There are always eight letters on the board. Two letters will change with each turn. You cannot have more than two of the SAME LETTER or two letters with bonus points on the board at any time. Redraw the letter(s) and put the unuseable letters back in the bag. On your turn, try to make a word that uses the most letters on the game board. The board consists of two rows with four letters each. Going left to right, the letters in the rows are worth 4, 4, 3 and 2 points, respectively. At the end of each turn, the two letters in the right column (2 points) come off the board. All the other letters are moved one row to the left. Two new letters are taken out of the bag and go in the left column.There is a rule about interrupting another player's turn if you thing you have a fantastic word. We found this rule to be confusing and making the game harder to score. At the advice of game creator Gil Hova, we just don't use that rule. The timer should be used if someone is taking too long, or if one person score a word in the two player version. This is all according to the instructions. There are separate instructions and score sheets for one, two, three, and 4 or 5 player games.Overall, I like games like this. It poses a challenge and it forces you to think. One thing you'll experience is that when it's someone else's turn, you'll come up with a terrific word that scores more than the person whose turn it is. This game is out of print, so you'll probably have to get it on amazon.com or some other website like it. I recommend it.

This game comes with scoring devices and foam rubber fingers - oh goodie! You will use both of these during the course of the game - and there's six of each. Assembly is required when you first purchase the game. You have to fold and snap the scoring devices into place. The foam fingers are ready to go. Here's how the game works:Everyone takes a turn asking a question. There are two types of questions - Have you ever and Would you ever. There are three questions on each card. The player reading chooses the question they want to ask and read it for the other players. Players then take their scoring devices and set it for the answer that applies to them, either never, once, sometimes or always.Then comes the fun part. Everyone now takes their finger - the foam one - and points it at the person they feel is guilty or most likely of doing what the question asked. You CAN'T point the finger at yourself. If you point at the most popular person (the one who gets the most fingers pointed at them), you score whatever their scoring device was set at. You can score up to three points. You then set your scoring device for the appropriate amount of points. First player to get 21 points wins.Some questions have a blank which you can fill in with anything you want - uh oh. The questions are on the mildly provocative side - nothing outright obscene. The game is recommended for ages 12 and over. This is one of those games where you have an advantage if you know the other players. Even then, you may learn a thing or two, and the questions may spark conversations.A fun game that'll get a discussion going.

Someone I know has this game. He brings it to my Trivia Meetup group every now and then. The game has seven categories. Five that I can remember are TV, Movies, Music, Sports and Nature. You roll a die or dice (can't remember off hand) and move on the board. Where you land determines your category. When we play, we usually agree on a number of questions (like 10) to answer. First player or team to reach that wins the game.The game was made by Barnes & Noble (of course, of course), so that's where you must go to purchase it, or online. This game was made around 2010, and I believe it's out of print. Speaking of print, I find the print on the cards real small, smaller than the Trivial Pursuit cards. Other than that, a fun trivia game.

This game has questions on movies in five categories, namely:Comedy/CartoonAction/AdventureDrama/MusicalHorror/Sci-FiAwardsMany questions have a 50/50 or multiple choice for an answer. The object is to get one right in each category, then go for a game winning question, a la Trivial Pursuit. I often play this with the TV Trivia Game, made by the same manufacturer. I suggest playing in teams, since a lot of times, two or three heads are better than one.

This CD starts out with the Elton John holiday standard Step Into Christmas. Other artists featured here include Jon Bon Jovi, Bob Seger, ELP, The Waitresses, Billy Squier and The Kinks. Other artists include The Moody Blues with What Child is This and Chuck Berry with Merry Christmas Baby. There's something here to please every Rock 'n Roll Christmas fan.

This compilation has 10 songs. Familiar tunes include Little Saint Nick, Someday at Christmas and Run Rudolph Run. Songs I've heard before are Christmas Time (Bryan Adams), A Spaceman Came Traveling (Chris DeBurgh) and The 12 Days of Christmas by Bob & Doug MacKensie. The latter is funny. Some rare tracks include Christmas For Teens by Paul & Paula, a duo from the 60s. A decent compilation of holiday tunes.

This "complete" CD covers ALL of Doris' holiday recordings. The first 12 songs are from her 1964 Christmas album. Songs I like from these are Toyland, Let it Snow, Be a Child at Christmas Time and The Christmas Waltz. From the rest of the CD, I like Here Comes Santa Claus, Deck The Halls, Old St. Nicholas and Silent Night.There are TWO versions each of Silver Bells and The Christmas Song. A great CD to listen to while sitting by the fireplace and drinking hot chocolate or a spiked eggnog. The freckled blonde has a helluva voice. I believe she's retired now. Hope she's doing well.

I got this CD last year and finally got around to hearing it. Jingle Bells sounds lively with the "I like a sleigh ride" refrain. Happy Holiday sounds different from Andy Williams' version but it holds up. White Christmas, The Christmas Waltz, Winter Wonderland and Little Drummer Boy are nicely done. Some songs you don't hear that often are The Star Carol, Christmas Carousel, The Christmas Spell and Song at Midnight.16 songs, and Peggy adds wonderful vocal touches to all of them. Good CD to put you in the holiday mood.

This collection features several hits you always hear on the radio at holiday time. Bing, Nat, Elvis, Eartha, Aretha, Johnny and Judy are all here. A couple of great instrumentals, with Kenny G and Herb Alpert giving us Silver Bells and Jingle Bells, respectively. Whitney and the Gospel choir practically reach Heaven with Joy to the World. A couple of new songs add nicely to the mix. Carly Simon's "The Night Before Christmas" is NOT based on the poem of the same name by Clement Moore. Songs For a Winter's Night by Sarah McLachlin is another rare holiday gem. This CD is good for any party or holiday mixer.

This CD contains 12 songs. Of those, nine are original, and most are good. The vocals are clear and not overpowered by any instruments. Christmas Waits  and Mary got my attention. If you're looking for something new and different to add to your holiday CD Collection, pick this CD up. It's available in most stores at budget prices.

The only JB Christmas song I had previously heard is Santa Claus Go Straight to the Ghetto. I had no idea the Godfather of Soul had released Christmas albums. You learn something new every day. JB takes on some old favorites like Merry Christmas Baby and Please Come Home For Christmas with original material, a lot of which he wrote. Just a few words into each song, and you know it's gotta be JB singing.
