Mind you, we've only just started using them since Christmas, but after having a cheap department store set for years, these things are like razors. So far while chopping carrots and cutting steak my wife has made a point to tell me how much of a difference these knives make compared to what we had. Even the prospect of having to hand wash these hasn't bothered us as long as it lends to these knives staying in the condition they're in now. The only slight disappointment I had was that the block doesn't hold all of the knives included in the set, so some of them have to be kept in a drawer. However that's only a display issue and I'm not going to dock a star from the review for that.I'll try to check back in a month or two and update how they've held up after some usage.
Gets Better as it goes along, by the end I really enjoyed it.
Yes American Vermont is made in China for Bosch a German Co and sold under the name American Vermont. What could be more America!

It lasted 42 days. Long enough to be out of Amazon's return policy. I used it 5 times and on the 6 it wouldn't start. I left it over night, picked it up and tried it and it began to smoke. Not a little, a lot. I removed the battery pack and there it sits.I gave it one star cause it looks pretty. Tomorrow I will spend hours trying to get Dewalt to fulfill their warranty, want to be there's fee? I hope I can reach the bozo's at corporate who sent everything to China, guess the Mexico stuff lasted to long.

Attractive watch for formal business occasions or events. This is an attractive watch, with an inexpensive movement. On your wrist it will pass the test for most occasions. On very close inspection, it will not pass as the original 40's watch because of the detailing on the face. It is good enough though for a attractive watch. I won't belittle the movement because having many antique watches, if you wear everyday you know how old movements are affected by everything.

I was looking for something strong enough to charge my ASUS Tablet (I tried 8 different chargers), IPAD, 4 phones. This has plenty of power. The silver module shown is maybe 6" long and fits nicely on a desktop. The transformer at the other end (not shown)is also 6" long x 2 1/2 inches. It has a unique snap plug (looks like an old audio connection) to connect it to a short cord coming out of the longer cord on the wall hanging transformer. The actual cord is about as thick as a USB cord. The plug for the transformer is at one end, both prongs are narrow, but if you plug it in to the top of your outlet it will hang down and cover the bottom outlet. You can plug it into the bottom half no problem.  I recommend this product for power to those hard to charge items like ASUS. I've added a picture (cell phone is to gauge size only).
Wife and daughters swear by this book, many go to items...
Good Quality, Fast reliable service, recommended. Corner molded holds pad tight, handle is nice bonus.

This is a jacket with removable sleeves. It is larger than the Craftsman version, and the material is more of a canvas, versus a neoprene texture for the Caftsman (which is much snugger). The battery is towards the back at the bottom, annoying to sit in the car, you have to unzip and move it out of the way. Jacket is well crafted and warm without power, warmer with power.

Its a series so....having read the other 7 books in the series, this was an enjoyable installment. Arkady is still bucking the system, the bad guys are still bad, with lots of Russian atmosphere/observations. As a series, there is some short hand on the characters, especially the bad guys, but having encountered their type many times before it will not affect a series reader.

...these are well made, look presentable, and do not have the characteristic Keen nose. The nose is a traditional standard shoe shaped nose. If I were to characterize these shoes I would say old school chukka's. The soles are hard rubber with a very stiff plate heel to toe. Your hard pressed to to flex these shoes out of the box. The leather is nice heavy gauge with a pleasant feel and look. I found the lack of forefoot padding a problem since I tend to hit foot to heal. The stiff sole did help but coupled with a smaller toe box I had to send them back. I considered ordering a larger size but I would like more forefoot padding....so I'll keep on looking...Nice shoe Keen, fix the sole and I'm in....

The first 160 pages present a broad setup piece for the main character. Book one is not what I would call a "thriller". There is a bit of suspense but its secondary to the story.  The writing reminds me of Allen Furst but not as detailed/complex. I'm on to book two and would say the tension is building. Book 1 not so much. Good solid story about pre-war Berlin. If you've read Kerr, you might find some redundancy (places and events), but tolerable.

These feel like neopreme. On the Mustang OEM seats they add a bit more padding which is a nice addition. They are easy to clean and fit pretty well. They are bulky, but cover well. The lower seat part has a padded bar that fits between the plastic molded portion and seat which appears to hold pretty well.

...good sound pickup, temperature is nice to know. When the baby is crying the sound bar at the top rolls from green to red which comes in handy for grandpa. This one is less expensive because it does not have the remote control of the camera in the base. You have to move the camera by hand. This is less a problem when their really young and not moving. The field of view is large enough though that unless their in a corner, not a problem. The next step up is nice (bought for daughter) because you can sit down stairs and scan around, but for us and nap time not a deal breaker.
...magnets on one side of each notch tab. I drilled two holes in mine and mounted it to the wall with deck screws. Works great. Can't say how it works in a drawer, but for me winner.

The two sides unclick and display an assortment of screwdriver heads, connectors for the various nuts, etc. The middle handle slips into the center and is fairly snug. The ratchet is typical Chinese style so not really up to heavy use but adequate for occasional problems.  The only limitation is the shaft is stubby and no extension is provided. So as you see it in the picture, thats the way it is with all the attachments, It works but could limit you in some situations.
Solid handle with a fairly substantial connector shaft. The nut connector is also of pretty good quality so I've been able to seriously stress it. Not a ratchet style.

The ear pieces are of a very strange shape and size. They are sort of like large marbles. Completely round. The head piece is very short so I ended up using them as behind the neck (to reach my ears). The sound is very average. I wouldn't recommend for music and they are bulky to tote around. If you need a cheapy pair for some home use....then they are okay.
These are very light, well made stem cap. The have a snug fit and inner gasket make for a very nice fit. Appears to keep the mud and water out well.

If you own the original Seiko Sportura watch and you plan on keeping it --then yes this is the replacement. It has the plastic inserts at the end to complement the curvature of case, the orange sticking, etc. This will not go on any other watch, I wouldn't bother trying.

Not much to say about this yardstick --the numbers are clearly marked, nice finish, aluminum is heavy enough so that the stick is rigid (with just enough flex). Yes, it is better than those wood ones you get at the H/W of feed store.

The GoodNites bedtime underpants are the best prevention for boys who still "leak" at an older age. These L/XL sizes are very versatile and fit a wide range of boys.  All my boys can fit into these very comfortably.  We have not had a single leak, even when the boys dream about going to the loo and end up using the GoodNites for convenience.Obviously, I can't wait for the day when the boys can wear regular underwear like their age peers. But I guess they have bad genes. :-D Until that day comes, they are secure in these high-quality night-time underpants.
Very high quality T-shirt that still looks new even after over a dozen washings in a household washing machine. Fits well if you get the right size. Love the design.

This is a very nice women's timepiece. It has a pleasing design and the popular 38mm size. The three small subdial windows show day of week, day of month and hour in 24h format. (The included user manual does not mention the last subdial mode. This particular model does not have a stopwatch function.) It looks stylish on any woman's wrist and is appropriate for most occasions. It's rated 3ATM which means it's safe to wear in showers or washing hands, but not for swimming - much like the new Apple Watch.The reason I give it 4 stars is it does feel heavy - heavier than similarly priced watches we've bought from Amazon over the last few years. The heft is enough to make it a little less than the perfect daily wear I think most would like. Some women probably don't mind, but the manufacturer should have shaved a little weight to make the watch more comfortable. The strap is high quality and easy to close and open.If heavy watches don't bother you, this would be a top choice in this price range.

I love wine and this Artaste wine opener is the best I have used. The kit makes it easy to 1) cut the foil with the built-in cutter, 2) insert the corkscrew into the cork, and 3) take out the cork. It comes packaged in a nice clear plastic box which can also be used to store and display the kit. An extra corkscrew is included as well. Very practical, indeed.

I bought this microSD card to use with the New Nintendo 3DS XL. It is totally compatible. And it's fast! 3DS downloadable games don't take up much space and I don't put music on it, so it should last a long time.

I have been playing DOA since the first one. Yes, I play DOA not really for the fighting gameplay but for something else. What can I say? I reviewed a couple of older versions before and DOA5 for PS4 is the best version so far even though it's not a new game. The graphics is not among the best on Ps4 but to me that's a good thing, otherwise I would not be able to sleep at night. Frame rate is solid, and the PS4 controller is perfect for fighting games.If you are not into fighting games, this game is then really for guys who like certain things. If you like fighting games but don't need to play every title in the genre, DOA is not a series you will enjoy.

This Hoover cordless vacuum uses a LiIon battery, which means it's less susceptible to memory effect seen in older NiCd batteries used in cordless vacuums. This gizmo actually consists of a handheld and a housing unit with the traditional handle and roller, so you can use it in two modes: as a handheld or as an upright.Since it's cordless, it's best for light duties - and at those it does a very good job. I use it on hardwood, low pile rugs and carpet and it picks up most dirt and dust. It's not powerful enough if your rug or carpet is dirty, but that's not the kind of cleaning this is designed for. It's really for quick vacuuming as well handheld vacuuming chores.The build quality is very good - better than my last Hoover light-duty vacuum. Charging is reasonably fast.

The Nuud case is unlike any other case that claims to be waterproof I have seen: it actually leaves your iPad's screen (including the camera lens) exposed to the elements.The back cover is the typical Lifeproof type, although to my dismay I found the cutout for the back camera not perfect aligned with my iPad mini 2's back camera. (This case is designed for the Touch ID mini 3 but is also compatible with mini 2 and the original non-Retina mini.) It does not block the camera's view but is a bit unsightly when you notice it.  Otherwise, the usual ports and buttons are covered.The front piece is the surprise here: it's just a frame without a screen protector. You can actually see it in the product picture on Amazon: your hand actually touches the iPad mini's screen. The frame creates a seal around the screen rather than enclosing it completely. You must do a water test with a "dummy" before installing your precious iPad mini.This is where I felt I was not sure I could trust the Nuud. I did the water test and thought the dummy didn't get wet, but my spouse saw otherwise. Also, even if I had been 100% correct, that the Nuud does create a waterproof seal around the screen, leaving the screen completely exposed really does not sit well with me or the actual user of the iPad mini 2, who had wanted to take the device into our city pool. Also, on a day-to-day basis your screen is completely exploded to dust and fingerprint and dirt. You cannot have a separate film-type screen protector on because that would be detrimental to the sealing functionality of the case.In the end, I decided not to keep this on the iPad mini. For casual users especially those who are more concerned with rain or those who want use this in a controlled environment like shower or bathtub, it's probably a good case. Still, you must always keep in mind your iPad's screen is left naked.

As someone interested in math and politics, I was looking forward to reading this book. But I came away disappointed. The problem is simple: the author uses one-sided pseudo math to argue for a left-wing agenda. I'm no right-winger; I'm all for objective nonpartisanship, and I vote according to this lifelong principle. This author pretends to be analyzing issues arising from our Constitution in terms of math/statistics but he only tells you what he thinks is relevant and, gasp!, correct. Anything else is stupid and ancient and outdated.  He fails to see that human psychology and behavior and social issues cannot be modeled in math. His argument that (traditions-minded) politicians "ignore" "sound math" therefore are anti-human is just an example of the left-wing mantra "if you disagree with me, you are a bigot who will be swept away to hell by the progressiveness of human development".

It's hard to complain when this is only 14 bucks. NES cartridges are prone to dust and dirt so cleaning the pin contacts is a daily necessity. I buy my cartridges from a local specialty shop where they offer free cleaning as well as a generous exchange policy. The system is very light, despite including an AC adapter and two controllers. It makes pulling out a cartridge a little dangerous, each time as if you are gonna break the system. I have leaned to hold down the system with one hand and pull the cartridge out straight up.Like I said, it costs so little so it's hard to complain about the minor details. It does play all the NeS games.

This is a perfect low safety gate for family with kids. The height is a little over two feet, so if you have a cat or dog you may need to discourage it from jumping over, but otherwise this gate works well to keep them out of areas you don't want them to go into. In a hallway or at bottom of stairs you have the option to pressure-mount the gate just double-check the gate fits when extended and also your wall or banister can be used for pressure mounting safely.If used at top of stairs, hardware screw mounting is a must for safety reasons. (If you just want to keep a pet out, maybe it's okay to pressure-mount here, too.) this means drilling holes.The extended part of the gate is easy to operate even when single-handed. The gate feels solid in build quality. I have had positive experience with this brand for many years , so I feel I can recommend this gate again.

I was excited to be able to receive this from Amazon Vine for review. But I just couldn't get it to work, period. The latest version of the WeMo app downloaded from the App Store simply could not find either of the two bulbs. The app would either look forever or freeze. In addition, the link unit turned itself off frequently; even when on, it would blink non-stop until I unplugged it - all this after the app told me the link had been set up properly. The app got a low rating on the App Store. Now i understand why.

This is an ionizing air purifier for small space. They key word here is small. Such as inside an enclosed vehicle or small bathroom.An ionizing air purifier cleans the air and bad odors by releasing free ions into the air. The purified air has a slight metallic smell to it at the air outlet, but as far as my experience goes this is normal. (Whether it's safe in the long term, that I haven't been able to find out).This small unit comes with an AC adapter for home use and also a car 12V adapter for vehicle use. It has a small fan which has three settings. The ionizer also has three settings. There is no separate power switch.The fan is quiet at the low setting, tolerable at the medium setting, and can be drowned out at the high setting if you have your stereo on. The works best at getting rid of smoke particles and moldy odor. It works in a small bathroom against toilet odors as well. It's not too effective for general bad odor like rotten foods or smelly feet in a car. But it does make my daily commute feel cleaner, a welcome experience when I sit in parking-lot traffic.

This is a super-fun bath/pool toy. The toy sub looks really well built with good details. It's also easy for kids to hold. It can submerge with the tank filled or float with the tank drained. A tetherd claw captures the included squid squeeze toy or many other small bath toys. A water-safe diecast car is included, although this last item does look and feel cheap.This toy is fun for kids from 3 to 10. And it can educate the young minds about how subs work. I happen to have bought a picture book on submarines a fee months ago, so my kids love reading the book and then playing with this little toy at bath time. I'm definitely buying at least another one. Makes a great birthday gift, too.

(I should note that I received one of these from Amazon Vine for review purposes. The gate was not packaged in any plastic wrap but was instead directly placed in an outer cardboard box. Due to either poor packaging or rough handling by UPS, the top handle was partially damaged during shipment. I do not include this in my review here.)This is an excellent indoor gate for keeping babies and toddlers and also small pets from certain areas. In the case of small pets like the cat we have, you need to train them not to jump over this gate, as it's pretty low in height, about 2.5 ft.The best thing about the gate is it can be hardware mounted via screwed-in hinges like most safety gates but can also be mounted via its built-in pressure pads. If you mount it at the top of stairs, you must use the screw-in method because the pressure mount mode does not create a strong enough hold. A toddler or a running pet can easily take it down, hence not safe for top of stairs. Instructions and screws are included for hinge mount. Of course, you must drill holes on the wall and/or banister. In this mode, you swing the gate open.I use this at the bottom of our indoor staircase, so I have it pressure-mounted. Ditto if you use it in a doorway. In this mode you can swing the gate or slide the mobile panel. The beauty here is it's very easy to mount on the pressure pads. You do need to pay attention to alignment to ensure a strong mount, and I recommend doing this with a helper. But it's pretty much an easy job for any adult, even mothers. :)The lift handle is big and easy to operate, unlike Safety 1st gates I bought and installed in the past. (I have bought and used several different Safety 1st baby gates.) There is a button you need to slide and hold in order to open the gate. If you have carpal tunnel you do need to be careful.

This bedwetting warning system consists of two pieces: A flexible plastic sensor unit which you tape to the outside of the child's underwear (obviously where the pee comes out), and a chubby alarm unit that your child must wear on the night shirt. The two pieces are connected by a electrical cord that measures about 3 ft. This is NOT a wireless system.While the alarm unit is not heavy, it's thick and does require 2 alkaline batteries. The cord and the alarm unit may not be comfortable for your kid. This is unfortunately the case with my son. He hates wearing the alarm unit. He does have sensitive skin so he find it hard to fall asleep wearing the alarm. The cord also makes him feel uncomfortable because he likes to sleep on his sides. Your child may not object to this setup, though.If your child can tolerate this system, it should work well in waking him or her up when urine comes out and into contact with the censor. The manual says if the system helps your child stay dry for 14 days in a row, you can discontinue using it. I tested the censors by simulating urine on underwear and it did set off the alarm. The alarm has different tones so your child doesn't get used to one tone and fall back asleep when awakened. The idea is he/she wakes up to the alarm and over time conditions him to associating bedwetting with being woken up by an alarm.

Like many, I've been a Transformers fan all my life, and my kids are the same. This Bumblebee features a "one-step flip" design where it transforms from robot to car via raising and flipping the right leg. Going the other way is also easy, although the two tabs that release the locking mechanism is poorly constructed and often require extra effort.What the simplicity in the design takes away is the whole magical experience of hiding away all those body parts in order to transform, the very essence of Transformers. Also, this new design makes the two legs complete useless in robot mode, and you can't even turn or bend them. Bumblebee's head looks unusually small due to the new placement. In the end, there just isn't too much replay value, especially in the robot mode, despite the presence of a largely gimmicky disc-shooting hand.

This is the first time I'm using Charmin's bath tissue (aka toilet paper). I noticed three things to the paper i buy at Costco, Sam's Club and my local supermarket.First, the rolls are the biggest I have seen. They are big because they include a lot of sheets and also because each ply seems thicker than other brands.Two, the thicker ply does seem to be accompanied by the higher-than-usual quality if the paper itself. I've noticed that the paper doesn't tear as easily as the brands I'm accustomed to, which is a very welcome change.Third, the paper is smooth on its surface. Now, while I like this smoothness, my spouse doesn't. So this aspect is a matter of individual taste.

This book, published by a UK or India-based publisher, presents some programming concepts for kids. It's not really for parents but rather for kids themselves to read and follow along. Two programming environments are introduced: MIT's difficult-to-use Scratch (definitely NOT forbkindergarteners) and the popular adult language Python.Some concepts are introduced and the kids get 3 snall projects for Scratch and 4 for Python. Either because the programs have updates since publication or the authors were being careless, there are steps that simply don't work. The way the concepts are presented could use better organization and explanation.I would say this book is for kids at least 11 years old, i.e., in 6th grade or higher.

These are very nice, quality fabric napkins, much like what you'd find at a five-star restaurant. Out of the packaging, they didn't smell bad like some new fabrics, which was a relief for me. They felt soft yet solid, and looked classy. I washed the napkins in cold water and detergent and didn't observe color coming off. Definitely a nice set IMHO.

I've had this for over 3 weeks and I'm really happy with the drive.  2TB is not a lot these days but I use it in a NAS (network-attached storage) server here at home, along with 3 other drives between 2 and 3 TB each.  The drive is fast, no doubt, with its 7200 RPM rotational speed and SATA III interface and 64 MB of cache memory.  More importantly, it's quiet and, even without any benchmarking or even stopwatching, it appears to resume from sleep/standby very quickly (I noticed this when I first put it in an external drive enclosure and attached it to my Toshiba laptop).  I really don't think anyone can go wrong with this drive.WD says it includes the latest vibration-protection technology in this drive.  I have no way of verifying this.  I've never had a problem with drives crashing when I move my NAS server around gingerly even while it's still on and working.  Will a drive like this survive an earthquake?  I'll probably never know unless an earthquake does occur here and I'm not dead from it. J/k.

I didn't like T-Mobile but wanted to keep my old number without going through porting, so I went with this as a prepaid phone. It's really nice. The white shell can be changed easily. The screen is quite nice, way better than the screens you get on similarly priced Android phones. The system is easy to use and very fast, never crashes. I love it!

I bought this on Amazon.com from a third-party seller, unfortunately they send me a gray-market ZS30.  The instructions are in English and Chinese (no Spanish so you know this is not for the American market as half, or more, of the U.S. population now speak Spanish as a mother tongue!), but more importantly, the video formats are all 25p, which is not the 30p formats we use here stateside.But the camera is absolutely excellent.  It has GPS which finds location faster than my older ZS7 (but still nowhere as fast as the instantaneous locationing on my Nokia Lumia phone).  Panasonic's Quick Menu is always a pleasure to use, as it lets you access the most commonly used functions for each shooting mode.  The location of the video button is a bit weird as it's located right next to the power button, on the top to the right of the shutter, so sometimes, in the dark, I forget which is which.Yes, you can zoom optically, up to 20 times, while shooting video, and the motor noise is zero in the video captured.  Panasonic's tried-and-true intelligent zoom feature can increase the effective zoom by up to another 30% without degrading image quality whatsoever. (This can happen because the ZS20's sensor has more pixels than even the highest resolution output by the camera.)  I do wish there were a raw output option.  The manual mode lets you adjust exposure and speed manually (but not focus distance), and is relatively intuitive to use.Picture quality is nothing short of excellent, even in dimly lit situations.  in the old days Panasonic's camera tended to output noisy images.  I don't know if they still use Sony's image sensors, but this one gives better, smoother images.  You can tell by opening a picture in Windows Photo Viewer and going to 100% and looking at the pixels.Video image is excellent, too, and to my surprise, the non-US 25p formats play back well on my Toshiba laptop in Windows Media Player and VLC Player.  No stuttering whatsoever.  One minor gripe is when you zoom optically, and when the scene lacks contrast, the focus tends to hunt around more often than on my previous ZS7 or on any of my Sony digital cameras (primarily the TX series).  This is not an uncommon problem with auto-focus digital cameras when it comes to video recording, but I'm surprised it's an issue here but not with the older ZS7.I got the white ZS30 and, boy, is it stylish!  It's also ergonomic (save for the location of the video recording button).  The high-res LCD screen is also touch screen like on any smartphone nowadays. The icons do tend to be a little smallish, but still tappable.  You also get mechanical buttons and D-pad as usual, so it's really easy to use whether you prefer touch or old-style button push.The ZS30 is a great, top-notch all-around compact camera for all sorts of purposes, from travel to portrait to parties.  When it comes to taking pictures worth saving (as opposed to sharing with the 3,000 strangers on your Facebook friends list), a good camera like this beats any smartphone (unless you have the Lumia 1020 phone with its 41MP sensor).

This baby monitor product comes in two plain boxes, one containing the camera and the wireless monitor (called "Lila") and the other a small motion monitor (called "Oma") which you place with the baby to monitor breathing movements.  I'll focus on the "Lila" part.I really like the small LCD monitor.  It's cute, it's stylish, it's functional, and it's easy to carry.  The button felt a little stiff to me at first but I got used to the tactile feedback in no time.  The small size makes it very pocketable, so there's no reason why you can't carry it with you. Range on the wireless reception is good for a single-family house, although like most video monitors the image starts getting noisy when you're a floor below where the camera is. When there's insufficient light, the camera returns gray-scale images, and I feel this camera has a sensor that's not as light-sensitive as the one on my old Sony video baby monitor.  One con of the portability of the monitor here is the screen is smallish, so if you're a grandparent, no disrespect here but you might have a hard time seeing the baby's movements.The monitor uses a battery but like every other baby video monitor product I've used or seen, the camera must be plugged in.  For this price, I feel they should have made the camera battery-powered, too.  At least give the customer that option.Overall I feel this is a nice product that works well, if you're okay with the small LCD screen.  Some video baby monitors on the market today have up to 7-inch screens.  BTW I'll never recommend you using a mobile app, because there have been reports of bad people hacking into WiFi networks to watch what you and/or your baby is doing.

It's unfortunate, I must admit, that I have to rate this upright vacuum only 2 stars ("I don't like it").  It's actually a pretty capable bagless vacuum. It's easy to put together, although you do need a Philips screwdriver to assemble the handle to the body. It sucks pretty well, and the spring-loaded power cord management system reminds me of my old Panasonic vacuum, which is to say it's really convenient as you don't have to wind and unwind the power cord each time.Unfortunately, the vacuum has a very strong chemical odor every time I use it, to the point that I actually fear using it in my kids' rooms. My kids (like most modern youngsters) suffer from dust allergies (among other respiratory problems), that's why I have several HEPA-rated vacuums.  This one uses a HEPA filter, too.  But every time I run it, the strong odor, which seems a mixture of rubbery and oil smells, permeates the air.  It really kills the sense of keeping the house clean.I've never had a vacuum that gave out an odor like this before.  I really wanted to like this vacuum.  I'm going to keep the 2 star rating until the odor goes away after I use it in the living room for a few more weeks or months. (I needed to post this review as I got the vacuum from Amazon Vine and we're required to post a review within a month of requesting the product for review.)

This is a really good thermo jar for the kids, as long as you are aware that its inside is really small, much smaller than suggested by its total body volume. It's best for a lunch-sized hot soup, that's about it.  It can't even hold enough pasta for a 1st-grader's lunch.  I really wish the maker had gone to a bigger size and made it more practical. But if the 10 oz. rated volume is enough for you, I think this is going to please you.I wasn't able to measure how long it held the soup hot. My son eats lunch 3 hours after leaving the house, and every time he says the soup is still hot.  The label says it can keep food hot for 5 hours and cold for 7 hours.  The jar is well made.  But like I said, if its inside usable volume were bigger, I'd have rated this 5 stars and bought another 5 of them.  Still, I can recommend it to folks who are okay with the small volume.

I got the brown case, and it looks really nice. The quality seems okay, but I'll have to wait a few weeks before deciding whether the manmade material lasts.  It fits my T-Mobile Lumia 925 perfectly, and so far is a pleasure to use. Like it.

I use a TyIt Powerplant LiIon charger all the time, so my experience with this Mipow charger inevitably compares with my overall positive experience with the TyIt product.I have to say I'm rather disappointed by this charger. It just feels cheaply made. It comes with a USB extension cord (the male-to-female type) and a small cheap pouch, but the maker fails to include an AC charger, much like the case with the Kindle products.  So you're supposed to plug the input connector into a PC's USB port or an existing USB charger.The input connector is simply ridiculous. It consists of just the plastic connector inside a normal USB plug (the white plastic in USB 1 and 2, and the blue plastic in USB 3). The connector has two metal contacts. The poorly written instruction sheet, printed in poor ink and in tiny fonts, make no mention of which way this "naked" connector should go. I actually tried many times before deciding that you must insider the "naked" connector into a USB port so that the metal contacts touch the plastic connector (black in USB 1 and 2, blue in USB 3) inside the port.  Imagine doing this on a PC and you forgot which is which.  Adding a normal USB casing would have made the user's life so much easier.I tried this with a couple of USB chargers I already have, including my Acer tablet's AC adapter with USB slot and a dedicated RCA wall USB charger, but somehow the Mipow never charged.  I finally plugged it into a Lenovo laptop. It still wouldn't charge. I finally used the included extension cable, and then it started charging.  At the start of charging the Mipow, two of the indicator were lit, indicating 25-50% of power inside the cells.  It took over 8 hours (maybe 9... I'm not sure) for it to fully charge.  Imagine charging this power brick when it's completely discharged.  Like many unhappy Kindle users, Mipow users probably have to wait 20 hours for it to charge from zero to full from a computer USB port.  Not a positive experience.The input connector shares the same space as the micro-USB output connector. This part is like the TyIt Powerplant product, in that a micro-USB output is built-in.  Like the latter, the Mipow also includes a full-sized USB output port (female), so you can charge products like Sony and Apple that use proprietary cables.  The built-in micro-USB does not fit into my Nokia Lumia 1520 phone's micro-USB port well.  If I move the connector just a little, the 1520 reports the charging power has been disconnected.  This makes me very unhappy.  I've never had any quality issues with the TyIt, which I bought from Amazon.com a few months ago.In short, I feel the Mipow has some quality issues, and the use of a "naked" USB connector for input charging is a very poor design choice.

The list in this book is a bit outdated, nonetheless it's a great fan's guide to the many Pokmon characters. Detailed info is given and the artwork is really nice. Print and paper quality is high, too.

Got this to help my son get into good studying habits. He's older than his peers yet has trouble with the basic stuff all his friends are already good at. I found the book's contents to be uneven in difficulties, which makes the whole thing frustrating to use, because as a parent I have to decide which exercises are the appropriate ones for a kindergartner, and I'm not qualified to make those decisions, which is why I bought this book to begin with!  I also bought two other grade volumes and found the same problem: some exercises are super hard while others are super easy.

Witchy Wolf BookOne 5 StarHot, Original and lots of actionWitches, Wolves and other supernatural beings are in this first book of a new series.  Well written and very enjoyable to read.  Very original store line with good character interaction. A new twist with a witch becoming a wolf. When she doesn't even know shes either.  And yet someone is out to get her.  Will the Hot Local Alpha be able to save her? Good love story with some typical man behavior as well as some non-typical stuff going on. Looking forward to the next book in the series. I have this book from the Fated Mated box set as well as being given a gifted copy from the author.Peril: Witchy Wolf Book Two 5 StarAction, adventure and some mysteries solvedThis second book of Witchy Wolf series is a great addition to the series and yet it reads like a self-contained book.  Great character interplay and character development.  Loved who Chloes father turns out to be.  And what a piece of work her mother is. You have old enemies come back to haunt Chloe from the past.  And possible new ones coming. Very original story line with lots of action and extremely entertaining to read.  Well written and very enjoyable book and series.  Looking forward to the next installment. I was gifted a copy of this book by the author for an honest review.Cursed: Witchy Wolf Book Three 4 StarsTreat of dangerIn this book we have lots of threats to Chloe coming from a few angles.  Her father and Grandmother keep trying to help her with her magic but it just doesnt seem to come to her.  And then she starts to get sick.  Shes not supposed to be able to get sick.  With Chloes Mom escaped out of the mental institution with unknown magic powers it keeps Chloe confined to the compound.  Well written and enjoyable to read.

Breaker Hart is a Bear shifter and a fireman That tend to care more about the kids hes saving then his own safety.  Lorelei Roberts is a forensic scientist who specializes in arson investigation. Both are set up by well meaning friends to the Dating Agency.  Only before Eve can do her magic the two happen to meet in her office by accident and are instantly attracted to each other. This story has some great action and adventure and lots of funny stuff and quirks going on.  Always fun to read stories written by this author.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

Great story about finding a true mate.  With the last of their kind Alaric the Saber tooth were finally find her after a year of mate dreaming.  Lucky for him his mate is fine with supernatural type being she's human.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

My favorite Shiftr story to date written by this author.  I love the characters and the fact the two main ones both have kids from previous relationships. Lots of action with just the right amount of loving.  You can really feel the emotions both Lori and Bruno are going through and why.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

Corrine lost her true mate who was once known as Felix. After the Kingdom Guard changed him be became Zane and Felix died along with their mate bond. Javier was born into a Were family but never found his own wolf, never shifting and is what is called a Ghost wolf. Can these two lost s reach out to each other and help each other to heal?  Hauntingly beautiful story that at one point brought me to tears and happy in the end.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

This is an awesome story with lots of great elements making you unable to stop reading once started.  You have a new girl in town thinking to start belonging to a new pack.  Only her cousin she was going to live with had just up and moved the day before. You have a gypsy pack who works construction just outside the town with a very hot Alpha named Roman, that's got a warrant for his arrest.  The town makes Chelsea the sheriff in hopes she will be able to arrest Roman after they seen her handle him picking on a young man. And then there's the slaughtered sheep to solve.  Well written and very entertaining story with lots of twists to keep you entertained.

A Bear in Need Book One  5 StarsLove is a pure form of magicThis is a love story that is full of suspense and lots of surprises. It's got a curse and witches and shifters and family as well as lost friends. Liz Malone is back to her home town to take care of her grandmothers estate but while at a bar that night she meets her school girl crush Brandon Mitchell. And when he sees her it's like a pull he has to follow. Later figuring out she's his mate but he can't have her because of a curse that will take her away if he mates her. Well written and very entertaining to read this self-contained story. And yet we have two more brothers that need to break their curse as well.A Bear in Hiding Book Two  5 StarsDeigning your other halfIn this well written story, we get a glimpse of a different side of Alanas.  But the main story revolves around Brian and Emma who is on the run from her abusive Ex.  But not knowing that the bear attack she had a few month ago did something to her.  Brian tries to help her and almost gets himself killed.  Emmas determined to leave and Brian just knows shes his mate but with the curse hanging over his head he just might have to let her leave.  Well written and very enjoyable to read.A Bear in Charge Book Three  5 StarsThe truth revealed about AlanaThis is the third book of the series and yet is still a self contained story. This is Bryce and Alanas story and how so many things are not what they seem to be.  Something is draining the Hollow of its magic and everyone presumes it may be Alana.  But Alana what to know whats happening along with everyone else since it effects her magic as well. Bryce is having a difficult time controlling his bear and it may just be that Alana is in the area or it may have something to do with the Hollow.  I loved every one of the books in this series and this one is no exception.  Its well written and keeps your interest throughout the book and is very entertaining to read.

Tempted by the Bear 1 - V. VaughnFurever - Kate Kent  4.5 StarsLearning to trust againShort and sweet story about being jilted in love and learning to trust again when the real thing comes along.  Alicia fell hard for the wrong man, one who ended up marking and turning her and then dumped her.  When Two hot and hunky weremen come along and want her she doesnt trust herself or what their saying to her. Enjoyable short self-contained story with a nice HEA.Controversy - Elle ThorneRhino You Love Me - Lola Kidd 5 StarsFinding your one when you least expect itThis is a great HEA story thats in a setting that is great for more story to come.  It's a self-contained story with some action and adventure.  Curvy girl go to Shifter run Island for a vacation that they won.  Addison meet Chet and even though the attraction is there, Addison isn't so sure about Chet's full of himself attitude. Chet was just about to leave the job and Island in search of a mate when Addison shows up.  He's determined to win her over to his way of thinking. Well written and fun story to read.Desert Hunt - Anna Lowe 5 StarsMisfits that MatchRae has a secret that she thinks no one knows about.  Shes not just a wolf, shes more.  Zack is Wolf, Coyote, Navajo (Dine) and white man and if Rae would except it and trust him, hes also her mate. Then there is Jed from her old pack determined to take her for his own and her current Alpha who plans on having her mate his son and heir, yet she and Zack dont know this.  Lots happens in this well written and wonderful self-contained story and yet itReady to Bear - Ivy SinclairBlood of the Alpha - Part One - Amy Green

This installment of the story is so good that at one point I had tears streaming down my face.  Wolfs and bears fighting and a long trek across the Tundra. Erik agreeing to go to the Siluit pack and allowing Astrid to go as well came as a surprise.  But he has his own motives for it.  Now Astrid has to find her own way and will she ever escape?  Well written and very entertaining to read.

With all these newly made werewolves trying to adjust to being one, the last thing they need is an unknown trying to kill one or more of them.  And whats up with the sheriff and thinking Charlotte smells nice.  Shes nothing like the girls hes always had one night stands with and found attractive.  This is a fun and exciting story to read with lots of action going on.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

Mandy M. Roth - Prince of Flight (King of Prey World) 5 StarsDenial is fruitlessThis is Keonaes story and how is has kept himself in the human realm for centuries after being betrayed by a woman he thought loved him and the Vultures that harmed him to the point of leaving scars.  And the dive bar that hold the woman Lark, that has kept him company for the last month and he her. But she has her scars and secrets as well as him.  Well written and a self-contained story yet part of an ongoing series.  Kept my interest throughout the story.Michelle M. Pillow - Stranded with the Cajun (Captured by a Dragon-Shifter)Carina Wilder - Hunted 5 StarsReal or Fairytale?This is a modern day tail of Herne the Hunter. A woman from the US whose name is Ella comes to this country for a few months to get away from her life and have an adventure.  In this small town she goes to is having its annual Festival in honor of Herne the Hunter.  But it seems like some didnt really believe anymore and made fun of him.  But Ella strays away from the other women who are just spectators and finds herself finding a truth or is it fantasy in the handsome man who tries to send her back for her own good.  This is a fun story to get immersed in with lots of fantasy that just might be real.  Well written and very entertaining.Cristina Rayne - Seeking the Oni (Incarnations of Myth) 5 StarsSometimes humans can be scarierVery unique story with monsters and myths from another country come to America. When Hannah is asked by his supervisor to delivery an envelope to the one place she was told at hire to never go, something just seemed off.  And a new world was opened to her but not before someone tried to kill her.  Could be the beginning of a series or a one off story, either way is entertaining to read.Eve Vaughn - ThiefJaide Fox - Alien Disruption (Captured by Aliens)JC Andrijeski - The Rings Fighter (Alien Apocalypse)Kim Knox - Something WickedMichele Bardsley - A Damned Deed (Deed Brothers)Renee George - A Door to Midnight (Midnight Shift)Mandy Rosko - Gonna Make You Howl (Dangerous Creatures)Tracey H. Kitts - SacrificeElla Drake - Kilt in Space (Space Grit)Jaycee Clark - The SandmanCandice Gilmer - Guarding Her Secret (The Mythicals)Lexy Cole - Billionaire Shifters in Manhattan (The Wolves of Central Park)Jessica Collins - The Singularity

Cassie finally decides its time to move on with her life two years after the death of her military husband.  With the help of a few cousins she turns her house into a rehab home for injured soldiers. Her cousin Will, starts bringing her injured supernaturals for her to help.  The first is Cade and there is an instant attraction and connection between the two.  Trouble comes from one of the other injurers past that catches up to her.  Well written and very entertaining to read.

Chase knows its crazy that after his sister saves him, for him to go back but he has to.  His mate is there, even if she doesnt know shes his mate. And does she even want to be saved?  This has a bit of a twist on things and gets real interesting fast.  Fun story to read.

Calder has Liam as a captive to lure Alanna to him to another Arctic station with more people to try and infect.  For some reason Parker didnt shoot to kill most and now he will need everyones help to bring down Calder.  Exciting action packed and very entertaining to read.

Calder the 100,000 year old Saber tooth tiger wants to infect the world and wants Alanna to be the mother of his cubs.  Her mate Liam and everyone else are fighting to stay alive.  Then comes The Sheriff Parker to exterminate everyone at the station.  Lots of action and nothing seems to as planned for anyone. Well written and enjoyable to read this fast paced book.

A group of bears in the Arctic doing research finds something amazing in the Ice.  Ex boyfriend Oliver, brings Dr. Alanna MacCready in to help with the new research.  But things are not as they seem.  What or who they found in the Ice and what starts happening at the station is pure chaos.  Great first installment to the series.

Avery is a hunter, born in a family of hunters.  But ever since her father death (Murder?) and her Uncle took over things have changed.  To include her and she doesnt truly believe it was an accident.  Chase believes Avery is his mate.  But once she found out what he is she had to cut ties with him. A year later Chase calls her and needs her help to get his sister back who has been captured.  Plenty of action happens in this entertaining story.

Benny was cursed as a teenager to become a Sasquatch.  Elena is visiting her aunt only to find out shes a witch with true site.  She sees people as they really are inside.  So when she sees Benny she doesnt see the monster but the young handsome man he should be and that hes a good person.  Other stuff is also happening in the book with the panthers trying to find the bad female Sasquatch.  Benny and Elena ignite in this well written and entertaining story.
Awesome series.  You have adventure and hot dragon shifters.  Every book bring something new into the story.  Well written and very entertaining to read.  Love everything about this series.

Diana watched as her brother is in a fight for him life in the coliseum.  After getting caught Chase is now a forced fighter in death matches. Draven a local with lots of money and prestige in Emerald Isle see Diana and believes shes watching her lover, and why he cares is that she unknowably is his mate.  Seeing Draven, Diana thinks to enlist his help. This is all set in a world where some big catastrophe happened and the shifter / human balance changed.  Very entertaining beginning to a new series.

Can't wait to try these for Xmas this year.  I've set them up without installing to enjoy for mood lighting to the music.  Really fun.  I think the neighbors will be jealous when they see my light show for Xmas this year.  Now I just have to buy the clear tubing for it so it's fully waterproof under the eaves of the house.

Windows 10 compatible!  I was worried since I bought this when I had Win 8 then I upgraded to the new Win 10 so I procrastinated installing.  Duh... why didn't I just pop it in a USB port and give it 30 seconds to install?  You don't need the CD or anything just have your system running and put this in any USB port.  You get an icon in the hidden task tray that has the bluetooth icon and says "Bluetooth Devices".  Right click that icon and you have all your settings and options to use bluetooth on your Win10 system now. Literally a "no brainer".  And it's so tiny!!!!  My bluetooth speaker instantly showed up along with my cellphone.  Nothing to it...  good price too.  Now I want 3 more for my laptops and husband's computer.

I love Lana's voice.  My husband loves this remix.  I'm more a fan of the original version.  He had me find this specific remix and get it for him so I was surprised he even knew who Lana Del Rey was.  I love her song Video Games.
Fixed our problem with a gadget that lost it's cable.
Worked perfectly on my light sets
Works great!  I love the colors!  Can't wait to put them up for Christmas this year and see what the neighbors think.

I'm in love.  Here is the newest object of my affection... the Zyliss French Press mug.  I'm a coffee fanatic.  I drink only organic free trade exotic beans from all over the world and am as finicky about roast, pure water, grinding, and brewing as any other coffee connoisseur out there... but this mug is an exception to my rules.  Cardinal rule #1... Thou shalt not touch plastic to roasting, grinding or brewing coffee.  UNLESS you are in a rush and on the road or work in a crazy hectic job and still want to enjoy your beloved french press coffee from home as an instant coffee.  This little baby is a snap to use.  Toss 1 spoon full of your fresh ground coffee beans in the bottom, pour on you purified hot but not boiling water, leave a little head room for cream, sugar and your press...  then slide the press into the channel slowly and press down to the bottom... place in your organic cream, honey or pure cane sugar... stir... pop the top on...  and VIOLA! you're enjoying a cup of joe that makes Starbucks seem as gross as that old Folgers in the can.  Oh sorry if I offended the Starbucks and Folgers drinkers...  but the good news is... you too can use this nifty french press to make a cheap cup of coffee to supply your caffeine needs for the day.At this price... I'm buying another one.  At this price... if you're a coffee drinking family... everyone can have their own fresh brewed to go every morning.  You just can't beat this gizmo!PS... the ONLY 2 cons I have found about this cup is...1. Do not fill it all the way up... and hold onto it firmly with a good grip when you SLOWLY press down the french press piece or you will be making a total mess and getting coffee grounds inside your coffee... maybe even burning your hand.2.  When you add the hot water the internal air inside the double wall expands and escapes making a funny hissing whistling sound that you can barely hear so it confused me at first about where the noise was coming from.  I see nothing wrong with the cup and just think of it as my new cup has a personality!  It talks to me and tells me how good that coffee is it's brewing for me...hahahahaa

Okay... You can safely buy this grinder and save your money compared to all the other identical grinders on Amazon... and by now I'm sure you are confused.  This one is identical to all the ones that look just like it.  It's going to do the job the same in every way as all those other grinders that look identical to this one.  First of all... it's the size of a tall pepper grinder like they have in the restaurants... that sack of coffee shown is tiny. So keep that perspective in mind when you are looking at these grinders. They all are the same size. This grinder has nice quality slightly brushed stainless steel.  Mine has no flaws. The bottom simply pulls off with a twist while pulling down.  Mine was a bit stuck when I got it but after some rocking back and forth while pulling and twisting it finally came loose and now it works perfectly.  Just don't shove it so hard up into the top that you  have difficulty when you go to remove it.  I like that design because there is no threads to wear out or break.  It's going to last a long time.  The top cap come off so you can adjust the grinder.  The directions are clear and I didn't have to adjust mine at all.  It's perfect for my french press grind as it came.  You just put the beans in the top and put the cap back on, place the handle on the top notch and grind.  Here is where you may encounter some issues.  It is a small grinder... so it requires a firm grip on the middle of the grinder and place the base on a flat surface to provide vertical support.  DON"T PRESS DOWNWARD ON THE HANDLE WHEN GRINDING.  This is the rule with ALL manual coffee grinders.  It is the prime reason they wear out and break.  When you grind use NO downward pressure.  Keep your hand on the knob of the hand and make circles that are as parallel to the flat surface as you can.  Your effort will be reduced and grinding will go easier.  Pressing downward on the handle achieves NOTHING but breaking the handle and putting stress on the burr.  It will rock the central axle the burr is attached to in a back and forth motion that will ruin the mechanism and the burr.  So while grinding coffee... keep a steady hand going in an even flat circular pattern as possible to get the best out of your grinder.  You'll notice this requires a firm controlling grip on the base of the grinder to maintain stability while grinding.If you're looking for more than coffee for 2 people... this grinder probably isn't for you unless you just like the exercise and are a super conscientious "green" fanatic who can't afford a bigger coffee grinder... or you're living in a tiny house... or whatever reason you have for wanting to own a small grinder and grind pots of coffee with it.  Personally, I'm the only coffee drinker in the house and I want 2 or 3 cups per day so this is all I need.  At any rate... I'm super glad I bought this grinder especially now that I found out from so many people that it's identical to theirs that cost twice the price.  I paid $11 for this and most of them cost $17 to $25 for the exact same item.  I can confirm the burr is ceramic.  The grind is infinitely adjustable.  The bottom catch cup is a plastic cup surrounded by stainless steel so you can see through the little window at how much coffee you have in the catch cup.For the purists out there... No plastic is involved with the actual bean grinding process.  There is a plastic support inside the grinder that houses the axle and it's only function is to keep the axle rod centered inside the tall cylinder hopper where you place the beans. It does not rotate.  It does not perform any grinding function and once the beans enter the burr they are only contacted with ceramic and metal.  The only plastic is... the knob, the internal axle support, the little catch cup housed inside the steel cylinder.  So if you are going totally plastic free in your lifestyle... this isn't for you. But... if you are only worried about the health risks with plastic... as I am... this is a safe buy for you.  Both the plastic cup and the plastic support are the BPA free types... rigid plastic.  The internal support looks and feels like high density melamine.  The bottom cup looks poly.Cleaning can be performed using white rice ( the cheap hulled kind of rice that I don't eat but is most common in America ). Just put a tablespoon full in there and grind it up.  It soaks up oils and cleans the burr.  A shot of canned air after cleaning gets all the rice flour you just made out of the works. Also the removable handle can be secured with a rubber band for traveling and storage.Summary - Excellent bang for the buck... one of the few cheap buys that isn't cheaper in quality.  Grinds a great bean for all brewing methods. Perfect for 2 people but not for a whole pot of coffee for 4 or 6.  Easy to clean, small, portable, can hold several days worth of coffee inside for grinding along the way on a camping or other trip.  This one is identical and just as high quality as the more expensive grinders that look like this on Amazon.

We bought this to replace our pump that came with the Intex 15 foot round pool because the pump that came with it was not doing the job in South Texas.  I'm sure it would work in a less hot and humid area of the country but here in Houston... we need a massive pump so this one is doing the trick for us.  I LOVE IT.  So much easier to clean and use than the original pump.  It is massive overkill for our tiny pool and that's perfect for us with this crazy algae that happens down here. My pool is now crystal clear all the time and the skimmer is now working properly for the first time since we got the pool.  I can vacuum the bottom just using the auxiliary port while still filtering the pool at the same time.  It has plenty of suction to even pick up small gravel that our idiot yard guy slung into the pool by accident.  If you plan on using this pump for the smaller Intex pools with the smaller diameter hoses... you'll need to buy "Hose Conversion Adapter Kit for Intex 1500gph and 2500gph pumps" that is sold here on Amazon. Just type that into the Amazon search and you'll find it.  You'll also probably need some O rings 026 Buna O-Ring, 70A Durometer, Black, 1-1/4" ID, 1-3/8" OD, 1/16" Width (Pack of 25) that Intex is really stingy with when you buy their pools.  I also used some zip ties... the thick white plastic super long strap tie downs that make that clicking sound like a zipper when you pull them tight.  I used those to support the hoses coming out of the pool by strapping around the top rails then going under and around the hose so it can't droop.  Those drooping hoses put constant pressure on that seam around those inlet ports.  You'll bust them out if you don't support the weight of those hoses in some way.  Tying them to the top rail of the pool just makes sense.  On the lower port you can loop 2 or 3 zip ties together to extend the length down so it can support that lower inlet.I also suggest you get the Unicel brand of filter for this pump because it not only saves you a LOT of money on the filters but it's a superior filter. You can just hose it off over and over again so that one filter is all you need for a season.  I use 2 so I have a clean one to put in when I open the pump and take out the old one and close the pump and turn it on, then go clean the filter that is dirty and let it dry for the next changing.  The filter you want is:  Unicel C-5315 Replacement Filter Cartridge for 15 Square Foot Intex B FilterAnyone with a 15 foot round pool from Intex that lives in the south and is having trouble keeping the pool clean... this 2500gph pump is your answer. Trust me on this...

I can't live without these things.  Okay so I grind my teeth at night... what ya gonna do?  I tried everything and hated them all.  So sick and tired of waking up with raw patches on the inside of my cheeks from the expensive adjustable dental guards.  Twenty bucks and the thing wounds me at night... omg I was angry.  Then I saw a bunch of these in the dollar store near my house.  It said overnight disposable and I bought it for just a couple nights relief from the guards that I already owned. That's how desperate I was for ANYTHING else to wear at night.  Not to mention some of those things taste nasty and I'm sure that plastic is HORRIBLE for your health.  So I tried Plackers... OMG Hallelujah.  Never going back again.  I don't care what the box says ... unless you're an extremely aggressive grinder these will last you for months.  So far I've had to change them for losing them, washing one in a pants pocket, the dogs stealing it off the night stand and chewing it up, and a parrot that pulled it out of my hand and promptly bit it into pieces.  Only once have I worn one to the point that it wore out.  I put it in a case with Listerine (Original formula - the gold color) mouth wash to keep it sanitary.  This is the ONLY comfortable mouth guard out of the dozen or so I've tried.  It has no taste.  If you bite down hard your teeth just feel springy resistance that bounces back into shape. I've literally tried to bite through it as hard as I can and I can't do it.  It barely puts a dent in that pad between your back teeth.  The little thin front piece that attaches the two plates is so unnoticeable when you wear it that I had no problem feeling uncomfortable so I couldn't sleep like I had with the other dental guards.  I will NEVER go back to any other guard as long as I have these.  I'm actually entertaining the idea to buy enough boxes to have them for the rest of my life because I fear they will stop making them one day and I'll be desperate again.  That's how much I love Plackers.  No more grinding headaches and tooth pain!
Fits my Intex pool parts because they didn't send extra spares for those of us who have dogs that snatch up a fallen O ring and take off running with them!  So glad I found it.

Love this yarn.  Pure white that really looks like quality wool / cotton blend but it's poly and machine washes well... and tumble dries too.  Keeps a good shape and has a little more heft and body than Super Saver.  Not much... just a little.  Makes a super warm blanket when worked in a solid stitch.  You may want to note that this yarn doesn't have that "plastic" shiny look the Super Saver has. When you compare them the Super Saver just looks poly plastic but this yarn actually looks more expensive than it is.  It is a matte white.  I prefer this white for Christmas projects depicting snow or Santa, etc.  You'll almost never see a slub or a tie off in this yarn.  Out of about 30 skeins I"ve encountered 1 tie off.  If you want to take a step up from Super Saver yarn without paying a big price... this is your brand.

Lovely as always!  This is a bone color yarn that isn't yellow toned but a true bone off white.  I love the texture I get with this yarn over the Super Saver that doesn't even have this color available.  The fabric I crochet with this yarn comes out looking more professional and smooth than Super Saver yarn.  It really looks like wool / cotton blend but it's neither.  It washes and tumble dries well and makes a very warm blanket if you are doing a closed stitch or knitting for a solid material used in warm blankets.  For open work like lace stitches (shells & chains) this yarn holds the pattern shape better than Super Saver.  There is less stretch and slip.  It still glides well on the hook and gives a wonderful even tension.  I've tried it will all types of crochet hooks... including bamboo and wood... it does very well.  I find very few slubs or tie offs in this yarn.  I only have found one tie off yet in a skein and I've probably used about 30 skeins of this brand now.  Over all it's a better quality more expensive looking yarn than Super Saver for about the same price if you shop the sales.  If you are substituting it for Super Saver take into account that this is an every so slightly thicker yarn with more heft.  It is still worsted weight and in almost all cases can be a perfect substitute for Super Saver, but keep in mind its slight difference. This yarn will be a bit more firm with less drape than Super Saver.  I have a summer top pattern that called for Super Saver and I tried this but it had too much body and poofed out from the bodice down like a marshmallow.  The Super Saver top had the proper drape in the baby doll style top so the bodice looked gathered but not puffy.  It's a very slight difference but could be a game changer for some patterns.

It works.  Be careful about the shipping charges though.  The seller I had charged a lot extra for 2 day shipping then made a bunch of excuses why 2 day shipping was going to take 6 days to reach me. Not to mention the amount charged for a tiny letter size was ridiculous but I needed the laptop graphics working for a business presentation so I paid it.  I had to contact Amazon and they refunded my shipping. The memory itself is easy to install.  My system recognized it immediately.  I'm getting the performance expected and there are no problems at this time.

Because of past antibiotics my teeth are permanently yellowed and so any food stains make it so much worse.  I had given up hope because our dental plan doesn't cover whitening or cosmetic enhancement to counteract the damage from antibiotics. This product removed almost all of my coffee and food stains and brought my teeth to their best look which isn't as bad as I thought it was after all!  I'm so pleased that all the dark areas between my teeth are gone and I'm left with creamy white teeth now... not yellow!  So they didn't get brilliant white like the photos or most others are bragging about... but I'm very happy that it did remove all the actual staining that is possible to remove.  If I didn't have the antibiotic side effects that actually turn the inside of your teeth off white then I'm sure my teeth would be gleaming white right now.  They feel GREAT.  There is plenty product left to keep using it every few weeks to maintain the whiteness.  You have to be careful not to use too much the first time and let your gums get used to the product because it will burn.  I can only tolerate it for 15 minutes.  I was pleased that it comes with 4 dental trays that are super easy to form to your teeth. I haven't used 2 of the trays because the first ones are still perfectly good.  Not sure if the light actually helps or not.  I see no difference.  They also don't tell you if the light is actually UVA light in the proper spectrum for killing bacteria or just some bright blue LEDs. I would be interested to know that.  Proper UVA oral lights are great for after brushing teeth to kill bacteria that will cause tooth staining and decay.  The lights worked well and were much more comfortable than my UVA light I use for sanitizing.  I've had this product for a while and still have enough product to last me many more months.  If I have to guess-timate...  I'd say it's a year's worth of product.  I'd definitely buy this kit again. What a bargain!

I love my VicTsing!  I've got this one and the newer one as well and both work well.  The only thing is... 10m is more like 5 to 8m for me.  It should be able to play my music very well from my bedroom to my pool in the backyard but it won't.  Unfortunately it's way too burning up hot outside right now to take any electronics like a tablet or phone out to the poolside. So I'm still stuck with the issue of not having any music during the daytime hours. Still... this little beauty has a big bold sound that makes it great for the shower, in the kitchen, and I use it to watch Netflix at night so I don't wake up the whole house blasting the surround sound.  I just suction it to my headboard and I get great sound to watch my shows with.  I'm really surprised at the quality of the sound.  Easy to use too.
Works great! Fast data transfer speeds. What more can you say about it?  I would buy it again if I need another one. Good price fast ship.

Works great.  Easy to synch up with my bluetooth speaker so that any sound from any device with a sound jack can play on my speaker.  Great for listening to tunes by the pool from my computer that has no bluetooth.  Conversely it will make any speakers I have that have a headphone jack on them into bluetooth speakers.  So now I can listen to music in the kitchen from my bluetooth smartphone because we have speakers for a TV in the kitchen.  I haven't tried any other uses for it yet but these two.  The battery life seems good.  I watched a marathon of Breaking Bad last weekend and this unit worked for at least 6 straight hours transmitting to my bluetooth speaker.  I also bought another brand of this type device that is much more expensive and I don't see any difference at all.  The other brand boasts a lot of extras to prevent lagging when watching video content (like streaming Netflix) and better battery life.  This JETech unit kept pace with the other brand exactly.  They both function identically, they both have excellent battery life and recharge very fast.  The JETech did not have any latency issues when streaming 6 episodes of my series.  All the sounds matched the video in real time so it was perfect as far as my eyes can tell.  I'm kind of sorry I paid a lot more for the "fancy" one now because the JETech is just as good... and it's actually smaller than the fancier one.  Well at least I saved some money getting this one as my second unit because I plan on using them to transmit and receive in tandem so I can listen to my computer music out by the pool on some cool outdoor speakers I got a while back that are hardwired.  I just have to buy some adapters and I"m good to go now.

I love these so much.  I'm so glad I didn't waste my money on those expensive brand hooks (hint: the 4 leaf ___)  and bought these instead.  I'm used to Susan Bates so it's taking some adjustment but my arthritis is so much better with these handles.  They are soft silicone type... not hard plastic.  I just wish I had more sizes.

Was sent a used tablet after I was told they were working hard to find this tablet for me because they are out of them.  So the listing of this tablet is totally misleading. When I opened what was to be a new tablet it had signs of use, the case was flimsy and felt like it was falling apart, and when I turned it on the UI was weird.  I couldn't figure out how to do anything on it and I have 4 other tablets and a phablet (phone tablet).  So I sent it back.

This is my secret ingredient in my homemade lip balm recipe.  Nothing else works without getting your lips "addicted" to it and nothing else really gets rid of dryness for those people with ultra sensitive lips like mine.  It's great in homemade soap recipes too. This is a high quality oil that is light smelling and has a good consistency.  Hundreds of uses.  Will buy again.

This is really helping my dogs and cats!  I take one large bottle of Bronner's peppermint soap, add 1 tbsp of pine tar, 1 tbsp pure sulfur powder, 1 tsp of Texas red cedar oil, 1 tsp Neem oil, 10 drops tea tree oil.... in a 1 gallon jug... fill with hot water and shake.  Let sit overnight.  Wash your dogs in that and you get rid of mange and whatever this fungus junk is here in humid south Texas that the vet says isn't mange but we don't know what it is.I'll be using this for pine tar and sulfur bar soap too.  I have another recipe for a dog dip for fleas but haven't really decided if I want to leave anything like that on their fur without rinsing.  Nothing is better for problem feet and dandruff and ringworm than pine tar sulfur bar soap.  NOTHING.All I know is with ONE shampoo my yorkies stopped biting their backs and our cat that had mange on its neck is regrowing hair and stopped scratching.  I did spot cleansing on the other kittens that had the odd fungus stuff under their chins and it's gone in one treatment.  I also noticed it instantly kills fleas and almost all the fleas are gone now.  Here in S. Texas we can vet treat, dip, spray the yard,  and dust with diatomaceous earth and STILL have fleas showing up.  So anything that helps is great.

Would be absolutely perfect if it wasn't so red when you open the capsules up and use them.  I put this in saline solution for a nasal B12 shot which is better for me.  It turns the resulting liquid bright red.  I'm hoping that isn't dye. The label only mentions B12 in the capsules.  At any rate, it's working for me.  I'm getting a great boost when I use it.  I'm also taking the pills as is to help my iron supplement get absorbed with vitamin C as well.  I'm seeing a marked improvement in my iron levels. So I guess I will buy this again when I'm out.

Came exactly as shown & discreetly packaged. Even my hubby didn't know what it was. It also comes with a colon attachment that I believe is disposable. The hose is silicone and a much wider diameter than my old "hot water bottle" set. The fittings do not screw on they push together. I have to say I'm glad I know exactly what tip I'm using for this and will not need the other one because it fits so snug and secure I can't get it back off. I love the wide top that I can get my whole hand inside to wash it out.  The quality of the material everything is made with is very high.  If there is anything I'm unsure about with this product it is how long that little hanging hole is going to last. So far it's fine and doesn't seem too stressed but when I put the hanger on it it feels a bit too flexible (stretchy) and it is very close to the top.  I like that it came with 2 hooks... a big plastic one and a smaller metal one. The clamp to turn it on and shut it off is vastly superior to my old one. It seems like it will last a long time and it has quite a few settings to regulate flow.  I would definitely buy this set again but I doubt I will need to for another 10 to 15 yrs.  It does have a smell but it's not chemical.  It smells kind of like baby powder?  Can't put my finger on it but it isn't a toxic smell and it is diminishing gradually.

Smoky voiced Lana has a way with words. This song isn't like any other song you'll hear. I'm so bored of music these days because it all sounds the same.  Not Lana, not this song. Something totally different that's actually pleasant.  I'm hooked.
Good price, good product. Does the trick.

What can you say?  It's sulfur... But it has a nice consistent powder & it's great to add to soaps & shampoos especially for my dogs who get flea related skin problems.  It keeps ticks off if you add it to dog shampoo.  I'm also going to make a medicinal pine tar & sulfur soap bar that is used for various purposes like athlete's foot and ringworm... mange... etc.

Best deal for nut milk bags right here.  I use them for squeezing my "okara" from making soy milk (the solid bean part left over after straining) and it works so well.  The other bag is going to be used to apply diatomaceous earth powder to my dogs to it goes on them evenly & less goes into the air... for fleas. The bags are sturdy, have a great thread count that strains very well so my soy milk is nice and smooth.  I can't believe I was throwing out about a coffee cup full of soy milk every batch I made... and I make 2 a day... so that is 2 extra servings I could have been getting using this bag to squeeze it out.  Excellent!
nice quality oil that I use to add to a homemade flea dip for my dogs. Economical size.

OMG this stuff is heaven.  I've got a dozen uses already... but primarily it's going into 3 different recipes... 1. Natural pet flea dip, 2. Pine tar soap, 3. Flea repelling yard spray.  I'm also looking at a recipe for a sulfur & cedar pet shampoo that helps with fleas & the mange.  I think I'll spritz some of this inside my coat closet to protect my wools from moths too.  I also have a recipe for bar soap called "Woodsy" that uses cedar oil with others for it's smell. Glad I found the Texas red cedar because its way better than the other type. If I ever use this up... I'll be back for more!We have wood floors in our house & I put a few drops of this in the Murphy's Oil Soap water I use to clean the floors... omg the house smelled so good and clean. I like this better than pine oil.

I thought when I bought this phaser that it was just a hard plastic prop, but it's actually packaged as a toy and it makes phaser sounds when you press the large button. It cycles through 3 or 4 different sounds, from short to long duration.  The only thing I don't like is the weird orange nub on the front; I think it should be black instead but maybe it's supposed to look like phaser fire.I taped a rare earth magnet to the bottom of mine so it would stick to another magnet attached inside my pants pocket.  This way I didn't need a holster for my costume.

The Fire TV Stick is way faster than my Roku HD. The UI and the remote itself are very responsive, though I liked the Roku's UI a little better. The included remote does not support voice search, but you can add voice search by buying the fancier remote or installing the Fire TV app on your smartphone or tablet.Usually we watch Amazon Prime on our projector via our smart Blu-Ray player, but when I'm watching something alone or for those rare occasions when we don't want to watch something on the projector, I'll sometimes turn on the TV instead. My favorite feature is that it automatically turns the TV on and switches it to the correct HDMI input through my Toshiba TV's "Regza-Link" feature. I assume it's a standard feature with different names on different brands of TVs, but none of our other HDMI devices have done that in the past.

These goggles are cheap and they work great for woodworking.  The fit isn't particularly tight around my face but even with gaps around some contours they do the job in keeping my eyes safe.  I like the vents rather than the series of holes on either side, but there probably isn't much difference unless you're working with something that could splash in your face.I also wore them a few times riding my bike a little over 5 miles to work in the winter.
