And right now, it has been fun for me to simply flip through it to see all that it has, and taking it all in. Rarely would a cookbook grab my attention in this way, but this did. I am looking forward to other America's Test Kitchen books that I plan to get soon. Excellent company.

I wanted to like it much more, but it has major drawbacks. I bought this as a small, easy to carry, utilitarian tool. But one of the main aspects I wanted it for - the bottle opener - is practically unusable. It in fact is so frustrating to use that I gave up after the third try. Simply was not point to it. The knife and screwdriver (small as it is) are fine. Oh, and if you want to use the bottle opener, or some other aspects, BE AWARE that it will separate at the top, and fall off the keychain. There is no way to use it while attached. Big detriment.

I love these shears. Excellent multi-tool, multi-tasking shears. Very easy to handle, quality construction, and I love the additional extras it has with the screwdriver, veggie-peeler, fish-scaler, bottle-opner, and more. The blades are sharp and effective, and they come apart for easy cleaning. BUT... while they are advertised as a kitchen tool, I really see this as an absolute must-have tool for anyone going camping or hiking. It's versatility would be best utilized on trips like that. ONE COMPLAINT - The magnetic protective sleeve is total crap. The magnets barely hold onto anything while empty, and absolutely not at all while the shears are inside. So, I suggest to the company to fix that one and only problem, to make these an absolutely perfect all-around tool. Brilliant idea, and nicely constructed otherwise.

Love this safety goggles... !!  I ordered these for some projects I had coming up. As I wear glasses and contacts, I was wondering how they would fit around my spectacles. As it turned out, they work together very nicely. No pushing of my rims into my face, as these goggles fit nicely around my glasses with room to spare. They offer great protection, and I like the coloring. Kind of "cool" in a sporty way. But, I didn't buy them for a fashion sense (not really, anyway)... so luckily, I can say that these are very sturdy, good protection safety goggles.

Excellent blades. I recently bought a DeWalt Reciprocating Saw and ordered this extra set of blades for it. I can honestly say they worked wonderfully. Better than I had expected. The cuts were clean and quick. DeWalt is a default favorite company of mine now, for any power tools.

I bought this, thinking it would be cute and handy. In the end, it really wasn't anything special. As it turns out, it's basically light, cheap plastic, and I have yet to find a proper jar that it will fit on, securely screwing on. I think I found one, out of the 10 I had nearby. So that aspect makes it a bit more of an effort to enjoy. In the end, the novelty of it simply isn't worth it... unless you have exactly what it will fit. And even then... it's just cheap plastic. I wish I could say something better, but I can't.

I wasn't quire sure what to make of this, being silicone, but I am definitely glad I got one.I recently started using the Excalibur Dehydrator, and it's wonderful. But in order to dry more "gooey" or "liquid-y" materials, you cannot pour that on the meshing. So it's either using (and throwing away) parchment paper... or this. This is easier, as it's washable, and there is no waste. And for what I used it for, it worked very well. Nicer than expected. I definitely recommend this particular sheet.Of course, this can also be used for half a sheet on a baking pan in the oven, for easier clean-up.

A handy little field guide if you are out and about, or... as in my case... want to quickly identify something in your garden, in California. It is laminated, so no worries about moisture rot. I keep mine hanging close by on a pole by my gardening tool shed, for easy access.

When you're onstage performing... you sweat, you get thirsty. This drink holder is a great help so you don't have to bend all the way over to grab a drink from the ground. It's built very sturdy, does have some heft and weight to it, but that also helps keep it anchored to the mic stand better. Definitely recommended.

This iPad holder for mounting to a mic stand is very helpful. It really has come in handy, ever since I got the iPad and discovered all the neat tricks that can be done for musicians and performers. In my case, I am running a program (OnSong) that contains song lyrics, tabs, etc, and having this located discreetly down on my mic stand is so much nicer than a more obtrusive music stand (even worse when you have all paper pages of lyrics and notes that can possibly fly away).This tool became indispensable almost immediately upon my getting it. Now I cannot imagine going on stage with it - when I need it. As well, it's a great idea for practices too, as it holds the iPad nearby, where you can also make changes in lyrics, notes, and notations with whatever program you are running. A must-have for any performer using an iPad.AND... I will say this holder is honestly much better than many others. The clamp holds tightly. The whole unit is very sturdy, and mostly metal. The best part is the ability to position it in any way you need it.

Clever little chart to get a quick view of birds in your area, within Northern California. For me, it's handy to keep in the garden, so I don't have to run into the house anytime I want to try to identify a bird near me. It's laminated, so there's no worry of moisture rot as I keep it clipped nearby on a post by the garden tool shed.

I loved the idea of this "bucket list" type of calendar. It gave me a daily reminder of where I would still like to visit, while keeping me abreast of the days. Fun, with great photographs and quick, concise write-ups.

I loved the idea of this "bucket list" type of calendar. It gave me a daily reminder of where I would still like to visit, while keeping me abreast of the days. Fun, with great photographs and quick, concise write-ups.

This was such a fun read, with great photos, of the history of Santa Cruz, CA's most famous landmark, the Beach Boardwalk. While not being complete (due to politics and copyrights) this book does it's best at giving a full historical picture of what the Boardwalk began as, and later became. The Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk is iconic around the world. Really an entertaining book.

I love these throat lozenges and use them anytime I have had throat issues. After having use Ricola and all the rest, I have come to find that the Jakemans brand really worked best for me. There are no added chemicals or questionable things. They are comfortable, without any harsh lozenge taste or residue, and they do help calm the throat in times of coughing or soreness. As a singer, I recommend these highly.

If you are suffering from nasal cavity dryness, the NeilMed gel spray does the trick. I have used it repeatedly whenever I have had issues with my nasal area drying out for any reason. Sometimes there have been issues with residual drip, but that is easy to adjust in how much, and where exactly you spray the gel into your nose. But this definitely offers a superb answer to any dryness problems and is easy to use. I recommend it.

I recently got Bell's Palsy, which, amongst other facial paralysis issues, cause my nose muscles to collapse a bit. Before that even, I had had subtle breathing issues, with my nose closing in and not allowing proper nasal oxygen intake when running or hiking. I inquired with many medical device companies and asked about any sort of circle implant to keep my nostrils open, but no one knew what I as talking about, and recommended that I should invent one. When checking on Amazon, I found quite a few and ordered a varied selection. These Brez premiums are the product that I like the best.These are very easy to insert, relatively soft and unobtrusive, and do an excellent job at keeping the nostrils expanded open. There will be some adjusting to be made, depending upon the individual, and it may not even be the perfect fit for some. But for me, I could not be happier. These have been a God-send in helping me with my breathing issues.Price-wise, I think they are more than they should be, but in comparison, I would still rather purchase these for the quality and ease of use. I do think, if they became more popular, the price would come down drastically, but we'll see. It's not that intrusively expensive.I'm not sure why they seem to be non-reusable. I personally do re-use them each for several days. Most of the other products are in fact created to be reusable for at least a couple of moths. The box states that these are one-day use products. I would like an explanation.Also, all the different products, this one as well, state not to use the product for more than 12 hours in a 24-hour period. I would also like an explanation for that. It seems as though they are comfortable enough to be left in.All in all, I cannot give enough praise to this company and what they offer. It really has helped my situation immensely and I am telling everyone about them. If you have nasal breathing issues, these are a must-have.

These DownBeats ear-plugs solved a major problem for me. Aside from needing to use ear-plugs regularly as it is, since I am in loud live music situations often (as a musician, and a concert photographer), I also recently suffered from Hyperacusis (due to Bell's Palsy) that causes extreme sensitivity to certain sound frequencies and volume, and makes any loud noise unbearable. These ear plugs were fantastic. I would compare these to the DownBeats ear plugs as well, although there are subtle differences. Both offer excellent hearing protection, but it becomes a comfort issue. The DownBeats offer a bit more snug fit, keeping out disturbing frequencies, but are too small for many people. These are larger, and easier to use, but may require a bit more adjusting to give a good, snug fit in the ear canal. Also, these Etymotics come with an attachable string, to keep them connected (a nice extra), and a carrying case. Large enough to insert and remove, and it provides the protection we should have.Both are great companies, and a definite must-have for anyone around loud music or any other noise, and an a necessity for any musicians. Hearing is important, and we too often take it for granted. Protect your ears. Use these.

These DownBeats ear-plugs solved a major problem for me. Aside from needing to use ear-plugs regularly as it is, since I am in loud live music situations often (as a musician, and a concert photographer), I also recently suffered from Hyperacusis (due to Bell's Palsy) that causes extreme sensitivity to certain sound frequencies and volume, and makes any loud noise unbearable. These ear plugs were fantastic. I would compare these to the Eymotic ear plugs as well, although there are subtle differences. These seemed to fit a bit more snugly in my ears, thus keeping the disturbing frequencies out, while maintaining a proper hearing situation without muffling.The only "complaint" that I would have is that these are considerably smaller than the Etymotics, and can feel "lost" (stuck) in your ears. This caused an obvious immediate panic the first time I used them, until I quickly figured out how to remove them easily (by twisting them to loosen the tight seal in the ear). But in comparison, while both are great companies, these seem to block out the frequencies a bit better. A definite must-have for anyone around loud music or any other noise, and an a necessity for any musicians. Hearing is important, and we too often take it for granted. Protect your ears. Use these.

I couldn't wait for this film to come out. A superb collection of actors, along with a generous portion of storytelling and "literal liberties," tells a great story about a great venue that carved a historic and exciting time in our musical history. When times were changing, and music could exhilarate and frighten and motivate people. Hilly and his CBGB club was there to usher in those times, and thank God he did. It changed everything. This film offers the humor, the challenges, the drama, all that was part of creating something unique and original and memorable. Brilliantly made, brilliantly acted. I absolutely loved this film and will watch it many more times. See it, now!

Have you ever wondered about physics? What it is, and why it's important? This book is a great introduction to the various aspects of physics. It is engaging and interesting, while educational and entertaining. As all of Clifford Pickover's other books, it is put together well and very easy to follow along. To those who have stated any negative comments about it's "simplicity," they miss the point that this isn't an encyclopedia of all knowledge, but more of an eye-opener to give insight to the world of physics. It's meant to give a subtle introduction, and a push for the reader to get excited about the subject and search elsewhere for expanded explanations and information. And in that, I highly recommend this book to anyone who has any interest in how the world works, and what physics has to do with it all.

As someone who could do math well, and understood the logic, but wasn't as good in scholastic math, I found this book to be engaging and interesting, while educational and entertaining. As all of Clifford Pickover's other books, it is put together well and very easy to follow along. To those who have stated any negative comments about it's "simplicity," they miss the point that this isn't an encyclopedia of all knowledge, but more of an eye-opener to give insight to what mathematics offers. It's meant to give a subtle introduction, and a push for the reader to get excited about the subject and search elsewhere for expanded explanations and information. And in that, I highly recommend this book to anyone who has any interest in mathematics, or needs a reason to find it interesting.

I had been looking for a proper clapboard for my filmmaking endeavors. I settled upon this one, for the balance of price and offered quality. I was not disappointed. This clapboard is solid and sturdy, and offers everything you would require on the board for making notations. If I was to make any complaint, it would only be that the "slap" sound could be a bit louder (for my expectations), but that really was not an issue for me, as it provides adequate "clapping" noise. A definite must-have for any filmmaker.
I wish I had purchased one of these years ago!  I put this on my new Canon 6D body.  I wear eyeglasses and this really does the job for me.  Plus, I don't have to get my nose all over the LCD screen.

Yum!  A taste of Japan without having to travel there!  The clear edible wrapper is sort of weird the first time but it melts in your mouth.  I bought a bunch for myself and my grandkids.  They like them too!

Excellent for anyone with arthritis or other hand problems.  You get a good tactile feel and it makes for more accurate cuts.  I switched from the thin aluminum X-Acto blade holders to this style and I love it!
VERY good!  I may not get to travel the world but, my tongue thinks I am! :)
This is the pencil sharpener to own!  I have other Dahle products such as a large 554 paper cutter and a pair of their large scissors.  Everything works WAY better than any other brand.
My three beagles have been completely spoiled by these treats.  I only give them ONE per day and they just love them!

If you like crushed chili peppers, coarse ground black pepper or parmesan cheese you NEED these!  The type with the round holes doesn't let much of anything out.  This slotted shaker is the way to go.
It works very well for straining cooking oil into the jug when draining a deep fryer.

I just stuck one on my Canon 6D and I like it!  I have no problem finding the shutter button now. (I have sensory loss in my fingertips).  It's the exact size needed for the shutter button and it's just a matter of peeling the back off and sticking it in place.  I used an alcohol wipe to clean off the button.  And, for the installation, I used a pair of hemostats and Optivisors.  I set it on the button gently and then nudged it a little to get it centered before pressing it down harder.  I discovered that the Canon shutter button is free rotating in the process.  Anyway... I recommend them!
VERY nice Easter flag! :)

This is an excellent Canon L lens at an excellent price!  The only difference is the box.  "White Box" means it came bundled with a camera body and they were split up and sold separately.  Why pay $1149.00 when you can buy it brand new with warranty for $729.00?  It will work with any Canon EF EOS body.  I use mine on my new Canon 6D.

The non-stick finished bubbled and started to flake off with the first use even at medium heat.  It's not what I would expect from Cuisinart!  I think the same pan would be better without the non-stick flake-off surface.  I guess I'll toss it out and try something else.  I don't think eating Teflon is good for anyone.

I grew up not 10 miles from the Canadian border and we would always look forward to getting our Mackintosh's Toffee bars.  Then, several years ago, Nestle's stopped making the bars and had bite sized individually wrapped ones that were made in Switzerland.  The Swiss can make excellent chocolate but they had no idea how to make the Mackintosh toffee.  Due to public outcry, Nestle's brought the bars back again.  Albeit, they are smaller and are in a plastic wrap and not in a box as the originals were.  My friends from Winnipeg found them in a grocery store and brought me a bunch of them.  I found them here on Amazon cheaper than they were in Winnipeg!  Even my grand kids love to crack their Mack's on the table and enjoy them.  There is no substitute!

We used to buy these locally but can't find them anywhere.  But, Amazon has just about everything and the price was reasonable.  I love them and so do my grand kids.  Just nuke them in the microwave for 15 seconds on high and you get the warm gooey yumminess of the caramel corn.  I like the plain version the best.  I ordered the peanut version to try them out and will probably go back to plain next time.

The straight on front photo of this vase gives the impression that it is round.  It's not!  It's oval.  The only clue to this in the description is in the measurements 9x6x24.5 when I went back again to read it.  I think there should be a mention of this in the description and have side view photos also.  My wife decided to keep it although we both thought it was going to be round.

I bought this lumbar support belt to replace a similar one I've used for several years.  The suspenders attach with sewn on loops of nylon strap material with heavy plastic loops.  (I have seen some cheaply made versions where they tried to use plastic snaps which doesn't work well at all.)  This belt has two side belts with velcro to add support and adjust the tension as desired.  (Some have just one that wraps around which isn't as nice.)  The sizing is true to size.  I ordered a 5XL but probably could have used the 4XL.  But, no problem, it's easy to just overlap the main belt further.  It's better to have too much belt than not enough.  I've worn the belt for a week now and my back has greatly improved.  As most things these days... it is Made In China.

Very poorly designed.  The suspenders won't stay attached for more that 30 seconds.  Instead of being threaded through sewn on loops, they put some sort of a cheap plastic snap on attachment.  Also, the pressure adjustment strap is made in one piece instead of two.  The MADE IN CHINA on the label explains it all.  I'm sending it back ASAP.  It's a complete joke!

I bought this hedge trimmer and I don't have any hedges!  What I wanted it for is to cut off sucker sprouts around the base of my apple trees.  I'm somewhat disabled and can't bend over to do things at ground level very well.  The pole trimmer set at a 45 degree angle is perfect for what I wanted to do.  In only a few minutes I had everything trimmed off and ready to rake up.  It will be very nice in the fall to cut down the perennials in my wife's flower gardens also.  I've read reviews where it was mentioned the unit is heavy and tiring to use.  I have a LOT of weakness from a spinal cord surgery gone bad.  If I can still use it OK it can't be that heavy.I specifically wanted a cordless trimmer that uses lithium ion batteries.  It's been my experience that nickel metal hydride (NiMH) or nickel cadmium (NiCd) batteries especially, don't last very long.  The Li-ion batteries stay charged for a very long time and are generally much cheaper to replace.

First of all, this is a very nice looking angel and my wife loved it.  I say "loved" because it didn't even last for 24 hours.  She put it in a small flower garden in a protected corner near our house.  The wind came up and tipped it over shattering the left wing.  I can see from the exposed edge of the break that the resin material the angel is molded from is VERY thin.  It's only about 1/16 inch thick.
Installation is as simple as take it out of the box and step it into the ground with your foot.  It's nicely made and looks good.  I used it to hold the sump pump discharge hose when not in use.

The yellow flowers come squashed and flattened and don't look very good.  My wife is disappointed.  We don't dare put it outside or it would get destroyed.  It came in a box without any packing material or without being secured to an inner box or container. I should have known better than to have purchased a wreath online.

I am really disappointed in how cheap and junky this plaque looks.  The acrylic sheet they send with it is so thin it easily cracked and was ruined.  The plaque itself is terrible looking besides.  I should have sent it back before I accidentally barely flexed the acrylic sheet and it  cracked.  I guess I'll write it off as a learning experience and money wasted.
The rack with comfortably hold 8-10 pliers.  Maybe more if you cram them together.  It keeps them organized, easy to grab when needed, and your pliers aren't in a pile on the bench or in a drawer.

I own four of these slings.  The most recent one was purchased here on Amazon as it was cheaper than I could find anywhere else.  I like a single point sling for my particular needs.  The quick detach buckle is nice because you can detach the rifle and leave the sling on your body.  That's handy when getting in and out of vehicles or simply to take the weight off during a break.  Depending on the weight of the rifle and the clothing being worn, the strap may press on your neck and shoulder quite a lot.  So, I found sling pads that easily go on much like seat belt shoulder pads with velcro.

I really like the overall packaging and quality of the CD's.  I use them to provide a small library of information to each of my students.  They burn just as expected and I haven't had any that wouldn't burn due to disc errors.  I'd give them a 5 star rating but, I only got 99 discs in my 100 pack.

Just like the other reviewer, I purchased this tenderizer mallet because I wanted the largest, heaviest and best made tool I could find.  I put it in the drawer and didn't use it for a year.  I tried it out just recently when making Swiss steak.  After about 3 whacks, the head came loose.  I was surprised to find that the head is actually a hollow casting.  The only thing holding the head to the handle is the thickness of the aluminum casting where the wedge is driven in which is only about 1/4 inch thick.  About all I could do was to soak the head end of the mallet in some water and to drive the wedge in a little further.  Even so, the head doesn't stay firmly affixed and I don't think I can trust it to stay on.  It's made to look like a wonderful tool but is in reality something you would be much better off not owning.  I'd actually give it negative stars if that were possible.

We bought several of these soap dispensers and are currently on our last one.  They start out working just fine but end up quitting for various reasons.  We also found out the hard way that there are more than one type or refill.  They look similar but only one of them will work in your particular dispenser.  Two of them failed when soap leaked and drained into the lower unit.  Several friends and relatives have reported the same problems.  There is a nicer dispenser made by a different company that has a refillable tank.  Just flip up the lid and pour it full.  I have friends who have been using those for over 6 months with no problems.  If I buy another motorized dispenser I may try one of those.Save your money and don't buy this one made by Lysol.  It's a poor design.

I originally had Fizzies as a kid when my sister brought some back from a visit to Detroit.  They were pretty good back then and are just the same now.  Don't expect them to be like a modern soft drink out of a bottle or can.  They don't really have a whole lot of flavor or fizz so I use two of them instead of one.  That makes them much more enjoyable.  It's something you and your kids or grandkids should at least try once in your lifetime.
I gave one to my brother in law for Christmas.  The quality is similar to much more expensive buckles.  It's a HUGE buckle but a very nice one!

If you've ever purchased Uncle Mike's accessories in the past, you can expect the same high quality.  I was a bit worried that it was too small for the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge.  But, it fit just fine.  I don't think a longer cartridge would fit as the .338 LM goes from fold to fold.

It is elegant and remarkably slim. My Paperwhite fits snugly inside without the possibility of falling out, and the magnetic closure works effortlessly at keeping it shut and powering it on and off with total simplicity.I have no idea what the heck other reviewers have said about it not fitting properly. Maybe they don't actually own a Paperwhite - who knows? Mine does.UPDATEThis morning my lovely paperwhite dropped approximately 18" to the floor, flat - not on the edge. It was encased in this cover. I have included a photo of my damaged Kindle.This case is finished and I am now orderering a brand new Kindle to replace my dead one. Heartbroken doesn't even begin to describe how I feel.I am so sorry I gave such a glowing initial review because I've had other covers in the past which provided better protection. I have never replaced a damaged Kindle until now. I really thought this would be adequate - I was horribly incorrect.
If you've made it this far than you don't need me. You know how great these books are.Just lock yourself in, leave food for your family and simply enjoy the ride
Great highlighter or base color. Goes on smooth and has a medium taupe color to it.Even including shipping cost - cheaper than Wal-Mart.

This is a lovely, unusual piece that is perfect for the cat lover of all ages. I purchased it as a gift for a friend who went crazy when she got it.The vendor is very special, too. Not only did she supply a very adequate chain with the piece, but also threw in a velvet version as an extra option at no additional cost. Terrific salesmanship.If you want something different, classy and reasonably priced - look no further and buy one of these.

I was tired of watching my husband popping corn in a pan - making a total mess in our kitchen. I had resisted buying one of these after reading different reviews of various similar models. But finally I had to give it a shot or ban popcorn from our home forever.We both love this machine. It is sleek, very easy to use, requires no clean-up except discarding un-popped kernals, and pops about 98% of the kernals used. The color is okay, no big deal as it sits inside a cabinet until we use it.We don't bother with the melter piece on top of the machine so I can't say if it works well or not. We buy regular grocery popcorn from different vendors and so far everything has been fine. The brands we use do mention that smaller kernals might get blown out and not popped. So my husband tilts the machine back at a slight angle to improve our odds.So far, so good. And my kitchen stove looks nice again.

If you've ever run across one of my previous gazillion phone case reviews you'll know that I always love the latest one I've bought. Well - here we are again!This terrific all-in-one version is easy to put on (2 pieces, snap together - simplicity), lovely two-tone purple colors, all ports are totally accessible, and the price is excellent. I also love that the attached cover flaps for both the charging & earphone ports are firm and solid feeling as opposed to other cases which either have no cover or they're so flimsy that you (me) wind up just cutting them off.The overall feeling is not quite rubbery and not quite hard plastic but extremely comfortable to grip. I absolutely have no fear it will slip out of my hands. And it's slim. No thick, Otterbox bulk. I am very confident that with this case on my phone, an accidental drop will not have some horrible, serious repercussions.Sorry. Not one negative thing to say. The vendor was great and this is one terrific case. It just might be THE ONE that tames my restless heart.
Bought him to stand between my Loki & Thor bobbles. Working out great so far. No wars.

I'm sure Loki would hate to be called adorable - but there it is. Utterly and completely adorable. So much so that I ordered his "brother" to join him, but I made sure to also order Heimdall to hang out between them.  No need for global repercussions.And, yes, they are all adorable.

This is my second purchase of a Hey! Pinkgo mask but I made a mistake. This mask is definitetly better suited for someone with oiley skin. It is astringent based and will probably work wonders.I have normal, dryish skin and after one use I could definitely feel the tightening properties of this product.  It didn't do any harm, but the benefits of the yogurt version on my skin were more obvious (I just wanted to try another flavor).Just like the yogurt version it is a terrific design of staying on your face and providing saturated and refreshing relief to your skin. I have several boxes of the yogurt one in my cabinet and use them 3 times a week.This is a terrific product line, I just ordered the wrong one - my bad not theirs.

Outstanding production.As one if millions of dedicated readers, I am so happy to be able to enjoy this transition from book to film.  Of course we all have our own theory about how a character should look or be portrayed, but I must say I have no problem accepting this version.When you have great source material, the rest is gravy.

I have been a huge fan of the relatively inexpensive, paperish, hugely saturated facial masks by companies like My Beauty Diary and others ( you can find my many positive reviews) until stumbling upon these lacey, saturated, fantastic masks.I really can't contribute more than other outstanding reviewers have elaborated on the technical advantages of these lacey versions compared to the paper ones except to say how wonderful it is to position the mask over your face and neck and then be able to gently secure it by pulling it over your ears. Genious. The paper masks were good except the chin area never stays in place and I'm always checking to make sure the rest of it hasn't slid around on my face.These cost a little more but the results were so great after my first one, I immediately purchased 3 more boxes of this version and another one to try out.I am way past 50, but my skin looks terrific. Smooth, soft, healthy and glowing. I could not be happier. Go ahead and give these a try. But you better hurry before I buy them all up.

Needed this for a lovely area rug purchased from Home Depot. Have no fear dear buyers, this baby is gigantic. So much so that if you have a couple of smaller area rugs that need a rubber mat underneath, for the value and exceptional quality I would suggest buying this one and cutting it up to your requirements. Much cheaper than buying individually sized smaller ones.The weave itself is very tight and I have not observed any evidence of marking up my wood floor.  But in the event this happens, just run a soft mop with either vinegar & water, or some store brand cleaner to remove the pattern from your floor.In any case, this is a very apt product that will protect your surfaces from permanent scratches while enjoying your various area rugs. And, as always, no one beats Amazon for fair pricing & outstanding service.

I needed something to carry my purse, Kindle, a pair of leggings, t-shirt & hoodie.  This positively stunning, roomy and entirely functional bag is everything I could've hoped for.  It even comes with a small matching bag that I'm using as a make-up bag.There are 3 outside zippered pockets (keys, Iphone, work i.d.) and one inside zippered pocket (wallet). There is plenty of room for my clothes & Kindle whch are secure in this wonderful top zippered bag. And the soft, flat straps have enough length to be slung over my shoulder.As for the exterior colors & design - the photo doesn't do it justice. It is bold, bright and beautiful.  And I'm pretty certain the slick fabric will easily wipe clean if necessary. It is so awesome, in fact, I'm buying a second "just in case" bag.One of my smartest Amazon purchases ever.
Looks terrific in my workout room. Good color, sturdy cardboard design and a definite winner for any fan.

As a longtime fan of the author, I wasn't disappointed with this preview.The characters are well developed, storyline is highly engaging, and I thoroughly enjoyed what I read.My only small complaint is the constant use of 3 or 4 letter abreviations for different State depts. it gets cumbersome trying to keep them straight. But maybe that's the whole point.What can you lose? A free preview is a win-win. Give it a shot.
Plenty of action, terrific performances, often hilarious, and quite simply the gold standard of its genre. The bar has been set - good luck everyone else!

I am very impressed with the slim, comfortable feeling of this cover. I own several similar cases by other vendors but this one is by far the sleekest version ever.  And, amazingly, for once I can actually reach the little on/off mute button on the left side of my Iphone 6. Up till now I've just left it on because I couldn't access it through the thick layers of protection.The color is more of a reddish pink rather than the vibrant red color shown on Amazon, but I have no problem with this. And the gold contrast works beautifully.This is an exceptional value (even though I've felt that way about other cases) and wish I would have found this one first before buying so many others. I just kept upgrading and trying to find the perfect fit. Now I am truly Goldilocks'd and this one is "just right".

Bought this for my husband's phone - he thought my version was a bit too flashy/girly.  Well - he loves his cover.Total coverage, sleek design, attractive appearance and an outstanding price - excellent product.

Just started getting into smoothies and realized my blender wasn't gonna handle them.This unit is excellent for the novice 2-3 times a week user. I'm sure their are other machines out there that do more whiz bang stuff incredible things but for someone like me it is perfect.I have used various frozen and fresh fruits and veggies along with protein powder, yogurt and ice cubes and everything has turned out great. No ugly clumps, easy by-hand cleanup (don't use a dishwasher) and it stores away beautifully.One of these days I might graduate to something else more sophisticated but for now this little guy has found a home sweet home.

The box presentation was outstanding. Only wish the earrings would've worked out.They were extremely small for an adult woman but I could've dealt with that if the sapphire color wasn't so dark. They almost look black until you hold them up to the light. Unfortunately that wasn't the look I was going for.

This is a perfect case for total coverage, minimal weight & bulkiness, terrific bright colors, at a more than fair price.First you apply a screen protector to the face of your phone (an absolute necessity), then you pull the thin rubber cover over the whole phone (obviously leaving the screen totally visible), then you snap the plastic front & back covers over the rubber...and you're done. All ports, speakers and camera are available without obstruction, but your precious phone is protected. It's still slim & sleek, but the slight rubbery feel to the plastic doesn't make you think the phone will slip from your fingers.I bought the black one with the multi color chevron arrows all over. Attractive and yet easy to locate against a dark surface - think purse, car seats, etc.  My only criticism matches another reviewer regarding access to the small switch for turning volume off/on.  Impossible to reach without a sharp object or taking off the whole cover.  Not a deal breaker for me. Almost never need that switch and the other positives negate this issue.I'm so happy with this cover that I convinced my husband to buy the black/gold version for his phone. It hasn't arrived yet, but I'm sure its gonna work out fine. I'll let you know.Great purchase from a terrific seller.

A simple, clean design that efficiently holds my bathrobe perfectly. The other one holds my towel.I am so impressed with this product that I immediately ordered 2 more packages to use in other parts of the house.  Christmas decorating, perhaps?

The shield is good - but my review is more for the installation instructions.These people are determined that you will get this thing on your phone with no bubbles, dust or dirt. You won't believe the details and accessories included to help you get the job done right. I felt like I was involved in a major science project.Unfortunately,  I got so fed up with trying to figure out what went where that I just put the damn thing on by lining up the edges and it worked out fine. But that's just me - limited patience, steady hands.However, I am super impressed with this companys' intense determination that their product will not fail you. That is very unusual these days when most places just don't care.If you want a screen saver that doesn't wind up with you using all 3 of them just to get one on that looks half decent, buy this product. You'll have 2 extra screens to give to your friends.Oh yeah - I almost forgot - EVERYTHING lined up perfectly. Maybe other reviewers put the wrong screen on their phone - who knows? But I've had zero issues with my I-6.

I read the description of this item and nowhere did it indicate that this melter uses a lightbulb.  I do not use that type of melter and would've liked to have had a heads-up before needlessly placing an order which had to be returned.On the positive side, I wish it had been the type I do use because it is absolutely beautiful and a perfect size to place anywhere in a room.  It would be a lovely addition to your home or office if this is the type of burner that you enjoy using.  Perhaps the manufacturer could produce a similar product that doesn't use a lightbulb because I would buy that in a heartbeat.

I needed an uncomplicated and entertaining book to read and happily found it in "Manhattan". This is a surprisingly engrossing and totally enjoyable way to spend a couple of afternoons & evenings.The premise of three young women from entirely different backgrounds joining together to better themselves and defeat a common enemy is not entirely original. But its the paths they choose and the outcomes they reach that made the journey worth taking. I liked all three women immensely and truly cared about what would happen to each of them.My only very small disappointment was the neat way that everything tidied up in the end. After losing myself in their stories, I was kind of hoping for something a little more original at the conclusion. But honestly, it wasn't enough for me to downgrade my review.I had a wonderful time reading this book. The author is excellent at creating characters and situations that kept me tapping my Kindle as quickly as I could to get to the next page.  And that is the most important criteria, to me, as a reader.

Quirky, clever, well- acted and thoroughly enjoyable. I hope there 'll be more episodes to come. So far I 've watched this one twice and have been telling everyone I know about it.This show is too good for tv!  Don't miss it!

What a waste. I wanted this for making smoothies. All of the ingredients are pre-chopped, very small, and sold by a leading juice bar company. All you add is a cup of apple juice. It grinds and grinds. Nothing happens. So I have to stop the motor, stir the ingredients, and then go through the whole thing all over again.The top lid is made of flimsy rubber that you have to try and fit over the container because it keeps bending out of shape.I am now shopping for a decent replacement and donating this garbage for someone who only needs to blend chocolate milk.

My husband needed this for our pool. He went to several stores armed with the part number and all of them were around $40. Now profit is one thing, but 50% or more is insane. For the same exact item!Amazon provided fast delivery to my door and an outstanding price (and I 'm pretty sure they want to make some profit).Sorry if I didn't go into specifics about it, but I have to assume if you're looking for one of these than you know how it works and what it does. That is my husband's job - I shop.

What a find! This is my second purchase and I am now signed up for auto-delivery.I know the description claims it'll last 6 weeks but for me I generally get about 3-4 weeks use. Absolutely no complaint. In fact, last month I threw away my eyebrow pencil for good.I followed a lot of previous viewers' advice the first time I used it, but after that I was able to just do it my own way. I am thrilled with the results!Word of caution, however, I don 't mind my brows a little darker so I use the  "medium"  to get the desired look. You definitely want to be careful. But once you know your own preference you will love it.Easy to use, very little clean -up, very reasonable price, and it looks great! Sold.

This product does not do anything. I sprayed almost 30% of the container on the ice in my small refrigerator located in the pub area in my home. Waited almost 3 hours and still wound up chiseling the ice with a small pik.Skip this product. Just turn off the power, wait a while and remove the ice into towels or a bucket. Save your money for something else.

I have sensitive skin but in the past this brand was always one that I could use without issues but found to be very expensive. So I was extremely excited to have the opportunity to give this moisturizer a try and not have to spend any money.I used my Shiseido cleanser and then applied this cream afterwords.  It has a wonderful, smooth texture going on and as a result you don't need much to cover your whole face.  A very economical plus.  The very next morning I had several small blemishes above my chin.I stopped using the cream for several days to allow my face to heal and then decided to try it again.  This time I used a simple facial cleanser by Lush products and again I applied the Divine Cream.  The following morning I had a brand new blemish on my cheek and the beginning of the small blemishes again by my chin.  So I immediately discontinued using this product.I know that a lot of reviewers love this item and you have no idea how badly I wished I could join them.  Unfortunately my results have been drastically different from theirs and I want to present as honest a review as possible.  It's probably just me, however I would defintely recommend looking at all of the ingredients if you suffer from sensitive skin issues like me.  This was always a reliable brand name, but as for me I will have to take a pass.

As someone who read and enjoyed the first book involving these characters, I have to say that this one was every bit as exciting, engaging and almost impossible to put down.  And although this book can stand on its own as a result of the outstanding background provided by the author, I would strongly recommend reading the first one so that you can fully appreciate this talented writer and these terrific characters.The synopsis is simple enough - a young man is accused of a murder for which he takes full responsibility.  However, the circumstances of this crime are not as obvious as everyone chooses to believe.  And the old saying about "no good deed goes unpunished" comes to mind again and again.  But you're in for a whole bunch of twists & turns along the way.This is a terrific, multi-layered journey that will take the reader from New York to Alaska, Europe, Russia, the Ukraine and back again.  I was never bored or distracted by trivial nonsence or unnecessary fillers. Outstanding story-tellers have become harder and harder to find these days. Orest Stelmach is a master story-teller.My pre-order for the next book is already in place and I am eagerly looking forward to continuing this journey.

A teriffic old time scary haunted house story complete with clueless guests, skanky wife, possible infidelity, things that go bump in the night and the Master himself - Vincent Price. This is just classic, black & white, shivering in the dark perfection.Guests invited to spend the night in a possibly haunted house for money are then terrorized throughout their experience.  But by whom.., or what?It may not be as nasty or clever or gory as movies that have come since then, but sit back and just enjoy a little creepy, old-time fun in the dark.

I really wanted to like this speaker.  It comes complete with international plugs, an a/c wall charger, and two pouches which I assume is one for the unit and one for the accessories.  It is somewhat attractive with a built-in stand that allows you to either place it on its side or in an upright position.With most speakers, once you have paired it with your device (an Iphone 5s, in my case), you should be all done. This is not so with this unit.  The speaker has a spring-loaded slide switch that you push on. It gives you a guitar confirmation tone so that you know that it's working. Now you must go to the "Settings" icon on your device and manually choose the Klipsch speaker. Then you will hear another guitar confirmation tone letting you know that it is paired. You must do this EVERY SINGLE TIME. It is ridiculous. Of course when you turn it off, it will give you yet another guitar confirmation tone.The sound is very good, but the extra step of always having to re-enable the bluetooth connection through "Settings" totally negates anything positive about this speaker.  There is absolutely no reason why my Sony SRSX5 and my JBL Charge automatically pair with my device whenever I turn them on, and yet this one does not. I keep trying to understand why the developers came up with this procedure, but it totally baffles me.I know that other users have complained in the past about charging issues.  Perhaps Klipsch listened to them and fixed this problem because I have not had any difficulties with that.If you're gonna spend money on a good speaker, please look at the Sony SRSX5.  It is an outstanding speaker with logical functions and exceptional sound.

My heading says it all.  This is a really beautiful unit that delivers great sound with a solid bass and clear treble.  I have been using it for 3 weeks and have yet to find one single negative aspect.Once you have paired this unit with your device (Iphone 5S in my case), you're set to go.  You push down on the on/off button on top of the unit and you have connectivity every single time.  It came already charged up but I let it run down so that I could see how long a fresh charge would last.  It lasted almost 1 week of constant usage.The only thing that it does not do is charge up your device.  You will still need to use your USB or a/c adaptor for that purpose.I own the Klipsch GiG as well as a JBL Charge and this speaker blows them both away.  I listen to everything from David Guetta, John Williams, the Grateful Dead, David Benoit, Pharrell to Curtis Mayfield and I can tell you that every single track sounds crisp and clear with a strong bass that does not overpower the artist.  Even MLB broadcasts from Yankee Stadium sound great.It is sleek and sexy and would be welcome anywhere you want to enjoy exceptional sound.

I have owned Defender cases.  I have owned Mobo cases.  This is the best value, protection and presentation I have had in any Iphone case.It has 3 easy to assemble pieces which fit beautfully and perfectly on an Iphone 5s. Again, it is for the Iphone 5s, not the c.  The colors are even more vibrant in person than in the photo - if you can believe that.  The protection is similar in principle to the Otterbox Defender series in that you have a soft cushion cover closest to the phone and then 2 outer plastic pieces which snap together over the cushion and form a barrier in case of a drop. I have small hands and with this case on, my  phone is still easy to hold with almost no bulk whatsoever.  All buttons are covered and easy to use, and there is plenty of open space on the bottom for plugging in a charger.The vendor is terrific in that they provide the full package for your protection. There is a clear transparency to protect the front of your phone, a cloth to keep it clean, and even a stylus if you choose to use it. Absolutely no excuse why your phone can't have total coverage and at an extremely, almost ridiculously low price. And it arrived super fast.  People, this is really a bargain.  In fact, I'm planning on buying another one, just to switch out and get different looks.Please consider this case if you are looking for something that is unique, dependable and inexpensive. I am so happy that I did.

I was skeptical about this shirt because I kept thinking that something this inexpensive was going to be cheaply constructed.  I am happy to report that was about as far from the truth as I could've hoped.This is a beautiful, colorful and well-fitting shirt. It is generous in length and extremely comfortable to wear.  I bought a larger size because it is 100% cotton and I wanted to be prepared for any shrinkage.  But so far I am thrilled with this purchase and cannot recommend it enough. Especially when there are other vendors out there selling Grateful Dead shirts for twice this price.

I really was hoping this product would work out, unfortunately it did not.The capsules are easy to swallow and I followed the recommended guidelines of taking 2 of them approximately two hours before going to bed.  On three different occasions I could feel myself getting a little sleepy and relaxed about an hour after I'd taken them. Unfortunately I did not have a restful night, but more disturbing was the headache I had upon waking up. I don't ever get headaches and so I have to believe that something in this product is not working out as hoped.

Let me begin by saying that I have absolutely no interest in airplanes, their workings or their history.  So why did I get this book?  I was intrigued by the title and its implications.  What an incredible surprise this turned out to be.I kinda thought it was gonna take me through the history of the jet age in America and around the world.  It does and then some.  This book is about the hospitality industry, the gourmet restaurant industry, the publishing industry, the real estate industry and the entertainment industry.  I'm sure I've left out quite a few others, but I'm sure you get the idea.What a terrific author!  This man knows how to weave a story that takes the reader in so many directions that you don't even realize how much information you have just absorbed. This book is very educational, but not like a text book.  You want to read more and, in fact, there are so many different individuals referenced throughout, that I was constantly going to my Iphone and looking up the photos of these icons and others who are now lost to history.  I wanted to know even more about them.  And that is the highest complement I could ever give an author.Yes there is plenty about the evolution of the airplane from war and cargo to transportation of the rich, famous, notorious and the rest of us. But there are also the back stories, the gossip, the juicy details that most books like this leave out.  I don't care how many planes were constructed and who got which contracts - that's boring and you can find that information just about anywhere.  But to hear about the back room deals, out of control egos, and incredible exploits of so many of those titans of the industry and then to splinter out those stories to include hotel magnates,  stars of stage and screen, politicians (of course), mobsters (same thing) and so many other colorful characters - now you've got my undivided attention. I can't recall the last time I had so much fun reading anecdotes to my husband (who is a flight enthusiast) and hearing him say "I didn't know that".This is the kind of book you want to keep around even after you've devoured it from end to end.  You'll find yourself picking it up and re-reading different chapters because there is so much to learn - it'll be like discovering it all over again.  If you can't tell by now - I loved it.  A history buff's delight - with salacious stories and pop culture thrown in for good measure.

I thoroughly enjoyed Rob Lowe's first book so much so that I never hesitated to pre-order this release as soon as it became available.  I'm very glad I did.Neither a fan nor critic of Mr. Lowe's onscreen work, I must say that I am very curious as to whether he has written these books on his own or with the help of another writer. This is only because I find the flow of his words so comfortable, entertaining and very often eloquent, that it seems as though he has wasted time in front of the camera instead of behind the pen.I detest reviewers who insist on practically reproducing the entire book in their rewiews.  This is the job of the reader - not a reviewer.  I would hope that my endorsement or suggestion that you at least try a sample before judging the author would be helpful.  It isn't Tolstoy (thank goodness), but it is a very enjoyable opportunity to share the experiences and observations of another individual.  One who has had some pretty interesting experiences in his life.The only anecdote I will mention involves his time in rehab and the story about Buck - a composite drawn from another person who was a participant in his sessions.  The story of this heartbreaking and tragic individual is so well written that I found myself crying at the end of the chapter.  I never, ever cry at the end of chapters.  And this is why I'm so amazed at the level of writing.  It actually moved me to tears.If you're looking for dirt and garbage about other celebrities or entertainers, than I think you will be very disappointed.  That is the job of TMZ, etc., not a fellow actor.  What Mr. Lowe does is provide you with some glimpses into his profession, his family, his beliefs, success and failures. He does not paint himself in the warm glow of perfection.  He is honest (I hope) and objective about the road he has taken to get where he is today - warts and all (although I have to believe that somewhere in his home there is an aging, horrific portrait taking its toll).This really is a good book.  It is the story of a very lucky man who worked his ass off to make it in one of the hardest professions one could ever attempt employment. He loves what he does, unabashedly worships his family, and is grateful for every day of his life. A winner all the way around.
Great quality tea bags, great price -- easy to use and fold over. Works the same as higher priced ones. No complaints here!

This brush is absolutely wonderful for short to medium length hair. I have fine hair and find that this brush doesn't snag or tangle my hair and leaves it silky smooth. Also helps dry my hair faster with the hair dryer. I use it several times a day and noticed that the top plastic has small hairline cracks, but it has not yet affected the brush performance.

I bought this twin mattress for my 2.5 yr old as a first big bed after much research on organic mattresses. I was so excited and happy that everything was truly organic and there were no chemicals to worry about. The scent of the mattress is light and natural, so that did not bother me at all. Unfortunately, when I had the chance to lie on it for a bit, it was very firm and uncomfortable as I could feel the springs. It is marketed as a children's mattress, but I wanted a mattress to grow with my child, especially when spending $850.I contacted Naturepedic with my concerns and they were nothing short of amazing and accommodating. Because of this, the retailer accepted my return out of the return period ( they were amazingly helpful as well). It killed me to return it because I wanted to love it, but it just wasn't right for me. I would suggest trying the mattress out first before purchasing. (Lesson learned for me, but I tried to do the best for my child.)However, I will and have been a repeat Naturepedic customer. I love their mattress protectors and their pillows. When a company stands behind their product, that is the most important thing, and they get a A+ in my book. Hopefully one of their mattresses works out for you.

I initially ordered the low fill pillow for my toddler as an upgrade to a toddler size pillow. Unfortunately the low fill one was so flat, it was like sleeping without a pillow. I ordered the standard one as a replacement and am very happy with it. It offers enough support and is not that fluffy because of the cotton/kapok filling. I love that it is organic and not harmful. It does have a scent, but it's more of a natural woodsy scent that wears off.Just a side note, the law label does not state "organic". I contacted the manufacturer and they stated that for legal reasons, they cannot write "organic" for bedding. I researched this issue for quite a while to try and get a definitive answer, which I cannot. There are mixed answers everywhere because I think other companies are listing things as "organic" when sometimes they are not. Needless to say, Naturepedic is GOTS certified so I will take their word on it. They are a great company with great customer service as I have personally experienced.

This princess castle decal is huge and gorgeous. Very impressed with the quality and it is the perfect addition to my daughter's princess room!I paired this with the Disney princess decals. Well worth the price. No problems with peeling and sticking it.
These decals are beautiful! They are high quality and easy to stick and move around. So far, they have been sticking to the wall (and a wooden bed) without any issues.

These decals are beautiful! They sparkle, are high quality, and easy to peel and move around. So far, they have been sticking to the wall without any issues. Recommend pairing them with the large RoomMates princess castle decal.
Beautiful valance for a Princess themed room. Bright and vibrant, my daughter and I love it. Quality seems excellent as well.

I usually buy Huggies Pull Ups, but since I have used both Pampers and Huggies regular diapers, I decided to give purchase these.These are absolutely horrendous. I literally opened the box (not even the plastic packaging) and was overwhelmed by the perfumed scent of these diapers (seriously can make you gag). I will not put these on my child and don't understand who would want to use these. Maybe they have changed over time, but why would a toddler need such a scented training pant? I can't even imagine how irritating they are for a little kid!Pampers should put a disclaimer and label this as scented.

Just a few months after the 1 year warranty expired, this steam mop just stopped working. Doesn't heat up. Piece of junk.I called Haan and their customer service was worthless. I was basically told that they do not have a repair center and they cannot recommend any place that CAN repair this. I asked, "Ok, so after the 1 yr warranty is up and it doesn't work, what then? If I can't get it repaired, I am just suppose to throw it out?!?"Silence. "Well, you can purchase a newer model."Yeah right. I will NEVER buy a Haan again. The company does not stand behind their products. Horrible.

This headboard is absolutely beautiful! After searching for several months, I am happy to say that I have found the prefect king headboard at a price below $250! The headboard was delivered within a week by UPS. When you open the box, don't be alarmed about missing pieces. The support beams and hardware are packed behind the back of the headboard flap :-)The quality is impressive. Color is a rich, dark brown. Fabric is very nice and soft. Easy installation and it looks like a headboard from a high-end retailer. Do not hesitate to purchase!

If you have a little chef at home, you must buy this set. The breakfast items are so realistic and just adorable. My 1.5 yr old and 2.5 yr old LOVE them. One loves to cook the pancake in the pan while the other keeps "cracking" the egg to see what's inside (it's a sunnyside up egg) but she also likes to pretend there is a duckling inside. Lol. (No, the duckling is not part of breakfast! :-)Again, this is a well made set and the food items and accessories are just perfect. So happy with this Christmas gift!

This Sofia the First set is SO ADORABLE! The figures are tiny, about 4", but really cute and beautifully dressed. They come with accessories that are very small and choking hazards, so take them away if they are going to be around small children. My 2.5 yr old loves to play with these dolls.
Very sleek and simple. Does what it is intended to do -- hold lids standing up. It makes the area much neater and organized, so i am happy. Probably should be a little less expensive though.

I bought this as a lightning deal for $10 so I cannot complain one bit. It's adorable and fun for toddlers, but I wouldn't pay more than $15 for it. It's a great first "ukulele" introduction for toddlers, but budding musicians might want a better one. The sound is not bad, just OK (as expected).

This Candyland game is so sweet! It's nostalgic and classic, but updated to now have adorable little Disney princesses! My 2.5 yr old wanted to play with the princesses immediately when she saw them, but then I showed her how to play this game. She was so excited to take a card and move the spaces to the color on the card.
This Amber is so beautiful and the perfect size to complement the 10" Sofia. My little Sofia the First fan completely agrees!

I only used organic, all natural diaper rash creams without zinc oxide for my kids, but when a bad diaper rash came along, they were not that effective. Yes, it cleared up in a few days, but then I tried this one -- and it basically clears up overnight. Love the product!

NUK pacifiers have worked the best with both of my babies, when other pacifiers were rejected. (And I spent a lot of money on various brands). They are durable and last a long time..and the ring make is convenient to hold on your finger or use with a pacifier clip. The only thing is that they are sometimes hard to clean. When you use soap and water, it gets inside the nipple. In order to get it out, you have to cup your hand with water while squeezing the nipple. This gets some water inside to wash the soap out. After that, I always throw them in the sanitizer. Not a big deal. I will continue to buy NUKs!

This is a cute, rather inexpensive toy. My 1.5 yr old likes to "take pictures" with it and point to the "puppy". It plays a few songs and says some phrases, but is really not that entertaining. After a minute or two, it's off to another toy.

To make a long story short, I thought I had only one itty bitty mouse that somehow managed to get inside my VERY CLEAN house to escape the cold. He was hiding out by the oven and dishwasher. Spent tons of money on all kinds of traps, nothing worked. Didn't see much "evidence" left behind and thought maybe he died somewhere or ran back outside. Ha...ha...I was wrong.Turns out...there was not one, but quite a few...and they were all hanging out in the GARAGE....eating and living the luxe life in a pile of GRASS SEED!! Ugh, they tore open two bags of GRASS SEED. Who knew they loved grass seed. Note to self, NEVER keep grass seed anywhere in or near the house again.Once their food source was removed, I placed these traps baited with chunky peanut butter... along with electronic ones that cost $20 each, spin traps, and some glue traps. Lo and behold, one by one, these are the traps that worked. Not the others. One even caught two mice. I thought it would be disgusting and that maybe there would be blood from being snapped, but it's a clean catch. Just use gloves and pick up and dispose.I will warn you though that these will NOT catch baby mice. I saw one just sitting on top of this trap, eating the peanut butter. Trap didn't snap. The mouse was too light. So far, I caught 15...yes 15...in a matter of days. Thank goodness they were in the garage.I haven't caught another in a few days, so hopefully they are almost all gone. I am not that naive to think they are all gone. I know there must be one or two hiding out still. Hopefully they will get hungry enough and get caught.Few tips:1 - Find out where they are hiding and WHAT they are eating. Eliminate their food source and make sure everything else you have is sealed in plastic bins. Once you do that, the traps with baited peanut butter will lure them.2 - Or can be #1, find out how they came in. I found a tiny hole that was next to the garage door. They can get in a dime sized hole. Make sure you use steel wool to fill holes or professional sealant. We used the spray foam. Also, check to see where they scurry. Who knew mice can SCALE walls?! Seal up any spaces by pipes that are in your garage and on the ceiling.3 - Put a few traps out in different locations. Keep them near the walls or corners.4 - Try to keep them away. I tried peppermint oil, but I found that these mice dragged a peppermint oil cotton ball to the trap. Hmm..ok...that's NOT supposed to happen. I have a few ultrasonic pest repellents plugged in, but don't really know if it works. They were still around, but maybe it scared them to different areas. Who knows.

These are big, beautifully illustrated books with cute stories. Although it is not suited for my 20 month old without supervision (thin pages can cause paper cuts and sharp edges of the hardcover), she still loves to look at this book with me. Pointing out the ballerinas and dancing, she loves it.

Worth every penny of the $8 for an empty box. I used this for my husband who doesn't fall easily for pranks and is a graphic designer. He has an eye for anything that is "off/fake" and this fooled him. He initially was excited about this fake napsack and appreciated how detailed the box was. He literally was laughing because it was "so cool". Best laughs -- best Christmas present yet. Sturdy box that holds a decent size item. Definitely buy this or the other prank boxes which are just as funny. Great great great!

So far these are working great. Maybe a little too good since it makes it hard for even an adult to open!Not a problem though --  it does exactly what it should. Little hands will have a nearly impossible time trying to squeeze and grip the knob with these to get the door to open. Definitely recommend.

I bought this book because I thought it would be a great go to guide for quick, healthy, easy recipes. Most of the "recipes" involve just mashing and pureeing fruits and veggies. I don't need a recipe book for that. I wasn't impressed in most of the advanced recipes either.However, the one main reason why I returned this book is because the author is CLEARLY misinformed or ignorant. In the front section of the book, the author suggests that CANNED TOMATOES is a great source. How on earth can an "organic" cookbook recommend this. Canned tomatoes is one of the WORST things you can eat, nevermind feed to a baby.Please read two excerpts below from research studies.BPA is a toxic chemical linked to reproductive abnormalities, neurological effects, heightened risk of breast and prostate cancers, diabetes, heart disease and more. To avoid this hazardous chemical, avoid canned foods entirely and stick to fresh fruits and vegetables, or switch over to brands that use glass containers insteadespecially for acidic foods like tomatoes.Experts won't even eat this food.1. Canned TomatoesThe expert: Fredrick vom Saal, PhD, an endocrinologist at the University of Missouri who studies bisphenol-AThe problem: The resin linings of tin cans contain bisphenol-A, a synthetic estrogen that has been linked to ailments ranging from reproductive problems to heart disease, diabetes, and obesity. Unfortunately, acidity (a prominent characteristic of tomatoes) causes BPA to leach into your food. Studies show that the BPA in most people's body exceeds the amount that suppresses sperm production or causes chromosomal damage to the eggs of animals. "You can get 50 mcg of BPA per liter out of a tomato can, and that's a level that is going to impact people, particularly the young," says vom Saal. "I won't go near canned tomatoes."The solution: Choose tomatoes in glass bottles (which do not need resin linings), such as the brands Bionaturae and Coluccio. You can also get several types in Tetra Pak boxes, like Trader Joe's and Pomi.

I agree 100% with the first reviewer. In fact, I was going on to write everything already posted :-)My first concern is that I pre-ordered this book and the description is misleading. It says 0-3 years and I bought it for my 19 month old, thinking that the magnets would be LARGE enough NOT to swallow. Wrong. The book says 3+ years, choking hazard...and Bubble Puppy is a small magnet that can easily fit in a child's mouth.Second, there are only 4 magnets!! If I am paying $8 for a little kiddie book, include the ENTIRE cast of Bubble Guppies!I didn't bother to even try the magnets because I will be returning this. Shame.
